Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with amenities.”
Reviews.Author: tenmylove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Seattle and stayed at the Maxwell for 5 nights. Upon our arrival I felt a little underwhelmed by the location, but my attitude improved the longer we stayed. Location is usually a big factor for me in choosing where to stay and the reviews I had read prior to booking the Maxwell made it seem like it was in a prime location; while the Maxwell is only a 5 minute walk to the Seattle Center (Space Needle, EMP Museum, Pacific Science Center), it’s not as close to the waterfront/downtown area (Pike’s Place, etc.) as I would have liked. We did rent a car but it was next to impossible to find street parking near the waterfront on weekdays and the parking ramps were too costly; therefore, we ended up walking to the downtown area. The walk was a little less than 1.5 miles to downtown so not bad by any means (though, I may have been whistling another tune had it rained while we were there). Overall, the location was good but not great- knowing the price we paid I would’ve expected it to be a little closer to downtown but Seattle is an expensive city so I may have expected more “value” than I got. The hotel was great and I would give it 3.5 stars if I could; the Maxwell is a better than average hotel, but not quite 4 stars considering the price tag. The room was BIGGER than most standard sized hotel rooms and I never once felt cramped. It helped that the big flatscreen was mounted to the wall as that saved a lot of space on the desk. The room had a DVD player, microwave and small refrigerator which were GREAT bonuses that I really appreciated. Most hotels nowadays do not come with a microwave or fridge so I was pleasantly surprised and relieved we didn’t need to pay $2 at the vending machine for a cold soda. The complimentary bottled water and microwave popcorn the hotel provided were also a nice touch. Leave your umbrella at home, the Maxwell provides one. I actually forgot to bring ours and was cursing myself on the plane, so it was nice that it was there waiting in the closet when we arrived (even though we had beautiful weather and never needed it). A few areas the Maxwell could improve: The bathroom was large but lacked privacy. The shower did not have a curtain or door and was completely open; my showers always felt cold even when turning the knob to the hottest degree because of the openness. This would also pose a problem if you are traveling with someone besides a spouse and both were getting ready at the same time. Most hotels offer a privacy curtain/door or have the sink/mirror outside of the bathroom altogether which makes it easy for 2 people to get ready at the same time. The view. We requested a Space Needle view on a higher floor (Maxwell is only 5 stories tall). We were situated on the 2nd floor and had a view of some apartments, Thai Heaven across the street and a parking garage. Yay? We were disappointed to say the least. We arrived our first night late and hadn’t eaten and that was my first priority so by the time my husband called for a different room they only had one available on the 2nd floor with a “partial Space Needle” view and a Queen bed. We have a King bed at home and I wasn’t particularly crazy about downgrading to a Queen for 5 nights, so we stayed put. The view was less than desirable and I think we were mainly disappointed because we had specifically asked for a room with a view. We’ve never encountered unaccomodation over a simple request we’ve made; most hotels will gladly oblige, especially when the majority of the population never asks to begin with. Parking. The parking garage the Maxwell has is a bit of a joke. To preface, the parking is FREE whereas it’s not free at a lot of hotels (however, most hotels that charge a fee for parking are also located downtown). Their parking garage has mostly “compact” stalls (more compact stalls than regular stalls) and most cars took up 2 parking spaces because they could not fit in these tiny stalls; keep in mind that the cars that were overflowing into a 2nd stall were not big by any means. We usually parked outside in the “10 minute” parking space as the front desk said this was acceptable. This saved us a headache most of the time. I did workout in the fitness center as did my husband. He liked it, I did not. It was really small. Luckily, there was never anyone else there and if there had been I might’ve left because it was just too small of a space for multiple people to share. The elliptical machine was an older model and wasn’t as nice as what I’m used to but I guess that’s okay for a hotel. There was a large flatscreen TV on the wall which was nice at least. Would I stay at the Maxwell again? I would. I really liked the quaint Queen Anne neighborhood, it was nice to be close to the Space Needle; Kerry Park was not far away either (a few blocks up a steep hill). I felt safe and most everything was within walking distance. On days when you just don’t feel like walking several miles (or uphill!) the hotel offers a shuttle service within a 3 mile radius. The room itself was BETTER than average, but the other factors docked the rating down a bit. Overall, it was a nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Classy yet quirky with weird acoustics”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: The pineapple themed Maxwell is very modern with eclectic decor. The finishings are all very trendy and the use of space makes the guest rooms seem larger than they are. The only issue I had was the spooky wind noise that kept us awake most of the night. It was insanely loud and seemed to be oming from inside the hotel as opposed to outside. I can only imagine how scary it would be for a child to wake up to these noises... It was truly unnerving. The location (lower Queen Anne) is a bit far from the downtown core, though still very close to the space needle and Seattle Center. The pool is quite warm , though rather small with a max depth of 4ft. There is no hot tub. The work out room looked pretty standard. You can usually book the Maxwell for under $100 using the hotel tonight app, and at that rate it is an excellent deal!

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel was fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: Everything was gorgeous. The service was fantastic. The beds and pillows were so wonderful after the long days of walking all over beautiful Seattle. The location was perfect, it was nice to be SO close to all the fun stuff downtown but having a little distance from the noise was a welcome aspect. The hotel restaurant/bar was so convenient but there is also two grocery stores close by. I can't say enough good things about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: milliebest
Reviews.Content: The hotel's artistic design and furnishings were so cheerful. The bathroom was one of the best I have ever had. The shower was spacious and great water pressure. The hair dryer was state of the art. Coffee maker with real cream was great. Bed and linens were wonderful. Although the monorail which brings you right to the heart of the city is a short walk, the hotel offers a free shuttle service which was wonderful. Nearby are some great places for breakfast (Pesos and Toulouse Petite Restaurant). The Rock (bar) is a nice place for a drink and a light snack.The staff was so helpful. We really enjoyed our stay and would certainly go back if we ever return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lulubell01
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel five stars, were it not for the fact that it can get a little noisy due to the un-carpeted floors and slamming doors in the hallways. But let me tell you, this place has perks that made up for it. The mattresses and pillows were SO COMFY. Keurig coffeemakers in the rooms, real creamer, not the powder stuff, raw sugar. Golf umbrellas hanging in the closet...we used those every day. Fluffy towels and lots of them. Huge flat screen tv. Room service pizza from The Rock on-site (not great pizza, but it was very convenient and they'll bill your room). A free shuttle that took us downtown and would have picked us up too, if we had wanted. Pet friendly, and not just lap dogs under 25 pounds either, they will allow big dogs, which I have, so that made me happy. Also, the room was spotless. Staff was very accommodating. Walking distance to lots of restaurants, the Metropolitan Market, etc. I parked my vehicle in their free onsite parking and walked everywhere the entire time I was there. Just a great place to stay, and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel right next to space needle and short walk to monorail station. Rooms are enormous.”
Reviews.Author: Sosuma
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, offering large clean and modern rooms in a quiet location. The hotel isn't right in the centre of Seattle but the monorail is a 5 min walk away and there is a supermarket close by also along with the Space needle and music museum( can't remember the exact name). You can walk to the main shopping district and pike place market if you don't mind a 25 minute walk or so. There is a big and busy affordable restaurant downstairs. Nice little touches like a microwave in the room and popcorn to enjoy your big screen tv with. Overall a great place to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: hungrybeagle
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel was lovely in every way. My 12 year old daughter and I spent 3 nights here. The location is perfect - we had no need for a car and felt perfectly safe walking around in the evening. We appreciated little details like popcorn in the room for late night movie-watching, a small shelf in the entry-way of the room perfect for housing the room key, and free friendly shuttle service to the light rail station on the day of our departure. The decor has personality, the rooms are spotless, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable - and the hotel is within easy walking distance of Toulouse Petit - easily the BEST restaurant breakfast I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: nfdrew
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Seattle in early March and stayed at the Maxwell Hotel right near the Space Needle. The staff was excellent, from the front desk to the friendly shuttle drivers, we could not have been in better hands. The on site restaurant, the Rock is very good for pizza/apps and the staff there is also eager to please. Rooms at the hotel are very clean/modern. The WiFi was touch and go while we were there, the manager responded to a review I left of the hotel and commented that they were actually fixing the router on the floor. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: T P
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The front desk staff was super helpful. Excellent hospitality! Rooms were clean, modern and stylish. View of spaceneedle was nice, though the powerlines right outside our window were a bit hard to overlook. Pool is really small, though never busy so it was completely fine with out three kids. Water was warmer than most hotel pools. High level of security. Need pass to get in and out of parking garage and to access hotel room floors. Unlike most hotels in downtown Seattle, this was not a decaying building trying to be more than it is. HVAC was super quiet. Location is about a 10 minute walk away from the Spaceneedle, if you are walking with young children. Easy access to the monorail, and the hotel has a free shuttle to take you anywhere in downtown. Neighbourhood is nice, didn't feel at all uneasy walking around after dark. Would have given a full 5 stars but our window made a wierd whooshing noise as it wasn't sealed properly. Made the street noise a bit loud at times. I didn't feel it was a huge problem so we didn't complain until we left and were assured that it would be looked after. Not at all worried about having a problem like that the next time we go. It's for sure our hotel to stay at in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, friendly, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Betsy1612
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in March. The rooms are comfortable, very spacious, and decorated in a fun, bright way - not your usual blah hotel room colors and fabrics. There's even an ottoman for the armchair.They are also really well-designed. The bathrooms have extra shelving for storing toiletries, etc. There is a wall-mounted shelf in the bedroom next to the full-length mirror with an electrical outlet under it. Very handy if one of you wants to, say, dry your hair and put on make-up while your other half is taking his time in the shower. Each room provides a safe and an umbrella, but no bathrobes. The staff was great - very friendly and helpful. I missed having breakfast available in the hotel. Sometimes, you just want to be able to walk downstairs to eat breakfast. When asked to complete a survey from the hotel regarding my stay, I complied and got an immediate response from the hotel manager thanking me for the review and addressing a couple of my comments. I really appreciated knowing that the hotel sees and reads the reviews and that they take the time to reply to their guests. Nice touch. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here when I visit Seattle from now on...”
Reviews.Author: Pokee
Reviews.Content: This was just a fabulous hotel! When we checked in at around 2pm, our room wasn't ready yet, so they offered us a complimentary upgrade to a suite room (with a pull-out couch). Highly recommended - but I think most of these are on the 'view' side (street side) which can be noisy and disruptive if you are a light sleeper. My kids gasped with impressed awe when we opened the door. The decor was so bright and unique. What a real treat! The beds were awesome, as was the pull out couch. The TV was great, the fridge and microwave AND the Kureg coffee machine all got good use. The bathroom was clean and HUGE. It was a strange set-up (if the door is open, you can see the person sitting on the toilet - yeah, so just close the door, right?!) and there's 3 different lights in there (a main light, a shower light and a makeup light). Great Tommy Bahama shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, hand soap and lotion dispensers! Neat idea to save the bottles, but too bad you can't bring them home with you! The laminate floors were fine. Sure, a little noisier than normal, but clean. Small ironing board, but never used it. Safe and umbrella provided in the small closet. Loved the lobby and coffee/cupcake time. I drank so much coffee at this place. Ate at the Rock twice. LOVED this place. Great pizza, bear and lots of options for kids. LOVED the location. Soooo close to Seattle Center (5-10 mins to the monorail for downtown access). Close to the QFC supermarket for food to stock the fridge. Close to the I-5 and I99 for fast trips to/from the hotel. Also, FREE parking underground. LOTS of parking - I don't think you'd have a problem most times. It was wide open when we were there, but it was mid-week in spring, so I am not sure what popular weekends would be like. They also have a shuttle that takes you downtown. We used it once - and they even had a booster seat for our 6-year-old. Here's what I didn't like: - The pool was too small, but hey - at least the have one, so that's okay I guess! - No breakfast included, but hey - at least they have a little breakfast bar in the lobby that sells pastries and Starbucks in the AM. - Noisy (but that was the View side of the hotel - and the view isn't really all that great). The staff were great, the restaurant staff were AMAZING, and the facilities were really top notch. I felt safe in the area and was able to get easy access to this place (despite some construction in the area, too), so I was thrilled. Got my 3rd night free - too! Very affordable. The cleaning staff bugged us early (before 10am one morning and before 9am another morning), so be sure to put up your 'Do not disturb' cards on the door!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and convenience at the Maxwell”
Reviews.Author: Budgetwisegal
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel was a great base for our recent visit to Seattle. The teens in our group enjoyed the decor and the afternoon cupcakes; we all enjoyed the comfy beds, spacious rooms, and convenient location near the Space Needle and monorail. I especially liked the wood floors - seems so much cleaner than the usual hotel rugs. Also I was glad we didn't book a hotel right downtown as it was St. Patricks celebrations and it probably would've been quite noisy downtown. We will look forward to returning to the Maxwell's hospitality and funky decor!

Reviews.Title: “we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: wkabean
Reviews.Content: We booked one day and stayed 3 at the Maxwell because they had a good pet policy and we wanted the downtown location. We were not disappointed, they accommodated our pet with a big pillow, dish, treats and bags for scooping. They have hardwood floors and put us in an area of the hotel which we were able to quickly leave the hotel to do a walk with suggestions of where we could take our pet. Our king room felt spacious and had a very good bathroom with large size personal products, mini fridge and large flat screen tv. The location is great and you can easily find places to eat within walking distance. They also had included parking which was another BIG plus. The Keurig coffee machine and the pineapple cupcakes all add another personal touch. We will definitely stay there again and hope it remains as good as this last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl H
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. We're locals and wanted to roll out of bed and to the start line for a St Pat's Day run the next morning. Mission accomplished! Room was immaculate, with an eclectic, bright decor, and well-designed for the modern, connected traveller (free wifi, wired connections throughout room, plenty of outlets). Our only gripe: the sheets were obviously synthetic and felt like a mix of paper and plastic... I'd happily pay more for better sheets! Also, the shower, while promising (large, walk in), had a disappointing, immovable showerhead. This might be a reflection of water pressure/conservation ratios, but I've seen better. Another miss is the lack of proper breakfast availability - but then, this is Lower Queen Anne, so you don't have to travel far for that. Having a "Rock" on the property is a good move, for those who like good/gooey pizzas (and classic rock)! Free, secure parking in basement of the hotel, with easy access to the property via elevator. Overall, great addition of a modern, clean, and reasonably-priced hotel in the LQA/Seattle Center area.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Pineapple Cupcakes in the Lobby!”
Reviews.Author: flstorms
Reviews.Content: Nice location with easy access to everything by foot or by car. I was most intrigued by their unique mini pineapple cupcakes that welcomed you in the lobby. They were a whimsical way to reinforce their brand. The bathroom was my favorite - spacious and sleek. The rooms were very clean and the bed was full of pillows you could sink into, prop your feet on or just squish as you sleep the night away. I'll say we didn't spend much time here but we used it as our book end for our trip from Seattle, to Victoria, to Vancouver and back to Seattle. We were easily able to walk from here to the Space Needle, Pike Place, the piers and even uphill to Queen Anne. I will say, their reservations process was not as smooth as the stay - my friend experienced multiple charges and phone calls required to correct it. However, they did correct it and our stay was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and efficient!!!”
Reviews.Author: Babs3124
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Beautiful laminate wood floors so no carpet to cause me to ponder what might be in there!! Smart layout including dispensers so no small bottles taking up space and creating trash. Keurig coffee machine, produces waste but no more than others and so efficient for guests. King room was large and comfortable, free wi-fi which should be a basic for all hotels. Staff personable and helpful with free shuttle around the city. Nice walk to the markets. Not high-end posh but highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in fun neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: dumb_screen_name
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very much what the other reviews say. It is trendy, friendly and comfortable. The rooms are quite large with good amenities like a mini-fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, and flat screen tv. I was particularly happy there there was a great local brewpub called McMenamins right next door. There are also many other nice neighborhood restaurants in close walking distance. A little further away (about 2 miles) in the Fremont neighborhood are even more hip bars, restaurants, and boutique shops. Don't miss the Theo Chocolate factory.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacas911
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a sat for a friends b day party.Free parking!! Very clean with fun decor.Lots of places to eat within walking distance.Everybody at the hotel were very friendly in person and on the phone.Love the shower and Tommy Bahamma s/p ,cond, body wash.Very comfortable bed, nice floors.The microwave and popcorn were a fun extra .We are staying here again in two weeks while we catch a dinner show at Teatro .This is such a great hotel for the $.Great rates.We hope to take out the complimentary bikes

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: EricaPCB
Reviews.Content: Even though it was during the off season, we had the best time. The hotel seems brand new and all the employees are very helpful. The man that checked us in (I believe his name was Brian) gave us great tips on where to eat in the area and helped us all week long. There are a lot of great restaurants in the area and we enjoyed walking to the metropolitan market for snacks to keep in our room during our stay. Don't bother bringing your toiletries, they have wonderful smelling shampoo, conditioner, and body wash dispensers in the bathrooms! It seems their anemities are endless, we were leaving to go on a walk and the same man at the front desk handed us umbrellas because there was a slight drizzle. They also have a shuttle that was available immediatly at our request several times, which saved us money on taxi rides. If I could have changed one thing about our stay, it would be softer sheets. Overall, I feel we could not have picked a better place for our first Seattle trip! I have a feeling there will be many more to come, and The Maxwell Hotel will be our go-to getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Value”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an overnight trip to Seattle with my wife. Great experience with excellent staff and accommodations. Nicely appointed room (Aria King) that was spotless! Very comfortable bed with good quality linens. Bathroom had a walk-in open shower with soap & shampoo dispensers of good quality. The bar off the lobby provided great service and beverages... John was the bartender/server on duty and he was awesome. Great stay at a Hotel with a perfect location for enjoying Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel at a 2 Star price”
Reviews.Author: Agentpalmer
Reviews.Content: We live in the midwest and took the Amtrak train to Seattle. In searching for a hotel we were big into reading reviews and the Maxwell Hotel ranked #8 out of 108 hotels in Seattle. We are not sure why. As far as we were concerned this hotel should be #1. It was beautiful, very clean and net, great security, everything looked brand new. The staff was unbelievably accomodating and each day asked us how things were going and what we had been doing. Hotel is located just two blocks from the Space Needle, Science Museum, ballet, etc. Fabulous location so we could walk. Then they had shuttle to Pikes Market and would have taken us anywhere we pretty much wanted to go I think. Don't waste your time scouting hotels in Seattle. I promise you that if you stay here....You will be pleasantly surprised. Kudos to the staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: jslatch
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel at a reasonable price in a great neighborhood. Well appointed, nice service, free wifi, free parking (!), and best of all for me, free local shuttle service (technically within 3 miles, but they took me farther than that). I stayed with some girlfriends. Loved it! Pool & fitness room are both tiny but in fine shape.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, fun hotel!”
Reviews.Author: novamom_10
Reviews.Content: I love staying here. It's a great size (not too big, not too small), great location, extremely friendly and helpful staff, and best of all, things like bottled water, the newspaper, and wi-fi are all FREE. Will stay here whenever I'm in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: BIGDNevada
Reviews.Content: My Wife found this Gem for us to celebarate our 25th. The Maxwell sits with-in 3 blocks of the Space Needle, Science Museum, EMP and the Key arena.The staff was Excellent and the rooms were clean, comfortable and came with the ammenities that you may have forgotten. Getting to Downtown was simple, thanks to Justin (frontdesk) and Craig (shuttle). The restaurant "ROCK" in the Maxwell, was also a pleasant surprise. Hopping with great food and Classic Rock. Neighborhood was very peaceful and clean. Will definetly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: strawberryroan
Reviews.Content: We were only here a couple of nights, but our room was very nice, extremely comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful as we walked in the Queen Anne area. It is so convenient to downtown that we would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and better location”
Reviews.Author: num1sinner
Reviews.Content: Went to see a concert in Seattle and wanted something close to Key Arena. Found this place and it was within walking distance from many attractions and restaurants. There was no need for car rental because the train goes into downtown and then there is a monorail that is two blocks away from hotel. Cupcakes upon arrival were nice. The place was also very quite. Room was nicely sized. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: emailwolf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 10 days and it was a very enjoable and pleasant stay. The rooms are large, spotlessly clean and the service staff was at any time very helpful and went the extra mile to make me a happy customer (e.g. I forgot my mobile phone charger and they organised one that I could borrow for no extra costs). WiFi connection is not the fastest in the upper floors (I stayed in room 510 on the 5th floor) but unless you need to upload vast amounts of data it still works fine. The only one thing that I did not like so much was that someone must have tried my make up (there was a big finger mark in my make up box but I always use a brush!). The hotel does not serve breakfast but there are multiple cafes within 2 min walking distance - I can recommend the Citizen and also Cafe Mekka. There are also 2 large 24/7 supermarkets very close to the hotel, where you get everything (my hotel room did have a microwave). In the same building there is a restaurant named The Rock. I was never there but it was always packed with people, which I consider a good sign. Around the corner are some nice Asian places (Thai and Vietnamese) as well as two Sushi restaurants. The hotel is nicely located in the Queen Ann district, which is a nice neighborhood as such but there are also many buses driving downtown regularly, I never had to wait for more than 2 min. The Capitol Hill district, which is home to many music bars, looks a bit far away from here, but is reachable in 10 min. by bus. A taxi from there back to the hotel at night was less than 10 bucks. So, altogether I can absolutely recommend this place and should I visit Seattle any time again I will certainly chose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: ashandjb1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Maxwell Hotel. The front desk was SO helpful with giving us ideas of where to visit in Seattle as well as arranging transport for us to the airport. The hotel had a great feel about it, groovy, clean and very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who was staying in Seattle. The position may deter people as not in the centre of the city, but it is opposite the space needle and the monorail, plus a taxi to the farmers market for example, was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: rdumsp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maxwell while I was in town for a convention. I cannot say enough good things about it - and, in fact, can't think of anything negative to stay at all. I felt as though we'd gone back in time to an era when customer service was paramount and the guest's comfort and convenience were priorities. Everything was set up to make our stay as seamless and enjoyable as possible. We were offered free parking and use of the free shuttle to complement our use of the monorail, so getting downtown was quick and easy. Because I was in town for business, I needed to do a lot of printing. Not only were there multiple computers and printers available for our use, but the staff declined to charge us for using them. The front desk staff was exceptional (one example of their great service: after we'd been in our room for about 15 minutes, they called to ask if we were happy with everything and/or needed anything else). We even had contact lenses delivered to the hotel which were waiting at the front desk when we checked in. Our room was large, spotless, and very comfortable, the housekeeping and maintenance staff were helpful and kind, and we had a great view of the Space Needle. We enjoyed the restaurant and coffee shop in the hotel, which were especially nice options when we were pressed for time. We loved Seattle, plan to go back, and will certainly stay at the Maxwell again!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean, beautiful, comfortable and in a stellar location, what more could you ask for?! It's a hop and a skip to just about anywhere you could want to visit and with a room on the 3rd floor facing South my husband and I have a beautiful view of the Space Needle. Well worth the price (which really isnt bad to begin with) if you're looking for something a little more special than "adequate" accommodations. Oh, and the restaurant downstairs isn't just a hotel bar, it's a local chain and brewery. Tried the beer sampler and they're all quite delicious. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: EngRich
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to seattle center, nice grocery store, lots of restaurants, walkable to Pikes market. Very stylish accomodations. reasonable price. friendly helpful staff. favorite place to stay in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pete M
Reviews.Content: I live in Seattle so I haven't officially stayed here but my family has when they have come to town to visit. This is a nice modern, clean hotel. The free parking is a rarity, something that can easily cost $25+/day at a downtown hotel. It is also near the Space Needle and lower Queen Anne for easy access to food, bars, etc. I would go for a room without a view of the Space Needle as it is quieter on the back side, off the large one way street in front of the hotel. Plus, these rooms are cheaper:)

Reviews.Title: “First time at the Maxwell, but will come again.”
Reviews.Author: gerge07
Reviews.Content: My wife, dog & I stayed at the Maxwell. I can not say enough good things about it. They treated all of us exceptionally. The room was great - very large, as was the bed. There was a bed for the dog, as well as dog dishes. Dog treats at the desk. Coffee at the front area at night. Free newspaper at the door each day. Very close to the Space Needle. Great price for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: silver2lining
Reviews.Content: With free parking and free shuttle to downtown, it makes it very convenient for families with little one. All of the staff were friendly and gave us excellent recommendations as to where to go and dine. We would definitely stay here again if we visited the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel is very nice. Rooms have modern decor and comfortable furnishings. Very good pod coffee makers in the rooms. Nice bar / restaurant in the lobby. The service was extremely friendly and efficient, as good as I've had anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: benFlys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for one night and I wish I could have stayed longer! Upon arrival, we were given complimentary parking in the garage that is directly under the hotel. The front desk handled check-in quickly and were helpful in helping plan out a walking tour of the area. The room was comfortable and had a nice retro theme. There were nice touches like coffee and cupcakes in the lobby. The location suited us well and after we parked, we were able to walk to local shops, sites, and bars and restaurants -- no extra driving needed. For the price (slightly better than other well-reviewed properties in the area), I was extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: lotsoflife
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a great hotel, and so reasonably priced. Everything was very clean, and well appointed. The faux hardwood floors are so much better than carpet. My only complaint is rather odd, they have the noisiest sheets! I've never experienced sheets that made noise when you turn over, my husband thought the same. Otherwise, the bed was very comfy. The Rock restaurant in the lobby has excellent pizza. The hotel is nicely located in lower Queen Anne. The free parking in their secure garage was a real plus. It was easy to get where we wanted to go in the car, and by cab (just a few minutes to get downtown via cab if you didn't want to worry about parking downtown). Efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ronco336
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maxwell for four nights a few days before Christmas. This two year old hotel is only two blocks from the Space needle. The rooms were very clean and good size. The bathroom and shower were extra large, and we had an exceptional view of the Space Needle from our window. The only drawback was a lack of a bar or restaurant in the hotel for those late night dinners or nightcaps and breakfast. A newly built upscale pizza establishment on the corner and connected to the hotel was to open in January 1, 2012. There is also a great Irish Pub across the street no more than 50 yards out the front door of the hotel. We decided to get tickets for the Nutcracker Ballet at McGraw Hall which was only one block out the hotels front door. Upon request, the hotel shuttle (free) would take us downtown or pick us up when we called to return. I could go on, but simply said, "We'll be back."

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: dcvancouverbc
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel in Seattle is beautiful. We stayed at the end of September 2011. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful. The room was lovely, clean, spacious, and the complementary coffee was just the right thing to start the morning off. We found the Maxwell Hotel on a travel website and chose it because we were getting a good deal, and they offered free parking!! The free parking was actually the decision maker for us when other hotels in the same price range were charging $25/day or more. The hotel was a 7-10 minute walk to the Experience Music Project, the Science Centre, the Space Needle, and The Monorail which will take you downtown for only a few dollars. Be sure to check out Pike Place Market if you've never been. Our only complaint was that there is no restaurant in the hotel... but the rooms come with a mini-fridge and there are a few places in the area to eat at as well as a grocery store a block or so away. The Melting Pot fondue restaurant is only a few blocks away and nice to try for something different. Our overall experience at the Maxwell was lovely... we will definitively be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Jessace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell based on many reviews here on T.A. Originally we were going to take our dogs, but, as were are crossing the border and neither had updated Rabies shots, we did not. However, will in the future with or without them! I have nothing bad to say about the Maxwell. Rooms were very clean and very up to date. Not the "drap" chain hotel motife. Although we did not have a spectacular view, we did not need it. The room had two queen bedsm wood floors, Kurig coffee maker and DVD player and large TV. The shower was also cool. It was tiled and open with no curtain. Very unique. You can see by others photos that are posted what a nice room this is. There is a restaurant in the hotel that just opened called The Rock. They serve the best Pizza and pasta along with a good variety of appies. And lots of craft beer! The space needle, science centre and loads of other tourist options are within walking distance or very close by. There is also a excellent Thai restaurant called Bahn Thai just a minute away and a cool grocery store. So, you can stay at your Holiday Inn or stay here...you wont be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Spread the GOOD word about the Maxwell”
Reviews.Author: Robachev
Reviews.Content: First of all this is a NEW hotel (2011). Not a remodel. Look on google maps and you will see the construction! We spent 4 nights at the Maxwell and appreciated every moment. We brought our bulldog and found a dog bed and bowls for him upon arrival in the room. The room had a Kureig coffee maker in the room, pods of coffee & tea- with real cream in the fridge. I will agree that parking can be tight as some jerky guests take 2 stalls.Don't forget they do not charge for parking- how do you complain about free parking? We were parked inside every night except New Years Eve, as we came back to hotel at 10 PM. We still recieved parking within the hotel car entry arrival area. Beds and pillows were incredibly comfortable, nice TV, and no problems with wireless. Shower- no tub. Yes, the elevators are towards one end, but so what. There are stairs that are equally quick. Some reviewers made it sound rooms too far from elevator- it is not so far. We were on 2nd floor and could see the Space Needle. If you are obsessed with a view I would suggest get a higher floor. Better yet, go outside and walk across the street to the Needle! Restaurant within hotel now open. Walk 2 blocks east to the QFC grocery ( Thai restaurants along the way) or go west 4 blocks to numerous great places along Queen Anne (McDonalds, KFC to pizza to Thai, Viet, Italian, Dicks Burgers). For the last number of years we have stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on Aurora. I strongly feel the Maxwell is our new Seattle destination. Pet Friendly, free parking, restaurants & grocery within walking distance? PLEASE don't tell anyone of this place. Too nice to share!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy comfortable rooms with good location”
Reviews.Author: FoodiesX2
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in three adjacent rooms over the Christmas holiday. All were quite pleased with the size and condition of the room. Very clean and comfortable. Never bathe in a hotel so we didn't miss the tub as the shower was also spacious. The only thing we used that was small was the parking area which was a challenge for the minivan we used. Thank goodness it was free. The fridge and microwave came in handy and the complimentary water and keurig coffee and tea were a nice touch. Loved the produce at the nearby Metropolitan market and the Thai restaurant across the street and down the block was quite good. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “love it!”
Reviews.Author: njpk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November for a business trip. It was all that and more. The room was really nice. Very modern and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is great for nice relaxing walks to the Space Needle as well as the Public Market Center. Why can't all hotels be this nice?

Reviews.Title: “Nifty hotel and a great value to boot!”
Reviews.Author: mer4cal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over New Years with my husband and five year old daughter. We had a great time at the Maxwell. It was very easy to get to and has a convenient location near the Space Needle. The room itself was very stylish and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom only had a shower, but it was a nice shower and did not bother me. We all enjoyed the in room Keurig coffee maker and daily water and popcorn. The refrigerator was also nice (there are two nice markets within walking distance). There is a small fitness room and a small indoor pool. My daughter loved the pool and it was a nice addition. Every afternoon there was coffee and mini pineapple cupcakes in the lobby. They were a nice treat to come back to. The only downsides that we noticed was that the parking lot is small and it is sometimes hard to get a spot in the late evening. There is plentiful street parking in the neighborhood and we always managed to get a spot on the hotel property. There was also not great padding between our room and the floor above. The people upstairs were loud and woke me up at 1 to 2 in the morning moving around alot. We did not have any problems with floor noise or noise from the people on the sides of us. Overall it was a great little hotel. My daughter is already asking when we are going to to go back to the Pineapple Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: roadtripperVancouver
Reviews.Content: Located in a nice neighbourhood with alot of things within walking distance. The room was a good size and nicely laid out. The walk in shower was comfortable and everything was clean. Staff was friendly. The free parking was a perk as I'm used to paying $30+ for parking at hotels in Seattle. They were just about to open a restaurant when we where there and this would definitely be a plus as it is nice not to have to go to far for breakfast. However, if you do go out for breakfast make it Toulouse Petit! I would stay again. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: cstocker
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and the front desk checked us in with no problem. The hotel is very modern as well as the room. As we walked to our room on the fourth floor, all of the housemaid staff spoke as well a maintenance worker. Very friendly staff during our whole time there. Our room had two queen beds, spacious bathroom, hardwood throughout the room, and a Keurig Brewer. The hotel has a shuttle that can take you to different locations within the downtown area as well as the nearest train station. The shuttle driver was super nice. Thanks for driving us to the train station so we could get to the airport in time. Finally we had dinner at the hotel restaurant "The Rock". The pizza was better than good.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about Seattle”
Reviews.Author: WTGZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the Queen Anne neighbourhood and we loved that it was a little removed from the touristy hubs but close enough to the Space Needle area for nice lovely walks to there. Great amenities in the neighbourhood. Loved the 24 hr metropolitan market and pharmacy a few blocks away. Not to mention the lovely restaurants around. The hotel was comfy and chic. Great value for money considering the shuttle service they provide. The staff looked startled when we enter and I have to say on first sight they are not what you would call friendly but they were efficient and helpful. Perhaps it's just a bit of shyness. On the whole we really enjoyed our stay. The gym was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: T D
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Maxwell. (so I guess I like it). The facility is fantastic. It has a boutique feel, and is very quiet and comfortable. The staff are professional and friendly, even under stress. There were issues with the electronic key system and with parking the night we arrived. Despite the rudeness and impatience of some guests, the front desk staff remained calm and handled the situation well. Unsure about the new, loud restaurant off the lobby, but it seems to have patrons most of the time. Would also recommend trying Asian Breeze down the street from the hotel, it is a beautiful setting with great food and they will make food to order (vegan, vegetarian, etc.) The Maxwell is a good deal in Seattle. Free parking and wifi. A short brisk walk (20 min) will take you most central destinations. Only downside is that the wifi does not seem to function very well. In our room on the fourth floor it only worked if we stood and leaned on the door to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near Queen Anne”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe059
Reviews.Content: The hip modern design is fun but the hotel could pay more attention to details. For example, there is no comfortable reading chair with good light. The dark wood floors have a European feel and the shower is large and easy to use. We had to have the keys redone at the main desk but other than that, everything was O.K. We didn't use the pool or the fitness center but they looked nice. I enjoyed having an espresso in the large lobby with the dramatic curving ramp. The location is good for Queen Anne hill and the value is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JVandy33
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18 year old son and I stay at the Maxwell Hotel for 5 nights in September 2011. Our stay was excellent in all respects. Arrival and check in went smoothly and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. They provided information about the neighborhood, places to eat, and getting around Seattle. Our room was large, very clean, nicely decorated in modern theme, and oh-so-comfortable! The beds were divine. I liked the hard wood floors and the large room fit our needs well. The location was perfect for us and the free parking a fabulous perk. My son appreciated the other perks: complimentary water bottles, popcorn, coffee/cream, and cupcakes. Bathroom was large, clean and good water pressure and temperature. Lots of soft towels. My son visited U of W while were were there and the front desk arranged the visit and gave us a complimentary parking pass at a sister property on campus. Nice. My son used the pool and it was fine. No restaurant or bar in the hotel but many nice little places to eat and drink within a few short steps from the lobby. Great value. One of the best hotels for the money that I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller27
Reviews.Content: Very large rooms and bathrooms with hip, modern decor. My room faced the street and I was worried about it being noisy but I slept soundly. The pineapple cupcakes in the lobby were a nice and homey touch!

Reviews.Title: “great sized room for family of 4”
Reviews.Author: 521s13
Reviews.Content: We come to Seattle often as our daughter goes to the U of W. We have often rented a condo for the convenience of having a larger space and kitchen but like the ease of a hotel. The Maxwell is a perfect combination of both. The double sized rooms are huge! More than enough space to have 4 adults stay comfortably. The location and free parking are also perfect for getting to downtown or the University district although current construction of the nearby roads can create some headaches. The neighborhood is also great and there is a nearby large grocery store that is unique and provides all necessities. The work out room and pool area is small but sufficient. Have stayed here twice and will again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Couldn't Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Dskip
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Maxwell on business four nights in October 2011 after reading good reviews. I was very impressed with the room (spacious, frig, microwave, and clean). i was amused that another reviewer complained about the short cord on the hair dryer, however, I discovered the cord is retractable and plenty long. Staff were the most friendly and courteous of any place that I have ever stayed. I loved the location which was a short walk to a monorail that takes you close to the wharf that has tons of neat shops. Airport shuttle service convenient and very reasonable. You will not find anything nearly as nice in the same price range. When I return to Seattle, this is only hotel that I intend to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: flaymingyon
Reviews.Content: We utilized the advanced reservation savings deal and felt the price was a great one for the the city. The parking garage below the hotel was so convenient. Knew we weren't going to get a view of the Space Needle, but did have a nice city view. Roy St. is a bit noisy and our window was sprung a bit near the handle so more noise was able to enter. No hallway nor neighbor noise! Very trendy room design with the curved wall, wood floors, and interesting lighting. The open shower felt cold as the warm air escapes easily. The ironing board is a small tabletop one that is difficult to use. Comfy bed, great sheets and towels. Free internet. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Luxury at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: ast66
Reviews.Content: Hands down, this hotel exceeded my expectations! For a first visit to the pacific northwest, the Maxwell understands the essence of what it means to create the ultimate customer experience. We were greeted warmly by the staff at the front desk and they even allowed us to check in early. The lobby is spacious and elegantly decorated. The room was amazing. From the cozy bed to the sleek decor to the large shower, all our senses were engaged. We had time to use the pool and gym, although they were on the smaller side they were clean spaces which is always nice! My spouse and I are planning to take another trip to Seattle and we will be repeat customers. Thank you Maxwell for an amazing stay and intro to your beautiful state!

Reviews.Title: “lucky find”
Reviews.Author: Dolores C
Reviews.Content: I found this motel online when I needed a place to stay near Key Arena in Seattle for a music festival. From the free parking to the efficient check in, my first impressions were favorable. Add to this clean, spacious rooms with nice decor and the conveniences of a refrierator, microwave, room safe, hair dryer, even a large screen tv (which I didn't have time to use...) also included complimentary Tully's coffee, microwave popcorn and tea. The bed was comfortable and another offering I didn't have time to use included an indoor pool...maybe next time. The biggest advantage for me besides the free parking was the fact that this hotel is in the nice Queen Anne district within walking distance of Kay Arena and other town center venues and art galleries and shops. I also liked the relatively late checkout time of 1200. Oh, and not to forget the refillable soap and shampoo/conditioner dispenders and recyle cans in the room...more eco-conscious than most places I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate V
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on a month long u.s.a trip and was a great city to end in. Room was probably a bit small for our big family of 2 adults and 4children but was certainly good value. Free parking and wifi was also a great bonus. The rooms were nicely decorated and extremely clean. We managed to walk to most sights and restaurants though a restaurant/room service on site in the future would be even better. The staff were super helpful and friendly. Would certainly return to the Maxwell when we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Easy parking , nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Easy location, lots of free parking, friendly service- only issue for me is I prefer to have some type of restaurnat in the lobby of hotels I stay at- this one does not (yet) however plenty nearby. Overall terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: cokebaby
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated, spacious, good (not great) location. Lots of nice perks like in room microwave including free popcorn, a Keurig coffee maker with real creamers in the mini-fridge, free parking & wi-fi. All the things that are annoying when hotels charge for them, the Maxwell doesn't charge for them. The only thing bad I can say come from the fact that it is a renovated older hotel. It's pretty noisy. Everything that happens in the hallways is loud and clear in the rooms, including the early start for the cleaning staff. That said, it's no worse than you'll find at any older or cheaper hotel. I still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: gemini004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Maxwell Hotel two nights and loved the room and service. Everything was clean and fresh - room was large with a large bathroom, modern decor and a view of the Space Needle. Beds were very comfortable. Although there is no restaurant in the hotel, there are numerous restaurants within walking distance. There is a coffee shop in the lobby with pastries. The Space Needle and monorail to downtown is also within walking distance. From the hotel, you can borrow bicycles-free of charge. The staff is friendly, helpful and knowledgable about the area and places to visit. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this property!”
Reviews.Author: pensfan92
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Maxwell for business. The customer service it outstanding and the rooms are great! My only wish is a larger fitness center and onsite restaurant (which is in the works). Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will think twice about going back”
Reviews.Author: Claire93_11
Reviews.Content: After reading pages after pages of positive comments about the Maxwell Hotel we were thrilled to spend two nights there. The hotel has been very nicely decorated, with lots of taste and personal touches which make the stay homey and welcoming. However let's not forget it's not a 4-star hotel and, behind the new renovations, it's quite an old building. The noise level on the street side was quite bad on the Saturday night and we didn't appreciate being waken up at 7 am on Saturday morning by a barking dog in the corridor, just outside our bedroom door. Yes, the hotel accepts dogs, barking ones too! We wanted that week-end to be a relaxing one but unfortunately we didn't sleep well both nights! I was disappointed even though the location and the decoration were perfect and the bed very very comfy.... Will we be back?? Not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: egustafs56
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. Clean, modern very convenient to Seattle Center. Good value for Seattle. Rooms were very modern. Only drawback was that the wi-fi signal was extremely weak. They shouldn't advertise free wi-fi unless it is actually functional.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JPascoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed a weekend at the Maxwell Hotel in Seattle. It was good value for the stay but lacked some amenities. The hotel was very nicely decorated, clean, and even had a few nice surprises such as dvd players in the room. The location is good as you can walk to so many of Seattle's sites. On the other hand, the hotel does not have a restaurant or lounge (there is a seating area but no food or drink service). They are building a restaurant so that will be a good future amenity. As well, at the time we stayed there was insufficient parking for their guests. That was a major inconvenience as we had to go find street parking several blocks away. Aside from that, staff were very helpful and friendly. I would stay there again but would definitely make sure to check in early so I could be assured of a parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - One problem”
Reviews.Author: Travis B
Reviews.Content: Amazing renovation on the hotel. Great location. Good staff. The design of the hotel is modern. The people who designed the hotel really understand today's individual. No more bars of soap. Everything is dispenser. No more grimy shower curtains. Big screen tv. Hardwood floors. My only complaint. Ask about their restaurant renovation. We had a room right above the pizza restaurant they are building. We were woken up at 7:15am by construction work even though they say they dont make noise until 9 am. Ask about the location of your room before hand. Very disappointing. The walls are super thin too. We could hear our neighbors and their tv. So not the most romantic hotel but definately nice. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a more modern feel within the city about 2 miles from pikes place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Overall Experience!”
Reviews.Author: WinklersFour
Reviews.Content: On a recent family trip (two adults, two boys 7 and 9 y/o), we decided to take a risk and stay at a "non-chain" hotel. We weren't disappointed! The staff was friendly and very helpful (even offering activity boxes with crayons, card games, Legos for the boys to use during our stay). My request for a room with a view was honored (we had a great view of the Space Needle nearby). The room was clean, the decor was refreshing, the hardwood floors (and potential noise issue) wasn't a problem. We didn't mind that there wasn't a restaurant in the hotel, as the hotel's location is near the Seattle Center, monorail, and lots of good eating options. The free parking was worth it alone!! The room rate was great. I can't rave enough about our experience; we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location, clean/boutique and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: jorgeceb
Reviews.Content: Maxwell has clean/comfortable rooms, good price (compared to others), free wifi/Bottled Water, for us, with a good location/easy access to mass transit systems. Will stay in here if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Space Needle and other sites.”
Reviews.Author: Spicy04
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Maxwel hotel for four night. The hotel was convenient to the Space Needle and other sites. We walked to the Bartell drug store a few blocks away - to get thing that we needed during our stay - including gloves and wine. The hotel was clean, very comfortable, and updated. (I loved the decor!) We enjoyed the Keurig coffeemaker in the room. We didn't use the free parking...but that is a great bonus because parking is limited and expensive. On the downside...We would have liked to have a view of the space needle - but they said they couldn't give us one since we were staying for four nights. A gift basket that was supposed to be in our room upon arrival was not delivered...after asking about it, we had to pick it up at the front desk. This was a disappointment to the person that sent it to us. The (modern) showers are nice and large but did not have shower curtains which caused water to splash out on the floor. Special thanks to Justin (at the front desk) for answering all our questions - and storing our golf clubs.

Reviews.Title: “What's Not To Like?”
Reviews.Author: DMC551
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel and was pleasantly surprised by the nice, comfortable looking lobby. It was bright and cheerful, as well as having a nice fireplace. The staff who checked me in were also very friendly and accommodating. When I went to my room, I had another lovely surprise. More comfortable furnishings and a nice walk-in shower. There was also Tommy Bahama soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion dispensers. I was also impressed that they had a Keurig coffee maker in the room with half & half in the refrigerator. Having a refrigerator and microwave were a pleasant surprise. The bed was quite comfortable, as were the feather pillows I had requested. The sheets were also a cut above and very soft. The room was also very clean. Someone put a lot of thought into the design of the rooms and wants and needs of travelers. The rooms were a nice size, especially compared to many city hotels. I couldn't have asked for more. The hotel is located in a great area with restaurants, grocery stores and other shops. If you want to go to downtown Seattle, just hop on the tram behind the Space Needle and you will be there in a few minutes for very little cost. You can walk to many sites from there, including Pikes Place Market. The free parking is another bonus, although I was told by the staff that if I was out late, there may not be any spaces left in the secure parking garage. There is also free street parking if you don't snag a spot. I found the free parking to be a great money saver because I have found that in most cities, including Seattle, this is almost unheard of. As a frequent traveler, I would have to say that this hotel will be one on the top of my list. I will stay again next time I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Seattle, a little outside but just do it.”
Reviews.Author: CasaMurguia
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in Seattle on business, the cost of downtown was so hight when I trawled through TripAdvisor I found and decided to stay at The Maxwell Hotel and I have to say we were not disappointed at all. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous and given we arrived late and the parking was full they helped us locate street parking. The room was a good distance away from the elevator but they were plenty big, very clean and the bathroom was big enough for two to stay in. The hotel is not in downtown but a short walk to Space Needle brought us on the Monorail to the main shopping district and a short walk further brought us to Pike Place which was just great. They supplied mid afternoon coffee and cake which was a welcome treat after the cold wet walk – the coffee was great. Overall the hotel was worth the risk, the location was great, plenty of restaurants within a short walk and as a previous reviewer stated the fresh creamer in the cooler was also welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of Seattle Center!”
Reviews.Author: Mardy1
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I am used to being nickle and dimed for the extras but not here: Free parking, free wi-fi, free bottle water, kiureg coffee/maker, & a complimentary packet of microwave popcorn, topped off with an empty fridge... well, not empty, there was REAL HALF & HALF for my coffee! How nice to avoid the hassle of asking House-keeping to come empty the mini-bar. The next time I will stock that fridge with goodies for breakfast, although there are a number of great cafes and restaurants all with-in walking distance & in a few months there will be a Wood Fired Pizza on site too. The Metropolitan Market is right around the corner and the fact that the Seattle Center and all it's glory is at your front door is just icing on the cake. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location with Great Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Mom023
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I chose to stay at The Maxwell Hotel last weekend, in large part to the excellent reviews, and we were not disappointed. The staff was friendly and courteous, and even upgraded our room upon arrival. Our room, as well as the rest of the hotel, was clean and nicely decorated. Although, not in the center of downtown, we loved the location. The hotel is located on a fairly quiet street just north of Seattle Center. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and we were able to take public transportation to and from the airport (with about a half of a mile or so walk from the Seattle Center Monorail). I don't think any of our destinations was further than 2 miles (most were under 1.5). This hotel just has a great vibe and was the perfect place to begin and end our sightseeing days.

Reviews.Title: “Hip”
Reviews.Author: RenataOttawa
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel is a fun hip sort of space unassuming from the street side. The room had nice wooden floors with paintings bedding furniture all quite original in arrangement. There was a small fridge and microwave so one could stock the fridge for the visit. We flew in for just one night so did not take advantage of this. The Maxwell has no restaurant or cafe so this is important to know in advance. The neighbourhood has lots of restaurants - the good ones require reservations and do stear clear of a busy Thai place on a corner near by. Worst Asian food I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: atmktravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell hotel in Seattle for two nights at the end of September. All the hotel staff is friendly and helpful with any information one asks for. Hotel's decor and the amenities are excellent (pineapple cupcakes it the reception area, also coffee). Rates are very reasonable. Rooms are good size, comfortable and noise-free. Hotel is a little removed from the city center but its easy to get to and the Space needle is walking distance away. There are a few decent places to eat near the hotel, nothing fancy though. Overall its a very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Englishviajera
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Seattle. We chose this hotel based on the on the Trip Advisor reviews and were very pleased we did. The reception area is spacious and smart, the check in was quick and we were pleased to reach our room after a long flight. The size and quality of the room was a pleasant surprise, good size bedroom with bright and stylish decoration & spacious bathroom with walk in shower. Particularly liked that there's a vinyl floor covering in the bedroom, felt so much cleaner than carpet. For the price we thought it very good value. There is no restaurant but there's a coffee & cake kiosk in the lobby The location is quiet and although its located away from downtown we found it very easy to find our way to the Seattle attractions. The hotel offer a courtesy car, can order you a taxi or its not far to the Space Needle monorail station.

Reviews.Title: “You Won't Be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MarshallR
Reviews.Content: We took Amtrak from Texas to Seattle (that is a subject for another review) and arrived at the Hotel around 10:30AM. I had previously called and requested an early check-in. They had a room ready for us looking out at the Space Needle. Fantastic view. We chose the Maxwell based solely on the reviews that we read on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappinted. The hotel is great. Rooms were large enough and beds were terrific. There is no bath tub only a giant sized shower. Many really good restaurants within a few blocks. The Seattle Center is a quick walk from the hotel and there you can catch the monoral to down town and you can catch a city bus in the downtown area for free and get around the city. The staff, mostly young folks were very accomodating and showed real concern for the guests. What ever information you needed they were ready to help. They have these delicious little cupcakes every afternoon, they are super! A restaurant that we found not far from the Seattle Center is worth the walk. It is called the "Five Points Cafe" The food was really, really good and the portions quite large and the price was right. Try it, I'm sure that you will like it. Don't let the exterior keep you from going in. Thanks to the reviews that I read, we had a great time in Seattle. When we go back to Seattle, we'll definitely stay at the Maxwell. If you are cruising out of Seattle and want to spend a few days before or after, this would be a great place for you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, great location”
Reviews.Author: PowerTravelerCT
Reviews.Content: Our family of five (three teenagers!) LOVED this place. From the moment we walked in, we knew we had found something out of the ordinary. Beautiful decor, warm reception. And SO convenient to Seattle attractions (Space Needle in particular) and transportation, plus great neighborhood restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Details!”
Reviews.Author: plinkonet
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell is located only a block from Seattle Center, so it's easy walking distance from the Space Needle and other attractions. It's also a fast walk to all the restaurants and bars in Queen Anne. The building is gorgeous, and the rooms are large and well-appointed. Everything in general was very high quality, and we were especially fans of the details like the Keurig machine, fresh cream for coffee, and free bottled water and popcorn in the rooms. The staff was very friendly, too. Parking is iffy... the underground lot fills up quickly, but they helped us find a spot so we never had to park on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at Very Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: John2830
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms, friendly staff and good location just a block north of Space Needle. Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for Ballet, Zinzanni, etc.”
Reviews.Author: raebbie
Reviews.Content: Went to Teatro Zinzanni to celebrate our anniversary and stayed downtown so we could drink more wine and walk to bed. Zinzanni had a discount arrangement with the hotel and it's right around the corner so it was super-convenient, especially since the parking was free! Would be a great place to stay after a night at the ballet (think Nutcracker?), the Seattle Rep, anything that's down in that area. Rooms were clean, shower was great, the lounge area looked cozy although we just walked by it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: mj316
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell has nice, clean, good sized rooms. No complaints there. I found the service left a bit to be desired however. On check in at 1pm, we were flatly told that check in was 3pm. I appreciate that 3pm is the check in time. However most places are generally a bit flexible about check in time. Maybe they were 100% booked the previous night, but it would have been nice to have that communicated. We don't usually show up early for check in, but find that good hotels are generally accommodating on the odd occasion this happens. There was also another strange guy working the desk at various times who was a bit creepy. All that said, as other reviews note here, the rooms at the Maxwell are high standard and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel as it is supposed to be”
Reviews.Author: Baypeak
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with the kids. The Maxwell is really a hotel as it is supposed to be: (1) very clean (2) very friendly (3) no extra charges (4) modern and original design (5) well located. And also: very quiet, I do not understand where the noise complaints are coming from as it as quiet as it can be, we slept solidly for 3 nights with no noise whatsoever from adjoining rooms. Minor issue: the pool is the size of a postage stamp while the lobby is huge and we are not sure what the logic of that design was. Lots of good restaurants around (but give the Bahn Thai a miss, past its peak) and a great food market a few blocks west.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimDog77
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with modern amenities.... Unfortunately my only complaint is in regards to one of the modern amenities. The hardwood floors.... While these are very nice while you're in the room and add a nice modern touch, sadly they really amplify the noise from the room above. We actually had to call the front desk and ask them to call upstairs the first night since the noise of what I assume was small children (at 1130 pm) running around was making it very difficult to fall asleep. The second morning we were there it sounded as if someone above us was pacing back and forth in their room wearing dress shoes or high heels from 8 am until we left at 11. I truly can't describe just how loud this is when you are in the room below. Other than this one complaint I have nothing but good to say about this hotel. The staff was very nice and professional. The furnishings were clean and modern. The location is not right in the middle of downtown but it is just a three minute ride on the monorail. And of course there is the included parking which makes it easy to just leave your car and explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, parking”
Reviews.Author: opiehub
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maxwell for two separate 3-day stints on a recent vacation. We got a good deal with their stay a 3rd night free package, which was cheaper than Travelosity, so we averaged $109 a night. Thought that was a good value with the gated underground parking and quiet neighborhood off the beaten path. The rooms have faux hardwood floors and are small but very clean and comfortable for 2 people. The bed was fine. Seattle Center is about a 4 block walk and it was easy too take the monorail from there to downtown where it was just a 4 block walk to the Market. Bus stop is only 2 blocks away and it was an easy drive into downtown. The hotel staff was nice, our room was upgraded because it wasn't ready when we arrived, but the staff wasn't he most knowledgeable - could tell you how to get somewhere but their recommendations were lacking. 2 things: Just in back of hotel about a mile is the spot to take the iconic photo from a hill of the Seattle skyline. And in the nearby Queen Ann neighborhood we ate a great breakfast at the 5 Spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SuziCA
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, friendly staff, love the wood floor not carpet, great location. Walking distance to Space Needle. I definitely would stay here again when I'm back in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A real treasure.”
Reviews.Author: robandphyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, and then the next week for an additional night. The rooms were clean and bright, the staff was welcoming and always helpful. Free parking and internet! The hotel is in a relatively quiet neighborhood, but surprisingly convenient to downtown: the monorail is only a five or ten minute walk away. The only drawback is no on-site rerstaurant, but apparently one is currently in the works. This is where I will stay on any future trips to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lifecycles
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here in Sept. on the tail end of a trip we made to Vancouver, BC and Whistler. Upon entering the hotel I was immediately impressed by the decor (funky art deco?) and that continued into the spacious modern rooms. Not being familiar with Seattle we found the location of the hotel was very convenient and close to museums and the monorail. Also within walking distance were a couple of good places for breakfast that were recommended by the hotel staff. I would recommend the following restaurants, The Brooklyn (seafood and steaks) and the Pink Door (Italian). For great cocktails you must search out the Zig Zag Cafe near the market. Get there for happy hour and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ukaus123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2011 for 4 night, and all I can say is, that this is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed. I travel all over the world and usually stay at top quality hotels, but "the Pineapple" excels at every level. Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are nice and clean, location is superb - one block from where the Space Needle is - and surrounded by great restaurants. The mini cupcakes are delicious, and you cannot have just one! When we left they started work on a bar/restaurant, which will only enhance this incredible hotel. My wife and I will visit Seattle at least once a year, and we will definately stay here again. Our compliments to management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mldatty
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Maxwell Hotel and found it to be excellent. The rooms were spacious and well appointed, the location a bit far from downtown but convenient to Queen Anne district and other resources. Free parking, free Internet and outstanding service especially from Justin at the front desk who we found to be extremely professional and helpful. We will use the Maxwell as our base for furtre travels to the Seattle area

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bearoki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed it every minutes. Room was clean and nice. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. Location was awesome, walking distance to Space and nice restaurants. Cupcakes in the afternoon was very nice touch. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Donald C
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels in US and world cities, mostly big chains, but also a reasonable number of independents / small chains, I would rate the Maxwell experiences as one of the best! The decor looks fresh and modern without being overly trendy or trying to hard. The staff were great to us - helpful in a "I care about this hotel and your experience" way, rather than the offhand "I just work here / am paid to pretend to care" attitude. The room was clean, very well fitted out (Keurig coffee / tea maker, popcorn, big LCD TV and DVD player, small microwave, fridge). The icing on the cake were the freebies not obvious from the website - a free shuttle service (bookable) to drop you off and pick you up from downtown destinations, eg Pike Place Market, downtown shops, light rail. And the "packs" for the rooms - we asked for the free Kids Pack and got drawing materials, games and Lego delivered (you give it back well cared for when you leave). A handy, quiet location next the Seattle Center (space needle, pacific science center etc) and 2 blocks from Metropolitan Market - a great supermarket / deli.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Mako2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell Hotel for a total of 3 nights. There were three of us in a double bed room. We were mostly impressed with the hotel. It is very nicely decorated. The rooms are average hotel size and full of color. The whole place is very colorful. We loved the mini pineapple cupcakes in the lobby. The beds were really comfortable. That was an unexpected surprise. Free parking was a huge plus. The garage was little tight to maneuver. I can’t imagine parking with a big car. But we made it out with no scrapes or dents. There was no free breakfast but there is a Pineapple Expresso stand in the lobby that serves breakfast pastries and sandwiches along with coffee and tea. And the prices are not bad at all. $5 for a sandwich and hot tea. The front desk staff were very nice…not overly friendly but polite. They do have maps of the city and can recommend places to you with directions. They have real, full size hair dryers in the rooms. If you travel a lot then you know what a big deal this is.
