The room also had a microwave and mini fridge and 2 free bottles of water. The location was very good for us. It is at the base of Queen Anne Hill. It is .7 miles to walk up to Kerry Park at the top of the hill for amazing views of the city. The Space Needle is about ½ mile walk. Pike Place Market is a little further at 1.5 miles. But we walked it and it was not that bad at all. We felt safe wondering around on foot at all times. There is an excellent restaurant within walking distance that you must try. It is Toulouse Petit. And at the time I am writing this it is the number one rated restaurant in Seattle. It is to die for and so close the hotel. This was a recommendation from the front desk staff and we are so glad we went. If I ever return to Seattle I would most definitely stay here again. One word of caution. When booking and prepaying in advance check your credit card statement. I did get charged twice. They were quick to correct it for me but I am not so sure they would have caught it if I didn’t. They were very nice and accommodating about the situation. But I still thought it was worth mentioning. This would by no means discourage me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great $$$, Super bonus for free parking, funky neighborhood, loved the art-deco decor!!! Would go back I'm a heart beat.”
Reviews.Author: Dharma
Reviews.Content: As above...nothing bad to report as long as you can walk a bit easy trek to dwntwn or monorail, sweet hotel, a treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, noisy, but read on for some tips and what to expect.”
Reviews.Author: jennyleetee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights. Our first time in Seattle and not realizing that being near the space needle does not mean you are near downtown. Location and getting around The staff advised us the simplest quickest way to get downtown was to walk 5 minutes to the space needle. It is definitely NOT a 5 minute walk to the monorail! We are fit people and walk at a fairly fast pace. The best time we clocked from the hotel to the monorail was 10 minutes. The monorail has two ends; space needle at one end and a shopping centre that is a couple of blocks from pike place markets. There are no other stops. Each trip is $2 for the 1 mile covered. We discovered the bus as a better option. The off peak fare is $2.25 and you should always get a transfer which lasts 2 hours so you can make the most of the ticket if you want to return to the hotel or visit another area. There are two places we picked up a bus; 5th and valley or 1st and mercer. These stops are 2 or 3 blocks away; much closer than the monorail. The room Unfortunately we were given a room right next to the elevator and with a stunning view of the car park across the road facing Roy street. As other reviewers have said it is very noisy from other rooms. You can hear everything. We had the added bonus of the dulcet tones of the bing bong of the elevator and the grand accompaniment of loud merrymakers until the wee sma's. And on a weeknight too! Then the early risers using the elevator from 5am continued to keep us alert so we wouldn't miss the continuing sounds of room doors slamming shut. We did mention to the staff each day that we were being disturbed by noise. I'm certain there was a family of elephants in the room above; running continually up and down the hallway to their door. The staff offered to contact the guests in that room if the noise continued past 10pm. We were also disturbed by passers by on the street who were often exuberant; probably due to having just been to a show at the key arena. Wifi Basically, it sucks. The only way we could get enough signal was to sit in the hallway behind out door. We advised the staff on several occasions and they blamed apple devices for the problem. Bathroom I am really not a fuss pot but I do use a hair dryer and the length of cord on their dryers is impossible to be able to dry your hair unless you are prepared to have your nose stuck against the bathroom wall. The cord must measure about a foot and a bit long. The staff could not help with that either. All the dryers were the same, I was informed. Oh well. Beds Very very comfortable. Business centre This was convenient and you can print for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and right near the space needle”
Reviews.Author: chellisa78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the space needle and attractions and you can get into the centre of Seattle using the monorail which is cheap. Reception very good and the beds where so comfortable we had trouble getting out an about! There is a good 24 hour supermarket around the corner and a great little place for breakfast called Citzen. Our room had a huge shower which was very welcome after a long plane flight and the rooms where very nicely furnished. Altogether our stay here was very good and we where not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very different but in a good way”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Lynch
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here for four nights. Unexpectedly colourful lobby and the room was much the same. Really comfy beds. Excellent service at front desk. Wonderful location just by the Seattle Center and very easy to walk into town or get the monorail to downtown. Everything we could need in our room and plenty of space. No breakfast provided but easy to eat in room or go out. Plenty of food options in the evening locally so no need to travel. Can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “A Lower Queen Anne Hotel That Really is All that Trip Advisor-ites Promise”
Reviews.Author: mkedan
Reviews.Content: One always wonders on reviewing services whether the reviews are real or not, so when I booked the Maxwell in Seattle (having stayed at three other perfectly nice hotels on previous trips) based on ratings, there was an element of surprise. I'm not a huge fan of Seattle Center, but this hotel was conveniently located near Lower Queen Anne, and for some reason, I was quite fond of a morning workout climbing up to the rest of the neighborhood (we even picked up a map of the staircases). It's very near a lot of the performing arts, and how amusing is it to say we took the monorail back and forth from downtown. Parking was free, the staff was nice, the room was great, the public area was modern and yet still had that open lobby feel that I like in a hotel. The pineapple cupcakes were a sweet touch, and the phenomenal Metropolitan Market is only blocks away, as well as a perfect second-hand bookstore, Mercer Avenue Books. What more could one want?

Reviews.Title: “Maxwell is Great”
Reviews.Author: Bgtklbx
Reviews.Content: Rather than go over location and etc I am going to the heart of the Maxwell...the staff is excellent and caring,the entire hotel is very clean, and the beds are wonderful. We enjoyed everything about our stay. This hotel makes you feel at home. If you are a walker, even downtown is not out of the question. You can walk, or take the monorail for two dollars. We are in only moderate shape and we were able to walk to the Mariners game. Granted it is a ways away, but there is so much between the hotel and the stadium that it makes for a great time. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suzywongtraveller
Reviews.Content: I could see the Space Needle from my bed. It was a very comfortable modern hotel. Perfect to seeing Seattle. Most comfortable bed in fact could not fault room in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in Seattle......”
Reviews.Author: ChefKFairfax_VA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our top pick to stay when we visited Seattle. We liked everything, from the service, cleanliness, convenience to the space needle, and especially to the bakery (Nielsens Bakery for the Snitters). The beds were comfy and we had an excellent night's sleep before our flight back to the east coast. This place was almost perfect except for the internet service. I just gave up trying to connect from my laptop since the signal was very weak from our room. I wound up using my Droid instead.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetGal22
Reviews.Content: Hubby and i stayed here for two nights. Got great rates of their website. Room was very clean and very tasteful decor. Good location close to space needle. I would have given it a 5 star if there was a restaurant in the hotel. But there are great restaurants nearby within walking distant. I love that the hotel give comlimentary bikes, we rode the bikes everywhere and covered alot more grounds than walking. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DenandJim
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay here. Having read previous posts there is not much additional that I can offer. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. As mentioned in previous posts, the floors are wooden and can be a bit noisy if the room above you like to walk around in their shoes for hours. Our room on the second floor did have a great view of the car park across the road, but you did get to see the space needle. Not having stayed in Seattle before, we are unable to compare to other hotels, but for us the location was great. Easy walk to restaurants, the space needle and downtown. The staff were friendly and helpful for when we needed directions. Seattle is a beautiful city and we made the most of our time here. We bought a city pass and used the coupons to see the major attractions, this did save us a bit of money, but you need to keep busy to get the value. There are many restaurants close by and the choice of dining options is very good. The Friday that we arrived (after 26 hours of travelling)they had Yappy Day which was a pet parade to raise money. This was a hoot and we really had some fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: iHEARTvacations14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Maxwell for three nights (btw, look on The Maxwell's website for a 3rd night free voucher, if they still have the promotion. That makes it a great deal!). We had our 20-month-old son with us, so we needed enough space to set up his playpen, which there was. We had a "duet" room with two queens, no view, but we didn't care (I think you pay slightly more for a view). The rooms have laminate flooring, which makes it feel cleaner than carpet, and the room was immaculately cleaned every day. Having a toddler, I'm sure we gave the cleaning staff a couple of challenges, with him getting his snacks everywhere, etc, but every day our room was spic and span. THE BEDS!!! I can't say enough about how comfortable the beds are!!! I am actually going to call the hotel to find out what kind of mattresses they were because that was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on... ever. Also, there were a billion pillows, so you could use as many as you want to get comfortable. The bathroom was a nice size, but my only complaint is that there is only a shower. Our little guy hadn't had showers yet (just baths), but since there was no tub, he had to start. He didn't care for it too much, but it got the job done. For me, the shower was great, except there was no door or curtain (the shower itself was huge, so they don't need a door since it's almost impossible to splash out into the bathroom) so it got a little drafty. For my husband, there wasn't enough water pressure (it was one of those rain-like shower heads) so I guess it just depends on what you like. The room was very nicely decorated, and the TV was beautiful! It was SO nice to have a fridge and microwave too, so we bought a few groceries at the Metropolitan Market (a few blocks away, and fantastic little store, by the way!) and ate our breakfasts and some lunches in the room, which saved us some money. The single-cup coffee maker was really handy, and they left microwave popcorn in the room, which is a nice touch! My only other comment about the room is that you could hear EVERYTHING through the door. If you are sensitive to noise, you may want to ask for a room that is far from the elevator. We were right next to the elevator so we could hear every time it beeped, and even if people were talking in hushed voices in the hall, we could hear what they were saying. The location of the hotel was perfect. A nice walk to the Space Needle and monorail station, which takes you right downtown, and we felt very safe walking around the neighbourhood with our little guy in the stroller. There were lots of amenities nearby, but it wasn't nearly as busy as being right downtown. Plus, the Seattle Center area (where the Space Needle is) is so beautiful, with lots of arts facilities and parks, fountains, amazing public space. We took the monorail downtown for $2 one way, which drops you off about 5 blocks from Pike Place Market, which was neat. The area right around the monorail stop has AMAZING shopping too! And now, my favourite part, the staff. We had never been to Seattle, so we were constantly asking them where we should go to eat, and how we should travel to the different attractions. Justin was incredibly helpful when I asked him how we should get to the Mariner's game. Our options were to take the monorail and light rail transit, which drops you off very close to the stadium, or to drive and park. I was nervous about driving downtown and knowing a safe and reasonably priced place to park, and Justin gave me precise, step-by-step directions and told me where to park for $3.50, and said that's where he usually parks when he goes to games, and he's never had issues. Then he gave me a little background on the baseball team, who to watch for, etc. which was awesome! I think I should cut myself off here, but I just can't say enough about how great this hotel was, and especially their staff. Incredible. I will definitely stay here again, as it is an amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Okay Everything Else”
Reviews.Author: wanderer05
Reviews.Content: The price is right, lots of deals available too. Throw in free wifi and even free parking and it's a bargain compared to nearby hotels. The hotel itself is in an okay location just north of Seattle Center where the space needle, Key Arena, and other attractions are located. To the north is the Queen Anne Hill where you can get a good view of the Seattle skyline. Easy to get to off I-5. Service friendly but amateurish. Room quite nice, and more importantly clean.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Base”
Reviews.Author: Coyote88
Reviews.Content: We have recently spent two nights in Seattle at the Maxwell Hotel on Roy Street. We were pleased with the room, everything you would expect from an hotel of this quality but the big plus was the location. A 10 minute walk from the northern end of the mono-rail where a two dollar fare whisks you into the middle of 'downtown'. There is also an excellent 'pub' called McMenamins right next door with a good choice of draught beer and simple food - give the home made soup a try. Seattle itself is an interesting city, try the following three 'sites' the Columbia Centre, Underground Seattle Tour (608 First Avenue) and of course the Space Needle

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MDCSTP
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel blocks from Seattle center, as it is outside of the downtown core, rooms were far cheaper with not only free Internet but free parking(unheard of in Seattle) downtown is certainly a walkable distance or you could pay the 2$ for the monorail, within minutes of the hotel are 2 grocery stores, QFC or Metropolitan market, Seattle center with the space needle, EMP, science center, ride the ducks, Elliott bay and the waterfront, sculpture park....the rooms are clean modern and retro looking all at once, wood floors(great for a baby who may throw up) the lobby is comfortable with an espresso bar( we did not have coffee though so I cannot review it) the best thing is they have bikes that you can sign out to use with no limit on the time! I would 100% stay here and recommend this hotel to anyone, the staff is extremely polite and helpful. We stayed from a Saturday afternoon till Tuesday lunchtime.

Reviews.Title: “Quick but good stay at the Maxwell Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OutoftheBay
Reviews.Content: New, trendy hotel with all the nice details - comfortable beds, great products in the bathroom, flat screen tvs, large 'living' area with comfortable furniture and lots of amenities. Free in-and-out parking made our stay very easy. The pineapple mini-cupcakes are a nice touch. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, my first choice from now on”
Reviews.Author: vekel
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised us both in location and the hotel itself. We also stayed in downtown and found the Maxwell Hotel to be the better location. Many unique restaurants within walking distance and of course a simple walk into town or you can take a quick inexpensive train ride. (But we found the train ride not really necessary). The hotel staff were friendly and the hotel was very clean. A super find, and then the fact that you do not have to spend a whopping 30+ dollars on parking, was just the icing on the cake. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, really good location”
Reviews.Author: CheffyD
Reviews.Content: Super clean, fresh, new hotel conveniently located just north of Seattle Center. Great grocery only 3 blocks away for picking up ready made meals or just bagels. Free parking!!! Free internet!!! We got a suite, which had 2 queen beds and a sofa and a chair. Only complaint is that the water pressure was a little low and the closet was really small. But still a great find! Would recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: HH_in_AZ
Reviews.Content: This super clean, artsy hotel is a great place to stay in Seattle. It is located between lower Queen Anne and Seattle Center which gives you the opportunity to be close enough to the "touristy" places but still amongst the locals. The room itself (we stayed in the Aria) was spacious, clean, had a walk in shower, views of the Space Needle, and might have had the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on. If you stay here may I pass on some good info: If you are traveling light, not renting a car and want to skip the $45 cab fare from the airport you can take the LINK from the airport to the Westlake station, then take the monorail to Seattle Center which then gives you a 5ish minute walk to the hotel. The LINK and Monorail will cost you $5.50 per adult. There is a fantastic market (Metropolitan Market on Mercer and 1st Ave/walking distance) for any grocery or other sundries you may need. It has a great selection of local foods, wines, as well as a deli with eat in area. Toulouse Petit...for breakfast...DO IT!!! You won't regret it. (on Queen Anne and Mercer/walking distance) A nice walk up Queen Anne Avenue (and I mean uphill, you'll get in your workout), turn left on Highland Drive and walk a short distance to Kerry Viewpoint were you can gaze out at the Seattle skyline. After you catch your breath continue up Queen Anne and you will have the beautiful Puget Sound on your left and lovely Queen Anne homes on your right.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mreed907
Reviews.Content: Although I live in South Florida I try to visit the Seattle area as often as possible as I have fallen in love with the Pacific Northwest. I have often stayed in four and five star properties downtown but wanted to spend less on lodging this time. I found the Maxwell on the American Express travel site and selected it based on a very reasonable room rate and it's Queen Anne location. All I can say is, wow, what a great find! Luxurious but with a fun and whimiscial decor, the incredibly spacious lobby is not only welcoming but represents well the spacious, well-appointed yet equally whimsical rooms. I have spent more than twice the nightly rate at nearby hotels for much less impressive accommodations. And the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful--the front desk personnel were almost like having a personal concierge! Even the housekeepers always gave a warm friendly greeting. The location couldn't be better--a short (but steep!) walk up Queen Anne to Kerry Park..the best view in Seattle, a few steps more to the waterfront, and quick monorail and light rail to the airport. No car needed for me, but if you prefer wheels, the Maxwell even offers free parking! Try to find that anywhere else in Seattle! I truly can't pay enough compliments to this property and it's amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much what everyone else says..”
Reviews.Author: Greg A
Reviews.Content: Great, cool hotel very well situated for the Seattle Center and monorail into downtown. The surrounding area is great for bars and restaurants. Toulouse Petit is five mins walk (look it up-you won't be sorry). Also a McMenamins next door and various other very local options. Room was great and very quiet. Request to be away from elevator seemed to have been taken onboard. If there's one criticism, how are you meant to get up and see Seattle (which we were blown away by as apparently fairly rare UK visitors compared to other US cities) when a bed is that comfortable?

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was designed for us, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mehilainen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly designed for us, it really was fun and trendy. Our room was quiet, super comfy and beautiful. Loved also all those little things like coffee maker, micro, popcorn etc in our room. Wifi worked really well. Location point of view it's so and so. It right next to Space Needle and Monoreil but walking to direct downtown are might get bit long after few days, but there are good restaurants and groceries near by. Big plus for free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Singaporeconncection
Reviews.Content: I visit Seattle at least twice a year and, since its construction two years ago, I always stay at the Maxwell Hotel. I used to stay in five star hotels downtown but I find the Maxwell equally comfortable and luxurious at a much more reasonable price. The Maxwell is lacking a restaurant and pool but it makes up for it with comfortable rooms and a friendly staff. It is a reasonable walk to the Pacific Place downtown and is just blocks from the Space Center complex and the monorail. Even though it is lacking a restaurant there are several good bars and restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: amesOregon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maxwell was very nice. Nice people at reception. The location is great - just across the street from Seattle Center and at the foot of Queen Anne. Walking up into the hills takes you into lovely neighborhoods with great views. We had a view of the Space Needle from our window (over the parking garage across the street). The hotel was very clean and even had wood floors in the room instead of carpet. I worried it might be noisy but it wasn't the night we stayed. Parking was free but somewhat limited. It was bit expensive but I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Funky property!”
Reviews.Author: RobynMM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really liked this hotel. It had a modern, funky kind of vibe! They even put out pineapple cupcakes each afternoon in the lobby! The rooms were really nice and spacious and had a cool view of the Space Needle. We liked the location, but we like to walk places and don't mind taking public transportation (buses and the monorail are both close by). If you want to be in the "middle of the action" this would not be the place for you. Overall, everyone was friendly and accommodating and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, in a convenient location for first-timers”
Reviews.Author: Sport5639
Reviews.Content: We reserved King or 2 Queens, and by default get the 2 beds. Hotel is a 5 min walk from the needle, where you can take the light-rail to downtown. Though we had a car, which the hotel happily provided parking for, downtown walking is a good break as driving in Seatle for the first time is disorienting. In the evening, the hotel called taxis for us, as parking can be difficult in popular nightspots. They even nicely provided wine glasses for our newly bought Washington State wines, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: E B
Reviews.Content: It's certainly true that this hotel looks fabulous, but unfortunately its service doesn't really match up, although I would still recommend it as a good hotel in Seattle. The hotel makes a big play of the 'pineapple hospitality' but in the four days that we stayed there only one member of staff was polite, or even looked up when we walked into reception! I'm pretty sure his name was Justin and without him our stay would have been pretty rubbish - he had great suggestions for places to visit and eat and was really enthusiastic. (Any hotel owners reading this should head hunt him quick smart!) This was especially handy as the hotel is not really close to the action. The rooms are lovely, but there is very little water pressure in the shower, which made for a rather limp start to the day. The free water, coffee and popcorn are smashing though! The free wifi is ok but not that speedy. There are a few bars and restaurants nearby, and a large supermarket. I would totally recommend the Vietnamese restaurant a couple of doors down Roy Street (yellow sign) - best pho I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay to end our imperfect trip!”
Reviews.Author: cadybugtours
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell Hotel after a long trip with our toddlers. It was perfect! From the cupcakes at check-in to the DVD player to the free wifi to the popcorn it exceeded my expectations. The location was perfect and we found walking to meals fun! Our suite overlooked the Space Needle, which was nice. The beds were so soft and comfortable. The room was chic and had all the modern amenities a travelling family needs. There is even a kids cart you can rent with games, coloring books, etc! The parking garage was being repaved but the hotel had a staff member out front directing patrons where to go to park. All the employees we encountered were super friendly and helpful. My only complaint was that whoever was staying above us sounded like a dinosaur with all of his/her stomping. That is the only negative I could come up with about the hotel! We will definitely be staying here again! Thank you Maxwell Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Blind-Willie
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell is very nice hotel in good location. The staff is very polite and helpful. Rooms are very nice and large. Access to Pike Market is easy using the Monorail. Free parking at the hotel is a added benefit. We have been to Seattle several times and this Hotel is now our choice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “over-rated”
Reviews.Author: gringoca
Reviews.Content: Hotel with some pros, but far too many cons to warrant a 5 or 4 star review. Check-in was the most awkward of any hotel we've ever stayed at. Night desk guy (with thinning blonde hair) was extraordinarily awkward and unprofessional. It was next to impossible to understand anything he said because he mumbled completely unintelligibly. The fact that he spoke barely above a whisper also did not help. We got tired of asking him to repeat himself and just gave up. Beyond his complete lack of basic communication skills, he was completely incompetent--we asked him questions and he would turn to his computer for a minute or two, then turn back to us and proceed without answering our question. It was like a weird episode of the Twilight Zone. We were checked into a smaller room than booked and asked him to adjust the rate accordingly. He responded by turning and staring at his computer screen for 1-2 minutes, then turning back to us without responding. We asked him again and he responded by saying, "there's still two of you staying in the room, so why should I adjust the rate?". Huh?! If that's the logic, then put us in your biggest, nicest room for the same rate! The guy was so incompetent and annoying we just gave up and decided we would talk to someone the next day. Going to our room, the entire long hallway (we were at the opposite side of the hotel from the elevator) reeked of marijuana smoke (despite the hotel being non-smoking). When we got to our room we found out why--the doors have zero seal around them--there's a significant gap all the way around the door that lets in light, lots of noise and pot smoke (as even the inside of our room smelled like pot smoke). Found that our safe was broken and did not work at all. Called the front desk who assured that it would be fixed right away. When we checked out valuable at the front desk later, we reminded them again and, a second time, were reassured that the safe would be fixed. It wasn't. It took 4 requests over the course of several days to get the safe repaired. Every single time we came and went from the hotel we had to wait in line at the front desk to check our bag and wait to get our bag back. This was completely and easily avoidable and 100% unacceptable. Another disappointment was the noise--the hotel has hard laminate floors and thin walls. We could hear every step the person above us took at 6am and hear every word from the wall-mounted TV in the room next door. Poor insulation is inexcusable in a hotel in the Maxwell's price range. Especially a new hotel. Minor cons were the internet connection, decor and bath products. The internet connection was frequently unusably slow (slower than 1999 dial-up). The Maxwell tries to be hip and contemporary, but the decor/design is really just a jumble of uncohesive styles that are all over place. The bath products were pretty cheap and diluted--more like Motel 6 quality, than that of a hotel in the $200-400 range. Pros were a comfortable bed, extremely clean rooms, extraordinarily, warm, friendly and outgoing housekeeping (the front desk staff seriously needs to take hospitality lessons from the housekeeping staff, no exaggeration), a convenient Keurig coffee/tea machine and complimentary parking, water and popcorn. Overall, the Maxwell was a disappointment. After bringing a few of our concerns to the attention of the management, nothing in the way of compensation or a sincere apology was offered. It's a very clean hotel with a lot of potential, but the majority of the staff (housekeeping excluded) needs a significant education in the most elementary tenets of hotel hospitality, which is inexcusable for a hotel in Maxwell's price range.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Seattle and we will be back! My husband and I stayed here for 4 days. The hotel staff was most helpful in suggesting places to eat and the sights to take in. The location puts you within blocks of public transportation; which is what I would recommend instead of renting a car... the bus is free within the downtown zone!

Reviews.Title: “SEATTLE LODGING AT THE MAXWELL: EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: KAILUAKID
Reviews.Content: My wife and I vacationed in Seattle from 08/27/11 thru 09/04/11 (8 nights). I do all the research and planning as my wife is usually busy with her child care business. We spent all eight nights at the Maxwell and I selected the Ensemble Suite. This suite or room was extremely spacious with two queen beds, sitting area with sofa sleeper, walk-in shower, Flat screen TV, microwave, refrigerator,DVD player, and internet access among the amenities. We had a view of the Space Needle too. My wife and I enjoyed the beds as we slept peacefully like bables. An added plus was free parking. Since we had a rental car, I can attest that parking is very tight in Seattle as well as expensive. Popcorn, water, and coffee are provided free of charge. The Hotel staff (including the maids) were helpful and courteous. We checked in thirty minutes early and fortunately the room was ready. The Maxwell does not have a restaurant but they do have an expresso and we did purchase breakfast sandwiches on one occasion. We generally ate in the lower Queen Anne area and at times near the Maxwell. We walked to the Seattle Center and caught the monorail to Westlake to explore Seattle. The Maxwell was conveniently located near the attractions in the Seattle Center. I would definitely recommend the Maxwell Hotel.due to its amenities (which also include a pool and exercise room), cleanliness, and its exceptional staff. Attractions and tours include the Ride the Ducks of Seattle, Savor Food Tour, Boeing Tour, Bainbridge Island, Mount Ranier National Park, Crystal Mountain (New Gondola), an escorted walking tour of Seattle, Underground Tour and the City Pass attractions,(Woodland Park Zoo, Space Needle, EMP, Argosy Harbor Tour, Seattle Aquarium, and Pacific Science Center). We drove around the Ballard ( Chittenden Locks)and Freemont districts as well as two shopping malls. WEATHER WAS GOOD

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable first trip to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: GrandPotentate
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set between a residential area and the arts / theater area. Plenty of nice pubs and restaurants, one grocery within easy walking distance. The space needle, ducks, tour bus and monorail are about a 6 block walk. Very nice rooms and hotel. Good coffee shop in the lobby every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Queen Anne”
Reviews.Author: JuanManuel_11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a lot this modern, recent and comfortable hotel next the Seattle Center, the Metropolitain market and the Caffe Ladro. Plus an easy access to downtown by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: kdoOregon
Reviews.Content: Did the title get your attention? You want an honest review right? OK. Fabulous. Fabulous. Fabulous. Great deal. Nice people. We'll be back. Lots of perks - free parking, free internet, microwave in room, refrigerator in room, popcorn and water (free in room), cool decor. But just so you know this is a real review, I do want to put in my criticisms. First, the water pressure was a bit lack luster. But, if you are trying to save water, well, this is the hotel for you. And the hallways are very very cold. They could save money by turning off the air conditioning in the halls, but our thought was that was why it was so quiet - no one wanted to hang out and talk in the hallways. Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Will not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: retired
Reviews.Content: My daughter selected Maxwell Hotel for her guests to attend her wedding. Rooms were not ready as scheduled. Some guests had to wait as long as 3 hours. Some were promised adjoining rooms when reservations were made only to find out when they checked in there were no adjoining rooms Some reserved for a crib and were promised one but nothing was delivered on day of check in, One family member was so dissapointed with the overall service and unkept promises at time of reservation and was told by staff the "YOU CAN CHECKOUT IF YOU ARE NOT HAPPY HERE!!!!" Almost half of the guests did not receive the gift bags supposedly distributed by staff to the registered guests. We were promised that they will give it to the guests as they check in. The staff even printed the guest list. The hotel does not have a professional staff. Seems like they are all in training and still have not gone though Customer Service Class 101!. Do not recommend staying at this hotel at all especially when the staff are ill-trained, snubbish and did not care about making their guests feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ravalite
Reviews.Content: I love the bare floors, it just feels cleaner. Comfortable beds and a large flat screen television. Well decorated rooms and nicely designed bathroom. Enjoyed the complementary cupcakes and coffee at check-in. Great grocery nearby called Metropolitan Market. Really enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FCPSretiree
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal; walking distance to Seattle Center, Space Needle, and Pike Place Market. The rooms are great; clean, hardwood floors, big bathrooms. One of the best features is the free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family, so good we stayed twice!”
Reviews.Author: racheinderbys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning and end of our Pacific Northwest holiday (vacation), for a few days each time. The hotel was ideal for our purposes. The room was large and comfortable for a family of 5 (we had an "Ensemble Suite"). A huge TV with DVD player kept the kids happy. Free WiFi in all parts of the hotel kept my husband and me happy. All the beds were very comfortable, the room was attractively decorated and the bathroom was spacious and well-appointed (shower, no bath - not that that was a problem for us). No food served in the hotel, except for a 24-hour espresso stand, much appreciated by me, jet-lagged as I was, and which also had cinnamon rolls and banana bread, eagerly devoured by the kids. But there are several nearby places to eat, and very helpful desk staff to advise which would be appropriate. Some restaurants even deliver takeaway (takeout) right to your room, which made all the difference on that first night with very sleepy children. In fact, all staff were exceptionally helpful, fulfilling our many requests and queries and even locating a lost item from our first stay to return it on our second. The hotel is conveniently placed for the Space Needle (obviously a must when visiting Seattle) and the Monorail takes you to Westlake (near Pike Place) for $4 return (round trip). Not that it is a long walk, but the monorail is also an experience not to be missed from a tourist itinerary of Seattle. I can't comment on children's activities because we were too busy being tourists to explore them, but I believe there are some available.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Splendid”
Reviews.Author: aria
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be perfect for the 4 of us. We had a booking at the Schaefer Baille Mansion on Millionaire's Row, but they overbooked us. Luckily, we found out a few days before the stay and found this hotel. We dropped by Schaefer Baille to collect our money and get free breakfast, and realized we were lucky to be at Maxwell. Good location. PiKe's Place is a bit of a walk but doable. Free parking and wifi. Nice snacks and coffee in the room. We booked the cheapest room thru Octopus (Japanese site was a bit cheaper) and it was comfortable for 4 people for 2 nights. We saw a family eating takeout food in the nice lobby tables one night and thought that had I known this I'd have gotten some nice roasted chicken from the supermarket to feast with my friends :) They do sometimes offer 1 night free if you stay for 3 nights. Check that out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: SatbirT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little difficult to find but once we called the hotel and got some help it was ok. Check in was fast and friendly. The front desk clerk called our room to make sure we were able to settle in ok. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant which disappointing considering the expansive size of the lobby and sitting area. I prefer that the shower stalk would have a shower curtain but the design is one where it is not required. The water pressure for the shower could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: randi g
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was clean and the rooms were great. Helpful front desk staff. It was in a great neighborhood close to space needle and other attractions. It does get a little sketchy after dark. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: travel-lionNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days and with free water, free Kerig coffee maker and popcorn-- room is appointed with fridge and microwave. Nothing could be nicer. Conveniently located, yet in a quiet area. Doesn't serve breakfast but near great breakfast choices -- even grocery that serves a big breakfast bar! Fitness room was a bit small and meager but serviceable. People nice, too and the best is free parking!! I'd go back there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, affordable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tmbronk
Reviews.Content: we loved our stay at the maxwell. the rooms were clean and functional. nothing too fancy but not lacking in any amenities. we found the wireless to be inconsistent and dependent on where we were in our room (we got better reception on bed 1 than bed 2, go figure?). the lobby is a great space to relax and we ended playing a number of family games there. the pool is on the small side, but clean and perfectly fine for cooling off and distracting the kids for an hour after a busy day of site seeing. the location is terrific - you can walk to all major seattle sites. we loved the science museum! there are two great local groceries stores, and good restaurant options - i'd highly recommend cafe ladro (for breakfast) and mcmenamins (for dinner, especially with kids.)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jillandamy
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel this place is great. We had a nice room with 2 queen beds. There were 3 of us (friends weekend). No charge for the extra person. Free parking was a real plus since most Seattle hotels charge $20 per night to park. The hotel was in a good location. Quiet. Free wi-fi in the rooms. Very clean and pretty. The pool is tiny - used by families with children from what I saw. Don't expect to swim laps here. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fun neighborhood, WIFI not so much..”
Reviews.Author: Kellker
Reviews.Content: Due to late planning, we had to split our time in Seattle between two hotels. I loved our stay in the Maxwell. The nearby neighborhood includes several really good restaurants, a grocery, a drugstore and of course, Seattle center, with the Space Needle, EMC etc.. The rooms had wood floors, which I much prefer to carpet and were decorated in fun colors. Microwave, coffee, bottled water, popcorn, mini fridge and parking were all included. (Ah, and if you wander by at the right time, the mini cupcakes in the lobby are lovely.) The bed was very comfortable. The Service was friendly. So... why not 5 stars? We were there for four nights and I was able to access the "Free WIFI" once for about ten minutes, despite numerous tries. I found this ironic in Seattle. They do have ethernet, but I did not bring the dongle needed, since they had "Free WIFI", When I inquired, the front desk personnel seemed well acquainted with this problem and were even able to cite the max number of connections available on their "Free WIFI". I suggest that they only advertise "intermittent Free WIFI" or resolve the issue. In short, stay there, you won't regret the hotel choice, just bring your ethernet cable.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: K8MN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with our two kids and loved it. The decor is modern and fun. The front desk staff was very friendly. We could walk to the Experience Music Project and the Space Needle, as well as lots of restaurants, but also had a car and the parking was easy and secure. Plus, free wifi! We love the pineapple theme - especially the free pineapple cupcakes in the afternoon. I would definitely stay here again if I'm back in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonnefov
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in good location Room very clean and most comfortable bed ever Staff helpful and price good Only negative size of parking garage and spaces

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: the2lcs
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly...rooms were clean and large. Great location for downtown and the parking was great. The only thing it seemed to be missing was a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Minoakafl
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. The decor is beautiful, classy and hip. Parking was free!! Spacious room and rather large bathroom ( with a great blowdryer). Located a few blocks from the space needle and close to many theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Meet me at the Pineapple! I loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dcolumbus3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days on our way to Olympic NP, and decided to come back for one last night at the end of our trip rather than stay at an airport hotel. This place has great furnishings and is very new and clean. It feels like your artsy friend's apartment you're staying in rather than a hotel. The room has a huge bathroom, flat screen TV, coffee maker, microwave,and fridge so is very convenient if you don't want to eat out for every meal. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood just a few blocks from the Space Needle and monorail, so is very easy to get around the city. The hotel staff is excellent and very helpful (they printed out bus stop directions so we could get to Washington University). Although there's no restaurant, it's close to a grocery store and other restaurants. Free parking is another big bonus, and I didn't mind the free afternoon coffee and mini cupcakes. If you're feeling adventurous, take the train from the airport to Westlake, and from there take the monorail to the Space Needle. From there it's about 5 blocks to the Maxwell; not too bad if you have carry-on luggage and will save you about $35 over taking the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place and worth staying.”
Reviews.Author: SKBC2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Our room was fairly spacious, up-to-date, and clean. We tried out the pool and it was small but adequate. We liked having the underground parking garage, and although we were warned by staff that the spots may fill up quickly over the weekend, we never had trouble with it. Our only true complaint was the front desk staff. The few times we had a question or otherwise had to deal with them, they seemed a little less than helpful. I'd say the front desk staff was overall young and not the most skilled in customer service. But other than that small complaint, we were very happy with our stay and will likely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pineapple cupcakes and gorgeous rooms make up for lackluster service and WiFi”
Reviews.Author: wandersmuch
Reviews.Content: Was here for three days on a business trip, and as a huge fan of cute boutique hotels, the Maxwell's cute-as-a-button rooms were a great treat, as was the location to yummy restaurants. Free parking was a nice treat, and even came late at night and could still find a spot, and free cupcakes always equal a good time! I was pretty disappointed by the service, however-- my business trip was completely dependent on wireless work, and the majority of my stay it did not work, be it in the lobby or in my room, and when I called to discuss options, the receptionist was very rude and unhelpful; he cited the newness of the place in possibilities for a struggling network, but I shouldn't have to walk to Starbucks at 5am to do work in 2011, and a smile and some sympathy goes a long way in helping out a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel punching well above 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: burukku16
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel punches well above its weight when it comes to star ratings. It's rated 3.5, but could easily be a 4 or 4.5 with all it has to offer (I think the only thing holding back this hotel in terms of its star rating is that it's missing an on-site restaurant and/or bar). Our room and the bathroom were huge and easily accommodated four adults. Both were stylish and sleek while at the same time cozy. We loved amenities like the walk-in shower and pillow-top mattresses (to die for!). The hotel's quirky decor gives it a boutique feel. It manages to be modern, plush and sophisticated without being pretentious or sacrificing comfort. Little touches, such as free coffee in the lobby and mini cupcakes appearing alongside on more than one occasion, a private 'business center' with computers and free internet access (and printing!), the pillow-top mattresses (so good they’re worth mentioning again) and free microwave popcorn in the room made our stay even more enjoyable. The staff at the front desk also were amazing and well worth mentioning. Every person we interacted with was very knowledgeable and able to answer all our questions quickly. In terms of location, the Maxwell Hotel is conveniently situated just north of the Seattle Center where you have easy access to the monorail to get downtown. The neighborhood around the hotel is nice (despite the ugly concrete parking garage across the street) and there is a plethora of bars, cafes, restaurants and shops within a couple blocks walking distance. Trendy Queen Anne Avenue, for example, with its great selection of restaurants, is only about four blocks away (check out Toulouse Petit for a Creole/New Orleans twist to your breakfast and Peso's Kitchen and Lounge next door for a Mexican feast). I’d very highly recommend this gem of a hotel if you’re planning to visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: uknowthename
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of 1st time tourists to Seattle I was originally looking for a hotel near The (Pike Place) Market. The high prices & lack of vacant rooms forced me to look further away (I'm glad I did). The Maxwell Hotel was the perfect home base for our 6 nights in Seattle. Our room was clean, cool & comfortable. The Hotel staff were pleasant & helpful. The AAA room rate, free parking & free wireless internet were big pluses. The hotel is a short walk from the City Center (Space Needle, EMP ect.) and Toulouse Petit which has an amazing breakfast happy hour. The most incredible view of Seattle at Kerry Park was just a few blocks away by car. In the end I was very happy that I chose The Maxwell Hotel as it provided us with a nice peaceful place to rest at night (a stark contrast to the loud & busy market area).

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: pwoods1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel loved staying here. Room was the best we stayed in during our trip to America just the right amount of space for 3 people. Could not see nay faults and the price was very reasonable for the quality. Not downtown but very handy for the Space needle and the monorail. We did walk into town but it took about 30 mins. From the hotel we walked to Union Lake for a restaurant. On the map it looks easy but the road parallel to the lake is very hard to cross. We had to walk a good way up the road to find a foot bridge over this very busy road. If in Seattle make sure you do the underground tour it is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Cool ambience and terrific location!!”
Reviews.Author: Liza T
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this hotel. The hotel has a cool ambience and terrific location. This is a family friendly hotel steps away from Seattle Centre. The kids loved the complimentary craft cart and pool. We will stay here again when we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Find ...”
Reviews.Author: nicoda49
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the reviews & my expectations wer surpassed. Large King Room ... clean, stylish, comfortable, friendly & helpful, even good coffee in the lobby!Outstanding value for your money. I also liked this location. Near the Seattle Center, Space Needle and a quick monorail ride to downtown. The Queen Anne neighborhood also offers, resturants, bars, a nearby Metro Market and the wonderful Toulouse Petite for breakfast, diner, or drinks! This hotel was a real find ...

Reviews.Title: “Quirky cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wuntyme
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights and it was more than expected. Good price and a great location. They have spent quite a bit of time and money to create a interior look that I had not seen before with mismatched carpets, wall paintings and furniture which worked well. The staff were great and there is even a nice little hole in the window for snacks and coffee. The rooms are large and the shower was the business.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: lzuckerm
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly stylish considering the reasonable prices. We liked the hard wood floors and view of the Space Needle. It was a good jumping off point for Seattle's main sites with good public transportation access.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Chico_malo45
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, just behind the Space Needle but a good walk from the hustle and bustle of downtown Seattle. Can't find flaws with this hotel other than the fact that when I booked, I requested a king bed and was given 2 doubles instead. The cleanliness of the establishment and spacious rooms made it all worthwile, however.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to Everything and MUCH better than most !!”
Reviews.Author: Lauder_Calgary
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Maxwell and quite enjoyed the room, the ambience and the people. We were greeted by Adriel, who checked us in and was extremely knowledgeable about the area and Seattle in general. The hotel is well situated just outside of downtown, a couple blocks from the Space Needle and Aeattle center, right across the street from Teatro Zinzanni and a short walking distance from a network of restaurants and a grocery Mart. The only thing better than the location, is the hotel itself. The rooms are spacious, clean and quiet and decked out with a big screen LG tv and a dvd player (dvd's can be borrowed from the front desk library). The hotel is decked out with modern furnishings and great colours. The wifi Internet is fast, and the parking is not as 'limited' as noted in other reviews (about 100 stalls). A fantastic find that will have us back. NB- regarding the 'overrated' review below. I was at the front desk when the gentleman was there. He was treated with much respect and consideration, in fact I was impressed with how Jacob handled the situation. He found the guest another room quickly, and worked hard to satisfy a client that was simply looking for more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: beaucat
Reviews.Content: Within blocks of the space needle. Very friendly staff. Comfortable beds and bedding. Sophisticated yet colorful decor.

Reviews.Title: “OVERRATED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jas034
Reviews.Content: Not what I expected. Decided to stay here because of the excellent reviews. First I was disappointed when I entered the lobby. It was missing the ambiance of a four star hotel. Next, after checking in, unpacking, and returning from a day at the Seattle Center, our air conditioning was not working. I callled the front desk and they sent a repairmen. He was unable to fix it so we went to the front desk to inform them that I needed another room. Jacob at the front desk was very apologetic and said hewould be able to get us some breakfast vouchers or discount the room for our troubles. But after calling his manager, Tyler, he said that he was told just to give us another room because we already had a good rate. So me and my wife, after a busy day out in town, had the pleasure of packing up us and two teenagers, moving to another room, and upacking all for the fun of it. Cute little hotel but not up to the standards of the top hotels. Not what I expected!

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Melissa
Reviews.Content: The boutique hotel added to our first trip to Seattle. The hotel is just two short blocks walking distance from the Space Needle and the EMP. From here you can take the mono-rail for $2 into the city centre. The room was lovely, very modern and large. Soft furnishings added to the comfort in and contemporary design of the room. Staff were very friendly especially Adriel at the front desk. She gave us lots local tips that very spot on, from places to eat and entertainment for night time. Free coffee/tea and delicious lemon cupcakes in the entrance hall was a lovely touch. It's a hotel with the 'wow' factor.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rasmus H
Reviews.Content: It doesn't look like much from the outside, and the street is a bit of a dump, but once you enter the hotel, you are greeted by a huge and beautiful lobby with a very trendy and modern feel to it. The service is great and felt very professional. My room was also very nice. Great décor and it felt very 'fresh' and new. Indeed, the hotel hasn't been around for that long, so everything still has that new car feel to it. The bathroom in particular was gorgeous and spacious. While I could see the Space Needle from my room, there wasn't much of a view outside of that. You have a huge parking structure right across the street. The hotel is located close to the Seattle Center which is pretty convenient. There's also a large 24hr supermarket and 7-11 close by, as well as several restaurants and a few shops. The room had a huge bed and large LCD TV with many channels, including HBO. The Wi-Fi was also fairly good. Nothing to complain about! The Maxwell is a great, modern, hotel in Seattle and feels very luxurious for the rate.

Reviews.Title: “high quality no frills boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: davecheesecake
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel if you want to have a high quality base for exploring Seattle. This is a boutique hotel with limited services available but if you don't plan to spend your time in Seattle cooped up in a hotel then this is a perfect base to explore a great city. The rooms are really nicely decorated and the hotel is spotlessly clean and has a very modern and relaxed feel. Free wifi a nice bonus. About a 20 minute (pleasant) walk into central Seattle/fish market etc, with space needle and monorail station even nearer note - if you are expecting to use the pool for some exercise you will struggle, it is tiny!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Sprattman65
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 on vacation in the Pacific Northwest (M, D, 16yr boy, 14yr girl). We were trying to figure out if we wanted to stay downtown, on the waterfront or at the Maxwell and were not sure if it was too far out of the way. It was in the PERFECT spot. The Maxwell is located just North of the EMP and the Space Needle and in a very pleasant neighborhood that had a cool vibe. We started our walk around Seattle from here and it was the perfect location to get to the Waterfront, then up through Pike Market, then up to downtown for some shopping. After shopping, we hopped on the Monorail to get back to the EMP and Needle and enjoyed the time there. After this, we hit a close by restaurant and then it was a quick walk back to the hotel. Great price, 2 queen beds, spacious room, great location, great perk ($20 coffee shop, 4 one way monorail tickets). Got a passcode to stay at a discount in the future. Great experience and my wife and my kids were very pleased with my choice to stay at the "Pineapple". Note cost from airport in a Town Car was $50. From Maxwell to airport was $42.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: MauraIllinois
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed. The location was perfect for us - just a few blocks to Seattle Center and the Space Needle, as well as the Monorail which we took to Pike's Market. The front desk staff was so pleasant and helpful. The rooms are so clean - we loved the wood floors and the decor. They did not look like the typical hotel rooms.. It was nice to have a little refrigerator and microwave. and even microwave popcorn. The beds were so comfortable and we really liked the big walk-in shower. We really appreciated the free parking. The pineapple emblem on the doormat was very indicative of the welcome we received there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sydralls
Reviews.Content: This hotel was across the street from Seattle Center. It was very easy to get around and see all the sites by walking and taking public transportation. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The "Aria" room was nice and clean and the perfect size for a couple. It had a microwave and fridge which was a nice addition. There was a free parking garage under the hotel and there were always plenty of spaces. The only downside was the tiny workout room and pool. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel; we loved everything about it.”
Reviews.Author: love2travel702
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel turned our first Seattle visit into a "let's come back here again" experience. The free parking and convenient location allowed us to experience the area by foot. The hotel is nestled in lower Queen Anne, just a few short blocks walking distance from the Space Needle. The beds were soft & comfortable; and the hard wood floors & tiled bathroom made the room much cleaner than traditional carpeting. The lobby's contemporary decor was conducive to casual lounging & relaxing after walking all day in the nearby Seattle Center. As we sat in the spacious lobby, we enjoyed complimentary pineapple mini cupcakes and a reasonably-priced latte. All the staff were friendly and knowledgeable each time a guest asked for recommendations or directions. We especially noted the area was safe & quiet to walk around; even at night. It was more than we expected and will absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A true delight”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Glynis
Reviews.Content: Maxwell staff are very friendly, helpful and efficient. Regrettably no breakfast capability at the hotel but there are endless options outside the hotel within a few minutes walk. Rooms are spacious and clean and the afternoon bottomless coffee pot and cup cakes is a welcome pleasure when returning from a long day enjoying Seattle. Downtown Seattle and the Pike Market are easily walkable (about 20 minutes) and the hotel fits neatly into the $32 fixed price taxi ride to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Sedins
Reviews.Content: one of the best things about the hotel, especially in seattle, is the free parking! i have had tons of bad experience parking just about anywhere and its a nice change. the lobby was different, the rooms were clean and nice. everything had a different feel than an ordinary chain hotel. I was here a couple months after its opening and i got a good price for it. it is probably a lot more expensive than the price i remember paying. this spot is also a pretty good location. you can take a train/tram downtown so you save yourself money parking downtown. you can just walk and hangout without having to woryr about the car. the tram is quick and is actually pretty good in terms of view.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel with a Resonable Price-Tag!”
Reviews.Author: ziasunbird
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Seattle (where I have stayed at 5 different ones) and I always try to come back here. The front desk staff is professional yet friendly, and after a couple of visits they remember who you are. The rooms are "modern" meaning no wall to wall carpeting on the floor, just nice dark wood and a small rug next to the bed - much cleaner! Bathrooms are sleek and modern with a huge walk-in shower (but no tub in any of the rooms I have stayed in; might be an issue if you travel with young children, or maybe they do have rooms with a tub and I've just never been assigned one). Housekeeping maintains the rooms to a high standard. One side of the hotel faces the Space Needle, so if you can get a room on that side, great! The hotel has no restaurant; there is a little nook near reception where you can buy coffee/ other drinks and pastries and perhaps a bit more, and that is open 24/7. The rooms have a refrigerator and microwave and a Keurig coffee-maker, so I just buy a muffin and fruit and yoghurt and have breakfast in my room the next morning - don't have to dress for that either! The hotel has a small pool and a fitness center, no spa that I am aware of. The neighborhood is quiet and very near everything at the Seattle Center, two blocks away. Public transportation is about 3 blocks away, and the hotel has its own parking lot if you are driving, though this is quite small and gets filled up early on. If you stay more than once, ask for the "frequent visitor" rate, which they call "WOW"; it shaves a good bit off the price of the rooms. And the hotel often runs promotions offering one free night if you stay a total of 3 or more, particularly in the winter months. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lawtonjl2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two days prior to an Alaskan Cruise. From the airport you can save money and take the Light Rail and Monorail to arrive two blocks away from this hotel. The room was a joy to stay in...large queen beds, fresh linens, wooden floors, coffee and popcorn. The front desk staff was excellent and very accomodating. We mentioned that we may need a "cab" to the port for our cruise and it was written down and confirmed for us. Located two blocks from Seattle Center and the Space Needle. We enjoyed the local area and were in town for the " Taste of Seattle"..yum

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: Lara2885
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Maxwell Hotel on the last leg of our Washington state trip. We stayed for three nights, and had a wonderful experience. Upon check-in, Adriel (the girl with flowers in her hair) was so helpful. She answered all of my questions (both at check-in and repeatedly throughout our stay) about where to eat, things to do, transportation, etc. She, and the rest of the staff, left a lasting impression about the hotel. The room itself was nice, spacious, and modern, with the comforts of home. The bathroom did not have a tub, but I expected that from the information on the website when I booked the room. We also enjoyed the complimentary on-site parking. The only problem we had was the loud people who stayed above us. We constantly heard them walking around (they seriously sounded like elephants). I am not sure if this was due to the hardwood floors in the rooms, or if the people were truly inconsiderate. Regardless, this only happened in the evenings, and did not affect our sleep at night. Overall, a wonderful place, and I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “New, modern, large and quiet”
Reviews.Author: ExSpec5
Reviews.Content: Located a wee bit off the downtown Seattle beaten path (in the lower Queen Anne District), the Maxwell is fairly new (three years old, I think), modern and very comfortable. The rooms are large, as are the bathrooms, which feature walk-in showers. Good value, too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: spabdolphin
Reviews.Content: We were coming down to Seattle to watch the Manchester United match against the Sounders with our 9 month old. Our first stay at this hotel and let me tell you it was fantastic. The hotel room was spacious and beautifully decorated. The bathrooms are huge with a walk in shower. The beds were comfy, honestly couldn't find anything wrong with this one. The hotel lobby is huge and it's nice just to look at all the paintings and artwork. Friendly enough staff, we would definitely stay here again. Oh yeah, it's close to the Concert stage and also the skytrain into town. Lots to see around this area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: wildthing_50
Reviews.Content: Excellent across the board! Great rooms, excellent location, good prices for downtown Seattle, free underground parking, what more is there to say! Loved the ala cart trays they offer; we had the mobile notebook complete with printer and supplies, while our daughter and grandson had the toy cart with crayons and stuff. Wonderful concept wish more hotels offered such a great idea. Wood floors we had heard about on Trip Advisor so we asked for rooms on the top floor. THANKS to whomever posted that review. It not only made me a trip advisor fan and member, but it improved the quality of our stay. Meet you at the Pineapple!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that we found from reviews here”
Reviews.Author: tvmovielover50
Reviews.Content: As said, the hotel is very close to the Space Needle (nice view at night), good small restaurants, and a longish walk or quicker monorail ride downtown. Our room was nice with view of side street. There are two Thai restaurants close by, the one across the street and down must be the good one-the one next door was not. On Mercer a block away, there are two huge supermarkets one two blocks left and one two blocks right that have everything you might want organic or conventional. We went to Olympic National Park from here-it is easy to access the highway for a trip elsewhere. We would stay here again and recommend it to friends. One caveat-due to weather, we arrived in the middle of the night with a small map to guide our rental car to the hotel (free parking is a real asset and we always got a space though the hotel was pretty full). There are many one way streets in the area and it takes about 15 extra minutes to get going the right way if your instructions are not adequate. Coming off route 5 from the airport at Mercer, go right on Mercer to Denny or call for instructions ahead of time!

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: veredka
Reviews.Content: a nice hotel with free parking, free wifi, microwave (complimentry popcorne), complimentry computer (!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, elegant, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Panhvtinmi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights on business. The room was spacious, with all of the comforts I associate with the most thoughtfully planned hotels: good and abundant lighting, drapes, climate control, toiletries, a pod-style coffeemaker (with mini half and halfs in the refrigerator instead of those awful artificial creamers!), an outlet over the desk, and free, dependable wireless Internet access. On the second morning, I went down to the front desk dressed to run and asked if it was safe. The person on desk duty at 5:15 AM not only assured me that it was, but pulled out a map and showed me exactly how to get from the hotel down to the pedestrian paths along the waterfront. The Maxwell is located about one block from the Seattle Center, with all of the major performance venues. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: hondo001
Reviews.Content: On first glance, one is not quite sure if this will be a good family hotel. There is no complimentary breakfast, no restaurant or bar, and the snack shop is really just some goodies behind a counter that the front desk staff also mans. But the hotel is clean and the look is modern. The rooms are comfortable and are a mix of uber-modern and art deco - as are the common areas. No room service available, but lots of eating places within walking distance. You can also walk to the Seattle Center and the Space Needle, while downtown and Pikes Market are 10 minutes by car. Therefore, the room rates are lower than downtown but you are in easy reach of all the attractions and shopping. Worth a repeat on return visits to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for location and price”
Reviews.Author: Rebeccainlv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night, prior to our Alaska cruise. I had arranged a town car pick up through the hotel to get us from the airport. This was a flat rate of $50 (paid at drop off). There was a small issue with waiting on the driver to get gas instead of being ready to pick us up immediately, but it wasn't a big deal. Easier than calling a taxi. The ride to the hotel was about 20 minutes on the highway. Check in at the hotel was easy, although they didn't mention that I had booked the pre-cruise package which includes transportation to the pier the next day. I had to inquire about that and arrange pick up time. The package also included 2 breakfast sandwiches and specialty coffees from the coffee stand in the lobby. Overall, this hotel is beautiful. Very clean, elegant and contemporary. The room is large with wood floors, fridge and Kuerig coffee maker. Included is bottled water and K-cups for coffee and tea. Linens are high quality, soft and fluffy. The bed is a soft pillow top. The hotel is located in Queen Anne. It's about a 10 minute walk to the Space Needle. We walked all the way to Pike's Place and that is quite a walk but good exercise. It took about 2 1/2 hrs to walk round trip plus walk through the market (didn't have time to browse much though). Practically next door to the hotel is a Pub with good burgers and microbrew beers. The truffle tater tots are also good.They do have happy hour specials and they are open until late. Prices are reasonable. This hotel is worth the price. It's well located and room is very nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on a cloud”
Reviews.Author: chrispyfire
Reviews.Content: Being a travel agent myself it is very important to have a good location to visit and stay. My husband and I took a cruise to Alaska and we wanted to stay in Seattle to relax before our long journey back to the east coast we had the privilege of staying at the Maxwell hotel in downtown Seattle. What a great hotel!!!! It was within walking distance to the space needle, the duck tours, and the music and science museum. The beds where heaven we actually asked what kind of bed it was so we can go home and get one. The hotel was clean and very friendly for both pets and people. It was modern but elegant. Location was very clean. The pool was great for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Courtesy Bicycles”
Reviews.Author: drmo717
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell before our Alaskan Cruise. We had two days in Seattle. The Maxwell is very contemporary and that was fine. It's location near the Space Needle was great to walk around the area. There was some good breakfast places and a nice bar with local beers right next door. The Queen Anne district was good to explore. The best part, however, was that they offered courtesy bicycles. Seattle is very bike friendly. There are some hills, but almost always there are bike paths around. We were able to explore Fremont and the Ballard area and the locks so much more extensively because of the bicycles. Their bus system is wonderful also to get to these areas but the bikes made it so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovesaz25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are staying here now and we really like it. Great places to visit and go eat right in the neighborhood. Nice to have the parking for free! Also we lived the coffee and popcorn that was in the room. Beautiful hotel, big room!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: travelinhillbilly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Maxwell for a vacation and it was a great choice. The location is quiet, but within easy walking distance of the Space Needle and the Monorail, which is a cool and short ride to downtown. The rooms are trendy and clean with some great amenities. Our door's internal security lock somehow became loose and actually prevented us from entering the room. The manager was able to open it and moved us into a different room with views of the Space Needle. It is great to look out and enjoy the view at night. There is also a great Thai restaurant just down the block as well as other eats nearby. I would stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay a the Maxwell.”
Reviews.Author: pjc320
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maxwell July 11th-13th. We enjoyed our stay very much. We arrived early on monday checked our bags and headed over to the Space needle park to do some site seeing the hotel staff called us as soon as our room was ready, This gave us time to unpack and change for a 3:30 appointment we had. The room was very well decorated the bed comfortable. We requested a space needle view and we were given a room on the 3rd floor facing the space needle, unfortunitly due to the parking garage accross the street the space needle is the only thing you can see.The location was very convient, a short 6 minute walk and we were at the space needle $2.00 for the monorail ride and we were in the heart of down town seattle. We also rode the mono rail to downtown caught the light rail to the airport for a total of $6.00 per person. The room was very quiet and comfortable the staff pleasent and helpful, we will stay at the Maxwell the next time we are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Boutique.....Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jtssea
Reviews.Content: Perfect for Seattle Center exploring, clean,comfortable beds, huge lobby w chic furnishings, pool, free parking which is unheard of in Seattle(most hotels charge $40+), also free bike rentals. I live south of city but stay here when I am n town late for shows, parties etc. I have recommended this to numerous out of town visitors who loved this place. Note it is not right in hub of downtown but a long walk or short cab. It is however right next to the Space Needle. Right out front door in all directions are great restaurants, pubs, coffee shops and stores. The Duck tour is super close too. We really like this place. Only quirk is showers are walk in with no shower door and rooms only average size...but u are there to explore great city of Seattle! (Walk to.these places : cafe lladro for espresso, Crow for casual gourmet dinner, Dicks for a cheap burger, McMENNAMINS for craft brew and pub food, and Tolouse Petite for breakfast, lunch, dinner or famous huge happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “great decor, relaxed ambiance, wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: mamamia46
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get away from the usual Holiday Inn /Best Western etc. routine and out of the downtown core but close enough to use transit. The Maxwell fit the bill. Our room (we were upgraded without asking - thank you!) was very spacious, great beds, wonderful bathroom. Initially we were not too pleased that there was no restaurant for breakfast. However, there is a great market almost next door where you can pick up any kind of bread, cheese, fruit, yoghurt etc. And with the in-room fridge and microwave, not to mention the Keurig coffeemachine, it worked out perfectly for us. Nice touch with the complimentary mini-cupcakes and cofffee in the reception area and free newspaper at your door in the morning. The friendliest housekeepers around. Spaceneedle a ten-minute walk, where the monorail takes you right downtown. Others have commented on not finding free parking underground. We always found a space in the 3 days we were there. I would say the only negative was hearing the upstairs guests' every footstep on the wooden (albeit a lovely) floor. By the way, if you have a car and time, go visit the Bellevue Museum of Art. Great contemporary art. If you have even more time, go to the sunday Freemont fleamarket.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish with good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tartan69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a quiet area, near the Childrens & Music museum. It is very stylish with large rooms and a small pool/gym. Free parking great Make sure you ask for a room away from the elevator though as ours was next to it and all I could hear was a loud 'biiiiing' whilst I was trying to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Neighborhood Niche”
Reviews.Author: TheTripTroupe
