Reviews.Content: The Maxwell deserves a look. It is hip, modern and fresh. The rooms are comfortable with bare floors (no one elses gradu on the floor), and VERY comfortable beds. The decor is fun. The location is convenient to Seattle Center, while making you feel like you are living in the urban vibe. Nice cupcakes and coffee on Sat. afternoon. Krups machines in room. Front desk staff was helpful and served as the go to. No concierge on staff. Night crew never spoke or looked up as we entered the hotel, even though one must walk right by. Still, it is a super family hotel with a smallish indoor pool and tiny fitness center. One note, there is no view, so if you want to see the city from your hotel room choose a high rise.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean an well laid out hotel. Close to tourist attractions and local transport.”
Reviews.Author: IndiaRob
Reviews.Content: Does lack a restaurant but plenty of options within 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: dbsanders
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to stay downtown, then this is a good option. Very friendly service, and walk to the Space Needle, EMP, Children's Museum (not great) and ride the Duck. Also walked to the monorail station, which goes to Westlake Center (mall) and a good food court. Got a great Expedia deal on this one, cheaper than going direct.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2011Marg
Reviews.Content: We initially booked two nights in the Maxwell but due to flight delays had to reduce the booking to one night. Upon arrival after a 33 hour flight schedule, the reservation staff realized they had cancelled our booking all together. They rectified this and we were allocated a lovely room beautifully appointed with a very comfortable bed. Everything about this hotel was lovely and the staff were very friendly. Everything was spotlessly clean. The Maxwell has a complementary shuttle service downtown which we took, but Downtown is also walking distance if you are feeling energetic. They have complimentary petite cakes in the afternoon which was an added bonus as I used one as my husband’s birthday cake. This hotel thoroughly deserves its ‘trip advisors’award and I would definitely recommend it and stay again when next in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay at The Maxwell will not be our last.”
Reviews.Author: TheBuhrs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary last weekend and booked a trip to Seattle. I have been to Seattle a handful of times and have stayed at various hotels. I can't say that I was overly impressed with any of them. For this trip, I wanted to try something new. I saw The Maxwell while searching hotels.com and was instantly sold! The Maxwell is very conveniently located, only a half mile to the Space Needle and just a few blocks from some great dining options. Free parking in a secured garage was also a major selling point. We especially liked the overall vibe of the hotel. It is very colorful and comfortable. The rooms are very clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. The walk in shower was great and the vanity lighting was better than expected. Our room, #438, had a great view of the space needle. Service at the front desk exceeded our expectations. Check in and Check out were both very quick. The staff were able to answer questions and show us on a map how to get to particular restaurants and atractions. All of the employees were very friendly. The housekeeping staff were always nice. We will absolutely stay here again! There are only a couple of things that could be improved. First, the swimming pool is very shallow. It is only 4 ft deep at the deep end. Second, there were often housekeeping carts left along the hallway. They took away from the overall polished appearance of the hotel. Third, the batteries in our DVD player remote were dead.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: kenk10
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, very cozy, clean and friendly atmosphere! The staff at the front desk was very helpful when we asked directions or were in need for some ideas to explore the area. The hotel's location is very good to explore all of Seattle, public transport or a taxi can get you everywhere in a short time.. It was also fun to enjoy the free cupcakes and coffee they served in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: laura714
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at The Maxwell Hotel in June and it was FAN-tastic! We had been travelling for a few weeks already (trains,planes, cabins, lodges) and wanted to end our trip with a city experience and a bit more luxury, and The Maxwell fit the bill perfectly. They also let us in on a great deal, as when we had booked our three night stay a few months prior, we saw the 3rd night free promotion, but it was expiring in May. Oh, well...we booked our three nights anyway. When we checked in, we were told that they had extended the 3rd night free offer, so that was super nice (they could easily have not mentioned it, or said it was for new reservations only!) . This hotel seems like it is employee-owned, because all of the staff are so genuinely helpful, friendly and accomodating---from the front desk to the housekeepers to the shuttle bus driver. That was another unexpected perk, by the way---a free shuttle that guests can use during select hours and within so many miles---very nice! We had the driver take us to the REI flagship store, which is a destination in itself---we could have walked as it turned out, but wanted to save our legs for hours of walking ahead of us. Back to The Maxwell itself----we really enjoyed being in the Queen Anne neighborhood, rather than in the heart of the tourist area downtown. It is still very convenient and close to the heart of downtown Seattle, yet is in an authentic neighborhood-----with the steep hills rising from Roy Street, it was reminiscent of San Francisco. We loved the close proximity of many good local restaurants,bars,a great grocery store up the street and it is just a good walking neighborhood as well. We felt like we could have been paying about $100 more (closer to $300) for the service, amenities, great bedding, beautiful room and good view that we were getting. We really appreciated the good coffee service in the room, and even a refrigerator, which many nicer hotels certainly don't offer you. It was great to be able to keep a few breakfast items like yogurt and juice at hand, as well as a chilled bottle of wine and some cheese! We didn't miss not having a bar or cafe in the hotel as you just have to step out the door and you can find whatever you need. (They do have a coffee bar in the lobby, as well as those delicious pineapple cupcakes and coffee in the afternoon). Thank you Maxwell Hotel for making us feel cared for and comfortable. We loved our stay with you and wished we could have stayed a week! We highly recommend you and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Must stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: sainter_3165
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old daughter and i came to Seattle to see WWE Over the Limit on May 22. We stayed at the Maxwell for three nights and it was great. At check-in a lovely woman told us about places to eat and what was nearby. we proceeded to our room. the hotel is very nice and bright. There was a reading area in the lobby with couches and books to read. our room was great. it was a good sized room with a heater and a nice bathroom. the beds were amazing and warm... the lobby has a coffe machine set up and cupcakes. overall the was no down side to the hotel. and the pool was ok too :) if we ever go back to seattle. we will definatley stay here

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Maxwell”
Reviews.Author: Grandma0352
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location and was very pleasant to stay in. Clean room and spacious, good coffee (Keurig) in the room, free parking, good maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Great Price, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Alberta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and very funky in it's style and decor. You will love the modern feel and the unique furniture and decoration. My room was spacious and had lovely extras like a Krups coffee maker and a mini-fridge as well as an ipod docking station and dvd player. There isn't a bathtub but the shower is huge and I didn't miss the tub. We got a great low price on Hotwire but probably due to this, we got a room that overlooked the parking lot. I understand views are much better at the front of the hotel so it's something to request if you are so inclined. The pool was pretty small and there wasn't a hot tub as far as I could see which would have been a nice feature. The Staff here is AWESOME. I can't express enough how polite, friendly and helpful they were. I stay in a lot of hotels and this staff was the best I've seen. They were so eager to help. They all offered helpful suggestions and took extra time to explain how to get places, where their favourite restaurants are and to get us some extra coffee. We had a minor problem with our deadbolt not working and a man was sent up right away to address it. He had to come back with tools and asked when the best time would be so as not to bother us. This is more than I can say for many other hotels. The lobby has coffee available all day and little cup cakes that were very tasty. The lobby is beautiful and funky and usually very quiet and I saw people just chilling out and chatting over a bottle of wine while sitting in the comfy chairs. The location is pretty good. Lots of restaurants near by and it's about a 2 min walk to the Monorail that will take you within blocks of Pike Place Market. We went to the theatre down town and it was a 8 dollar cab ride back. The neighbourhood isn't super great for walking around, but you are right across from the Space needle so there was plenty going on over there, and as I said, you just jump on the Monorail for $2 and you're in the heart of the shopping and action. You could probably stay closer to the shopping area but you would definitely pay way more & you probably dont get parking included which this hotel did have. Finally, there is no restaurant here but we found 3 great ones within walking distance thanks to the amazing staff. I would highly recommend staying here as long as you don't mind a monorail ride to get to the market and are willing to venture out for meals.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LosReyes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for the U2 concert. I had read great things about this hotel and was pleased to find they were all true. The room was great. It was clean, modern and very spacious. Parking was free,a great bonus in this town. There was a pool, looked clean but I did not have a chance to use it, The work out room was tiny. I preferred to go out for a run rather than use it.The only negative thing to report is one day, despite the "Do not disturb" sign on the door, housekeeping opened the door and woke us up very early.The staff working the desk were very helpful and courteous. When checking out we mentioned this incident. They were very apologetic and deducted $50.00 off our stay.My wife says the only thing she would have liked to have seen is a restaraunt or lounge in the hotel. The location was good, it was within walking distance of grocery, stores, restaraunts and small shops. Just don't eat at the Mcminmins on the corner. Great for a few beers, but lousy food.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Hip”
Reviews.Author: XinAn
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two daughters, 10 and 8 as part of a precruise package.I did choose it due to the price and the reviews on line. We arrived in the rain on an early flight and were hoping like some of the reviews that we would be able to check in early. No such luck. The staff appeared somewhat clueless and confused. However, I did notice they were much nicer to older couples with out children. Maybe that was my clue that the place was just too hip for children. However, I've stayed at two placed owned by Joie De Vive in California and they are what I would call hip. Not this place. And they were nice to my children. From a a first time in Seattle person I felt I had arrived in nowhere land although that could have been the rain. The staff sent us down to a breakfast place that seemed to be the only place in the area open. It was quite good. When we got back I saw the staff checking in people and I went up and asked to be checked in as well. I was told I had a room with a view that was not ready and the other people didn't. At that point the kids and I went exploring and found we really weren't so far from many attractions including the Space Needle. we went on a Duck Tour which was really fun and then got something to eat at a food court that was lively and had music. We got back at 3:00 -check in time. And guess what no room. At 4:00 we checked in. The room was very nice and quite large. Guess what our view was of - the parking garage. I had to laugh by that time and was just glad to be in a room. We enjoyed the in door pool and were the only people in it. I could have gone for a spa - but it was nice anyway. The next day I went down to get the breakfast sandwiches and drinks included in the package. The staff appeared confused about how to handle it but did give me the food and were nice. The transportation to the airport was on time and efficient.. We later came back and stayed at the Inn At the Market. The two experiences were like night and day - but the Inn at the Market is also much more expensive. I don't think I would ever stay here again even though the rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: karenagnew
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor reviews never seem to let me down and this hotel was yet another gem I found on this website. The Maxwell Hotel was clean, spacious, reasonably priced and had friendly front desk staff. The hotel had really funky decor which was colourful and fun! The rooms were not your standard hotel room. They had lots of character. Colourful paintings can be found all over the hotel. The lobby is particularly inviting. The pool area and gym looked clean and well-appointed, but we didn't have time to try it out. We will definitely try to use them next time we stay here. The location was an easy 25 min walk to the main shopping district and market area and was very close to the Space Needle and the EMP. There is a huge but quaint grocery market quite close by where you can get just about anything you need for snacks and drinks. The rooms have microwaves and small refrigerators which are really handy. They even had a package of complimentary microwave popcorn for a late night snack...nice touch. The hotel offers free wireless which our teens fired up with no problems after our busy days on the town. We had no issues with parking as some have stated in their reviews and we were there on a holiday weekend. The car slots are tight, but there were plenty of them to choose from when we stayed. The parking garage is secure and safe. Overall, a great find and we definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JustQuietAndClean
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell is on the border between tourist area and Queen Anne neighborhood. So from the hotel you are a walk from museums, the waterfront, and tourist sites and a beautiful hilly neighborhood with charming houses and great views and neighborhood restaurants. We went to the Seattle Art Museum and waterfront one day, but then ate at neighborhood spots. We also went for walks just up the hill and around Queen Anne just looking at the houses and stopping to look at the views of Mt. Rainer on one side, and the mountain range on the other side. The hotel made a major mistake in our booking - we had signed up for a package that included a 2 hour cruise of the lake, and when we got there they had not purchased the cruise tickets and could not get us onto another. BUT, the way they handled it was inpeccable and left us feeling initially disappointed, of course, but no lasting pain. The manager came up to the room immediately in person, with a bottle of champagne, to personnaly appologize and offered to comp one night of hotel plus arrange for a lovely brunch (on them) on the waterfront the next day. I think the in-person apology and quick response and rearrangement plus the comped night were as good a response as one could hope for, and we appreciated them. Anyone can make a mistake, and they dealt with it very well. If you were booking a package, I would confirm and reconfirm. The Maxwell has hardwood floors which initially sounded good, but actually is a little hard on the feet after a day of walking on pavement. Beds VERY comfortable, nice bathroom with excellent lighting, quiet despite busy neighborhood, free parking. Front desk staff other than the manager were clueless - asked for several tips about the neighborhood and none of them knew anything about the neighborhood. Japanese restaurant? Had to look it up but there was a great one just down the street whcih we found. Desert at night? No clue but there was a coffee and pastry shop right down the street which we found. What restaurants and stores were at the top of the hill? No clue but we walked up and found great stuff. So don't count on the front desk people. If Melonie the Manager is there, she's the only one who knows what's what. Swimming pool and fitness room were small but perfectly adequate, and all machines worked.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: JohnnysWife
Reviews.Content: We only booked one night for flying out the next day. The parking garage was full, but we had no problem parking in the check-in spot. The little tea cakes at the lobby were good while we waited to check-in. The room was large. The bathroom is large also, but does not have a tub. The hotel is walking distance to the Space Needle where the Folks festival took place when we were there. We got to enjoy Seattle in the short amount of time we had thanks to the convenient location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place near Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: nishithvarma
Reviews.Content: By all means this is a great place to stay in Seattle. Very beautiful and well maintained property. Rooms are spacious and very clean. within walking distance to the space needle.Staff is very courteous. Love my stay here with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Even more good stuff”
Reviews.Author: elyette
Reviews.Content: All the good stuff the other reviewers say about this place is true. What's more, the rooms are very quiet and relaxing. They encourage recycling. What a concept! They have coffee in the rooms which is rare these days. Free local telephone calls and parking. The staff is gracious and accommodating. The front desk staff and housekeepers couldn't do enough for the guests. It is was unreal. Guests hung out in comfortable chairs in the lobby like they were in a second home. I would not stay anywhere else if I am near Queen Anne. They have ruined me for other places.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for price”
Reviews.Author: MVFAM
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell is conveniently located and stylish, but was not a good value for the price. We stayed the weekend of the Gay Pride Parade and Festival, which could explain why it was $459 per night, but at that price, we expected better accommodations and service. The "ensemble suite" was small. Basically, it was a rectangular room with two queen beds and a sofabed in a line along the same wall. There was enough space for a nightstand between beds. It was a smaller room than one at an Embassy Suites. There was only one bar of soap in the bathroom, which we didn't realize until stepping in the shower. The maid service was slow: Our room was still not cleaned at 5pm when we stopped by to wash up before going out to dinner. We returned to our room after dinner to find the beds made but bolster pillows still tossed on the wing chair and ottoman the way we had left it. You'd think that for $459/night, they could provide an extra bar of soap and do a 100% job of cleaning instead of an 80% job. We travel quite a bit with our children and have stayed in a whole range of accommodations in many different states and countries, from an adorable B&B in Derbyshire to the W Hotel in Hong Kong. We have a good sense for what a room should be when it gets to near the $500 and up range, and the Maxwell Hotel did not meet this expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort close to the Space Needle and Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: Seraphym13
Reviews.Content: What a great room! Super clean and comfy! It's a bit far from Pike Place, but minutes away from the Space Needle. Wonderfully friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again. Be sure to head over to Peso's on Queen Anne for a scrumptious breakfast! Just ask the front desk to point you in the right direction!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern, spacious......loved it”
Reviews.Author: Squirrel25
Reviews.Content: We were a group of five (two couples and a senior) and booked three rooms for two nights. The hardwood floors were initially worrying but we did not hear any noise from the room above us. The rooms are spacious and well appointed with two large beds, roomy bathroom and a cute little hallway. Beds are very comfy and we were not bothered by noise: either external or internal. It is a short walk to the monorail, space needle and science fiction museum. The monorail offers a quick ride into the city heart although you can walk it if you have more time. Breakfast was abit of a bother as the nearest place was not cooking breakfast on the morning of our first day however we walked a few short blocks in the other direction and had a choice of places including an all American diner that served a top cooked brekky. The rates were very reasonable and we booked directly with the hotel. The Maxwell ticks all the right boxes for a relaxed and upmarket stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Superb accommodations with excellent service"”
Reviews.Author: HOFOhio
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel close to the heart of downtown Seattle and easily within walking distance distance for those in decent physical condition. Our room was wonderfully appointed and laid out with the traveler in mind (fridge, microwave, flatscreen TV). We found the staff to be very pleasant and extremely willing to help in any way to optimize the pleasure of their guests. This was a terrific place to stay (June 23, 2011) and is highly recommended to those looking for convenience and good value - with great comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to the Maxwell and we'll definitely do a third”
Reviews.Author: Mojo-Ravi
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice - both times with kids - and we have found the rooms, amenities and staff to be great. Great location and adequate parking at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. I will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: LTrip_11
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel is a beautiful contemporary hotel set 1 block from the Space Needle. The location is great. You can walk across to the Space Needle and then take a tram to downtown. When I stayed there the hotel was less than a year old. The style is very contemporary with a jazz theme. The colors are bright and the rooms were very clean. The shower is built with a European feel meaning there is no door/curtain. The water does not splash everywhere due to the shower head facing inwards away from where the door would be. The rooms were spacious. It was great to not feel cramped. I stayed with 2 friends for 3 days/2 nights and then stayed for one more night on my own. The rates were very reasonable because they had a coupon through Yelp. I highly recommend this hotel. I felt very safe staying there the additional night by myself. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. When I switched rooms they made sure I got a room with a view of the Space Needle right down the hall which made switching rooms very easy..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but missed a couple of important details”
Reviews.Author: OldGuyfromBay
Reviews.Content: When our family (2 parents + 2 teenage boys) visited Seattle, we decided to branch out from our usual pattern of staying at "family" chains like Homewood or Embassy, and take a chance on the Maxwell. We probably aren't exactly the prime target market for the Maxwell, so please don't take my gripes to mean it is a bad place. The hotel is very pleasant, and conveniently located near Seattle Center. They have free parking, a nice plus. The staff was very helpful. We got a good deal (pay for 2 nights, get a 3rd night free), that helped convince us to give them a try. So far, so good. They do not serve a free breakfast, and their on-site cafe is very minimal. As we made our reservations, we were told there was a breakfast place very close by. But on our first morning, we found it is not open for breakfast. We had to choose between the expensive, nice, Seattlish restaurant down the street, or going to the store & buying our own stuff. We tried both. The staff said they hope a breakfast place will move into the vacant space nextdoor; that would help a lot. Our room was nice & spacious, it had 2 queen beds and the sofa opened up into a fairly good third bed (a necessity for us). But it was all one big room, we missed having a "suite" layout -- when one member of our party was ready to sleep, the others could not talk or read. Also the sound-proofing was OK but not enough to fully block a few loud guests who wandered down the hall at night. On the plus side, there are a lot of cool places within easy walking or public transportation from the Maxwell, and I could see it being an excellent choice for many people.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, spacious, and very nice”
Reviews.Author: Shrubbo
Reviews.Content: I loved the style of the Maxwell Hotel. Modern, fun, hip, and bright. Vibrant colors and thoughtful little touches everywhere. We only stayed one night, but we loved it. Yes, they did temporarily give us the wrong room, but they changed it quickly and got what we had reserved. The room was spacious with a view of Roy Street, meaning we could see the Space Needle (though a higher floor will give a better view). Hardwood floors are nice. The bed was easily one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel. They provided a fancy coffee maker, mini-fridge, and microwave along with complimentary popcorn and bottles of water. There was a large flat-screen TV (but no HD service) along with a DVD player. They had no movies on demand service, but the front desk has a nice selection of DVDs you can borrow for free to watch in your room. A great touch. Wi-Fi is free as well, but the signal wasn't very strong in our room. But hey, it worked, so can't complain. There was also a thoughtful little shelf with a plug next to it, clearly for charging phones and whatnot. Very handy. The bathroom is big with a walk-in shower (no curtain). Parking is free, but they have limited spaces. 100 spaces for 139 rooms. We had no problem parking, but I imagine if you arrived late at night you might have to park elsewhere for a price. Checkout is at noon, which is good if you like sleeping in (but bad if you want to check in early on a day where they're full). Only downside is they have no food. They have a small espresso bar and can make you coffee 24 hours a day, along with pastries, but not fresh, hot food. However, they were happy to provide us menus for all the local restaurants that delivered. And they're within walking distance to a few nice places. Location is a bit outside downtown, but it's a short walk to the Monorail which will take you right into downtown. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't just meet at the Pineapple - stay as well”
Reviews.Author: McArthur3
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel - staff were the friendliest and most helpful we encountered during our trip, which covered 5 other hotels. Staff took us to sightseeing areas in the hotel car - no tip accepted! We were told they were at our disposal and to let them know of any questions or help we needed. Concierge direct phone number given to us to use at any time. The decor in the hotel is great - modern witha funky kind of twist. Rooms are large and well approtioned. Only one very small negative - whilst wooden floors are easy to clean and look good carpet would be better to keep noise down - we were woken up by guest upstairs clipping around in heels! However i would not let this get in the way of using this hotel again as all else more than made up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel near the Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: cchanmen
Reviews.Content: We loved the slightly quirky design of the Maxwell, and stayed in one of their level-5 Duet Queen Hill rooms. Service was friendly, hotel and room were clean and well maintained. Free parking, which can get full. Free wifi, Walking distance to several restaurants. We liked the Bamboo Garden Chinese Vegetarian restaurant just 1 block away on Roy St. We also tried the Banh Thai restaurant, which was ok. Decent sized fitness room, which overlooked the indoor swimming pool. Our wishlist / suggestions for improvements: 1) Self-service Laundry facilities would have been a bonus. 2) Our room was located as far as you could get from the Elevators, and it was quite a walk. Would be nice to have a second set of elevators. 3) We would have wished for a little more manouver room in the basement garage, but free parking is always appreciated. (We were driving a minivan). 4) Boost the wifi connection speeds.

Reviews.Title: “If you're in Seattle, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ZanyLiaw
Reviews.Content: It's a pretty new hotel, the lobby is huge with lots of space for you to hang out, either for reading, watching TV in front of the fire place, or simply just spacing out at the many tables. The amenities are great , free bicycles, free parking, a large 24hr supermarket nearby, many eateries and a bird's eye view of the Space Needle from the room (depending on which side your room is on). The rooms were huge and they had an expresso machine and free popcorn in our rooms! Definitely a great experience. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: scicat
Reviews.Content: I selected the Maxwell Hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. I had never been to Seattle before and was meeting one friend who lives in the area and another friend who was going to be in the area for a college graduation. I had looked at reviews of the hotel that my visiting friend was going to stay in and it was not for me, so I began to search for another hotel close to her. The Maxwell Hotel was exactly what I wanted. It was close to the Space Needle and the monorail and to several casual restaurants. The service could not have been better. The room was large with comfortable beds, large well appointed bathroom with a walk in shower which worked well for me. We did not have a great view, but for this visit to Seattle, which was short, that did not matter. Everything was clean and comfortable and the parking was free. I will definitely choose to stay at the Maxwell Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KLJH54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell for two nights while visiting Seattle for a niece and nephews graduation. We wanted a hotel close to Queen Anne where our family lived and close to Memorial Stadium so we could walk to graduation. The Maxwell Hotel was a great choice. The rooms are larger than most and quite comfortable and very quiet. And the bed--I woke up both mornings never wanting to leave-what a dreamy nights sleep on a Very comfortable mattress! The linens and towels are new and luxurious. And if you do make it out of that dreamy bed--the coffee maker in the room in fabulous! Just insert a Tully's coffee pod into the maker and you have coffee in seconds . No messing with filters and packets--and delicious coffee served in the cutest Maxwell Hotel mug. Heaven! Parking underground and easy access into the hotel. Cupcakes and coffee served in the lobby in the afternoon. We'll be back no matter what part of Seattle we'll be visiting. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: fijihiji
Reviews.Content: I had such a busy schedule in Seattle, I barely got more than a few hours of sleep each night but the two nights I spent at the Maxwell Hotel were very nice anyway. The rooms are clean and large and the bathrooms even more so. They have free internet access and the location is great - not too far from the Space Needle and the staff are very friendly with calling cabs for you. I would recommend booking as soon as possible, as the hotel does seem to fill up fairly quickly. Also, I wasn't exactly pleased with the fact that they don't really serve a traditional hotel breakfast but the Citizen Creperie three blocks from the hotel is excellent (try their banana bread~!) so all-in-all it was okay. Also, they have a QFC three blocks from hotel, too, so, fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Pwrfect”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveler08
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. We could only stay for one night, but will definitely be coming back! Great coffee at the kiosk in the lobby too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location for Seattle Center activities”
Reviews.Author: NW_Earth_Mom
Reviews.Content: Seattle Center is about one mile (and a quick monorail ride) north of the part of downtown Seattle with the Convention Center and Pike Place Market.. The Maxwell is a recently built hotel and it shows - great design and soundproofing and - best of all - spacious rooms. Usually my family (husband, wife, two teenager daughers) feels cramped in a double queen room, but not here. There was just enough extra space to feel so much more comfortable. The style is unique - "Seattle sleek" meets whimsical bright colors and textures. It works well - it feels cool and trendy but not stuffy. Seattle Center is near the Space Needle and several museums. We enjoyed our itnerary of two nights here and two nights in the "main" part of downtown. There are many great restaurants within walking distance of the Maxwell. Although the hotel only has esperesso/snacks,at breakfast, there are some great breakfast places nearby that were recommended by the staff. Service in the hotel was great at both the front desk and among the staff in the hallways. Location is especailly suburb for events at the Key Arena or performing arts center.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bon-Bon Modern Magazine Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mocakes
Reviews.Content: These kids, these design kids with their chartreuses and their scarlets and their polka dots the size of drink coasters! I tell you, these modern kids are leaving their mark all over Seattle, and this Maxwell fellow chose them to design his splendid hotel. Maxwell is a smart hotelier! It was like staying in a Dwell magazine spread. Seriously. Free coffee in the lobby, too. I love the Maxwell Hotel. I regret not stealing a coffee mug from the room. Super-gorgeous, super-modern, with super-comfy beds, a super-nifty shower, soft white towels, and a Seattle location that is very walkable and central, without being too close to the bustle of downtown. PERFECTO!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: KalenaJeanne
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd year at staying at the Maxwell while we attended the Seattle Folklife Festival. Again a great location, great service and ultra convenient. Loved it and have already booked for next year. Hotel was full but room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: carlysuesmom
Reviews.Content: Great property in Seattle. Beautiful rooms, helpful staff, great location, reasonably priced. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Memorial Day Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: monmouthspring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell for the first time over Memorial Day Weekend. We could not have chosen another hotel that would have been any closer to the Folklife festival unless we were sleeping outdoors at the festival. The hotel was also walking distance to several good restaurants. Other pluses: Very, very comfortable beds; a large swimming pool (we went 5 times); easy parking access; cupcakes in the afternoon; a large, beautiful lobby area if you want to meet with folks somewhere other than your room; a refrigerator in the room where you can actually put things. The room are very nice - we had two king beds - great views if you get a corner room. At night we were looking right at the space needle. Staff was very helpful - especially Justin at the front desk. Highly recommend trying this hotel if you haven't done so yet.

Reviews.Title: “Very much enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: the-green-eyed-kri
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel when I had to travel to Seattle from NYC for a friend's wedding. She called off her wedding 2 weeks beforehand, but we still had the plane tickets and hotel booked and paid for, so we decided to just go and enjoy ourselves. We only had a very short stay booked (3 nights and then we were off to Mt. St. Helens and a super cute cottage-but that's for another review), but the hotel was fabulous. Easy to walk to the Space Needle, etc. and then hop on the monorail and walk to the market, pier, etc. (which is exactly what we did), very clean and comfortable. We just loved the look of the place and the staff was very friendly. Would certainly be our first choice in hotel if we end up in Seattle again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SMcBaker
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, unique, hip, CLEAN hotel! Fantastic helpful staff. To get here from the airport, took the light rail to the end of the line (Westlake Center) for $2.50....then the monorail and walked a few blocks after that. The walk with heavy bags would not have been fun....need a cab for that....but all during our stay there, we used the monorail to get to the city center area. Rooms were great, clean, high quality bedding. Bathroom was nice and large (stand-in shower only, though). Had a fridge and a microwave. Free parking in the garage downstairs!! Keurig coffee maker in the room....and coffee and cupcakes available in the lobby. Free water in the room, too. What really makes this place is the staff. The morning we left, we needed to get to the Amtrak station...I asked if a cab would be easiest....the young man at the desk suggested a towncar service for a flat $15 fee and arranged for it for us....it was painless. Really appreciated that. Space needle, Experience Music Museum very close (walking distance) and the monorail could take you to the city center from where you could walk anywhere. Felt safe walking at night. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: going_going_gone1
Reviews.Content: Excellent from early check in to check out. Arrived Friday post Alaska cruise at 10 am, not expecting room so early, but just wishing to stow baggage. Receptionist not only made room available, but because the room type I had reserved was not yet ready, she upgraded us gratis. Top notch staff at front desk. Hotel exceptionally clean, well styled. Loved having microwave and refrigerator in room. Just a block to Seattle Center and a nice half hour walk to Pike's Place Market. Highly Recommend and will stay again when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “One of my FAVORITE hotels so far!”
Reviews.Author: blazinRtires
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel! The room was amazing I loved how bright and colorful it was. It was very clean and had all these little touches that made it stand out from the rest. It was a 10 min walk to the tram ride that takes you to the mall, and from the mall you can walk all over Seattle. I took a cab once while staying here only to find out the place I wanted to go to was much closer then I thought. So in future when I stay here I will not be needing a cab to get to anywhere in Seattle. This hotel also has bikes you can rent for free. This hotel was worth every penny I cant wait to go back this summer! The only thing they did not have that I would have liked to see would be a free breakfast. They did have a coffee cart but it lacked selection,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P'line
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated only a 10 minute walk from the Space Needle. Our room was very clean, comfortable and well equipped. The Reception staff were very helpful and there are 2 computers providing free internet access. We would definitely stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Frambois
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night trip to Seattle with my Mom. We stayed at the Maxwell because of the good reviews it recieved on this site. The reviews were correct. A very nice hotel, large rooms, friendly staff, and nice decor. Be aware, this is not a fancy schmancy type place. There is no hotel restaurant or bar. (But there is a small coffee and snack shop in the lobby, and they serve mini cupcakes and coffee, for free, in the lobby in the afternoon). The big draw here is the size of the rooms, the friendly staff, comfortable beds, and great location. We had a fabulous view of the space needle from our room and could walk there in less than 10 minutes. To get downtown from there we took the monorail ($4.00 roundtrip). I have usually stayed at a downtown hotel when in Seattle (usually the W), but since I was there strictly for sightseeing with my Mom this was a better bet. Close to tourist locations and public transportation. I recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a low key experience close to the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless!”
Reviews.Author: Tricia063
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for 3 nights before going on an Alaskan Cruise and I cannot fault anything about the hotel. As we were celebrating our 50th birthdays and 20th wedding anniversary whilst at the hotel, we were upgraded to a suite. Great amenities, really clean and free pineapple cupcakes in the afternoon! Staff were very friendly and efficient. Yes, its a bit further from the city centre than a lot of the hotels, but everything about it, more than makes up for it. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... convenient... clean and interesting.”
Reviews.Author: jeanspo
Reviews.Content: New hotel (one year). Interesting decor... funky but cool... modern. Impeccably clean. Blocks from attractions like Space Needed, Experience Music Project, Duck Tours. Free locked/secure parking. No restaurant or breakfast in hotel, but blocks from some that are great... Peso's food was wonderful. Coffee, water , refrig and microwave in room. Coffee bar with very lite fare in lobby. Recommend for couples, families>

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel near the Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuyBC
Reviews.Content: Excellent quiet location, friendly staff and comfortable rooms. We chose this hotel for a family Victoria Day long weekend get away. The hotel was offering a buy 2-nights get 1-night free so we decided to try it after reading the reviews on TA. The hotel is located within walking distance from the Space Needle. We arrived in Seattle by the Victoria Clipper ferry and used the Town Car service to get to the hotel (cost us $20). Taxis are also available at the ferry terminal but we opted for Town Car because of the size of our party. You get a variety of restaurants and coffee shops near the hotel (Thai, Vietnamese, Greek, Italian, etc.). There's even a small supermarket closeby. Make sure to try Toulouse on Queen Anne Street for breakfast (loved their Creole dishes) or dinner at Gloria's Greek Deli (as featured on DDD). Great food and atmosphere. We found the front desk very friendly and helpful, especially Melanie. Overall, the service was excellent. The pool was small but just perfect for our little ones. They loved the complementary "kids cart" that came with games, legos and other goodies. Request the cart when you check in and they will bring it up to your room, if it's available. The hotel also has a small fitness room with treadmills and exercise equipments. The lobby is huge with a warm fireplace and lots of sitting areas. Parking is free, but not enough stalls for larger vehicles. We had a mini van, and only on one occasion, we couldn't find a stall that wasn't a tight fit. Our Prima Donna room was spacious (2 kings and a sofa bed), modern through out and very clean. Large flat screen TV with lots of channels, Keurig coffee machine with complementary coffee, free water bottles everyday and popcorn for the microwave all made our stay very enjoyable. The bed is very comfortable if you prefer soft mattress and fluffy pillows. The large bathroom came with a jetted tub and rainfall shower. Only complaint is that there's no fan so it can get little steamy if you like long hot showers. We enjoyed walking around the Space Needle park area and the big water fountain. Our 4 year old joined in the fun with the other kids running through the water sprays and getting all wet. We also spent a day at the Woodland Park Zoo which had a special dinosaur exhibit at the time. The animals were amazing to watch; there's even a petting zoo for the kids. We saw everything from penguins to snow leopards. A must visit if you have small children who love animals. For shopping, we went to the Premium Outlet (45 minutes by car) and downtown Seattle department stores (5 minutes from where we are). Stocked up on sports clothing at the new Under Armour store from the Outlet. If you need a car for the day, you can conveniently rent one from the downtown Hilton Hotel (Alamo/National). Lots of stores but not enough time. All in all, I would say the Maxwell is a small-to-medium family oriented hotel with all the amenities of the high end downtown hotels, but without the extra costs. Our family would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value at Maxwell.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy911
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Maxwell at a great rate from their website. The service is great. We arrived early, at 11 am, and not only did they have a room but a free upgrade to a Space Needle view. The staff also gave good advice for restaurants and arranged someone to drop us off at the train station for free. The room was very good and we had no problem with noise as mentioned in other reviews, but the hotel was not that busy. We walked everywhere and found the location to be ideal in a mixed residential / commercial neighborhood with lots of record stores and good food. It is about 1.5 miles to Pike Place Market but an easy walk we did 3 times. Overall the hotel presents a terrific value with great service over the upscale chains downtown. I highly recommend for leisure travelers in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcvu
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Maxwell for a work trip and would definitely come back for both work and personal travel. When other hotels nickel and dime you for all kinds of charges -- like internet service and bottled water in the room -- it's refreshing to have a hotel like the Maxwell reach a higher level of customer service by providing these amenities and features for free. I loved the hardwood floors in the rooms -- a very nice change from the usual musty hotel carpet. The rooms include many features that make your stay more comfortable -- a fridge, a microwave, a DVD player, multiple electrical outlets on each wall, and coffee maker. Pineapple cupcakes and complimentary coffee are available in the lobby throughout the day. Most of all, the rates were cheaper (more than $100 less per night) than comparable Kimpton and other smaller-scale hotels. I will definitely return to the Maxwell for my next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but needs a few quirks worked out.”
Reviews.Author: Gagirltravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the rooms are spacious and up to date! I loved the contemporary feel of this hotel. However, there are a few things that I would like to point out. Quirk #1, Upon arriving and checking in I was greeted by a rude woman at the front desk. She was short and snappy with any questions that I had. I asked her where the stairs were to get to the 2nd floor, she told me, obnoxiously, there weren't any and that I'd have to take the elevator and she looked at the man standing next to her and rolled her eyes. I thought that was a joke, I mean what hotel doesn't have stairs? Also, telling me "good luck in finding a parking space" However, upon checking out 2 days later, the gentlemen at the front desk were more than helpful with any questions I had and even with helping me locate a cart for my luggage. The maid service was also very friendly in asking how I was and if I needed anything. Quirk #2, The curtains on the 2nd floor are see thru, which meant that the people outside could see in, I even had a complete stranger start waving at me from the street and there was no way to close them. Not comfortable at all knowing that anyone could see in. Quirk #3, You can hear very clearly thru the walls and since there are nice hardwood floors, you can also hear the people above you walking around and babies crying next door. Parking wasn't really an issue, it was secured and right under the hotel so I didn't have to walk our into the rain or pay for parking. The wireless internet kept going in and out and was hard to get access to. The bathroom was amazing. It's size was perfect and it had plenty of space and counter space, the open shower was a nice touch as well. The room decor was a perfect flow with the contemporary hotel feel. The bed was soft and new, and so were the pillows. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and I would recommend it to friends. I would just forewarn them about the things mentioned above first.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay in a cool city”
Reviews.Author: Monicapsu
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on its location and all the glowing Trip Advisor reviews. It did not disappoint. I emailed ahead and asked for a room with a view of the Space Needle and they came through even though the place was pretty full of folks there for a film festival. When we checked in, the gal at the front desk told us what was going on and said not to hesitate to let them know if it got noisy but we never head much even though we were close to the elevator. The location can't be beat. We really appreciated the coffee (and tea) machine and fridge in the room, as well as the free WiFi. Overall, a very hip but classy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Space Needle, Belltown, but super quiet on Lower Queen Anne.”
Reviews.Author: geefour907
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to find this hotel, tucked away across the street from the new "Teatro Zinzanni" venue next to the Key Arena. It's on the other side of downtown from the Space Needle and the Pacific Science Center. This acts as an effective buffer between the hustle and bustle traffic noise so prevalent in SEA. Locals know this area as "Lower Queen Anne" and it's an iconic SEA neighborhood. It's got its own hoity-toity supermarket (Metropolitan Market), some great coffee shops (Cafe Zingaro) and incredible restaurants like Toulouse Petit (ate their twice!). The Maxwell has no restaurant, so you're free to roam the area to forage for food. I ate lunch at the Metro Mkt (salad bar). We even hiked up to the top of Queen Anne Hill (huffing, puffing) to the 5-Spot for breakfast. The hotel is essentially brand new--lots of modern touches. EXCELLENT hi-speed wireless internet. Great dark-wood floors. Comfy beds. Modern finishes in the bathrooms. I'm not a TV watcher--but they're big. There's the one-cup Keurig (sp?) coffee makers in the rooms. Very nice. Special touch: they put the 1/2+1/2 in the fridge. NICE TOUCH. Beds were comfy, towels were fluffy...there's a bedside alarm clock that holds your iPod. I could see the Space Needle out of my window--it stuck up over the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Seattle Center!”
Reviews.Author: candancejade
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maxwell to visit the attractions at the Seattle Center it was very close to before moving to another hotel for Sakura-Con, and I must say that I wish I could have stayed at the Maxwell for my whole trip! Let me give you a quick list of the things I loved: the room, bathroom, and shower were nice, clean, and very very roomy; I found the bed to be very comfy; there were a lot of good restaurants and 2 good grocery stores within walking distance; a fridge and a microwave I made good use of; every staff member I ran into was very polite and friendly; it was good to have free wifi and a flat screen tv that got HD channels. There were a few things that did not lessen my opinion of how awesome the hotel was, but could be a potential dealbreaker for others. You can really hear the people walk around and roll luggage on the floor above you pretty clearly. The nice big tvs in the rooms had a shelf near it that looked convenient if I had brought a video game console. However from what I could tell, there were only had composite video inputs and not the hdmi I would have preferred. Also, the hd channels on the tv weren't on the hotel provided channel listings, but were there way past of all the other sd channels and seemed to be a pretty random selection of what was there. The shower was designed to not need any sort of curtain or door, but it seemed to me that to make it work and not get water all over the bathroom the shower head was pointed towards a corner and was not adjustable at all. That made the very roomy shower seem kinda cramped as I had to huddle in the corner of the shower to stay in the water flow. All of that said, I loved, loved, loved the Maxwell Hotel! The next time I stay overnight in Seattle, they will be my first and probably only choice!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great”
Reviews.Author: 2bikers
Reviews.Content: very good location, friendly staff, clean, modern, plenty parking for the car, fantastic room, couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel with Character, Close to the Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: morris3445
Reviews.Content: I love this place. It is whimsical, contemporary, upbeat, colorful and cheerful with lots of open space and fun art work. The lobby is a lovely space, with nooks and crannies to hide in and an inviting fireplace to keep you warm. The really good complimentary cup cakes offered in the late afternoon is a nice touch. Rooms are large. Our corner room (348), in particular, is huge with big windows, a view of the Space Needle, microwave, mini fridge and safe.. The bathroom is also large and nicely appointed. Pillows are down and the beds are soft (which for me is great, but may be too soft for those who like firm). Free wireless, free parking. The Maxwell is about five blocks from the Space Needle and five blocks from the monorail. The monorail is about five blocks from Pike Place Market. There is an espresso cart on site, called the Pineapple Espresso, but no restaurant. There are lots of restaurants and a grocery store within walking distance of the hotel. Service at the Maxwell is excellent. Thank you Maxwell for your creativity and hospitality. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else in Seattle?”
Reviews.Author: SFKirk24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the bed was super comfortable, the whole place was immaculate. There were a couple of grocery stores within easy walking distance which made it easy to take advantage of the fridge and microwave. It's also a short walk to the Space Needle, the Experience Music Project and all of the theatres/venues at Seattle Center. From there you can take the monorail downtown. I rented a car (parking was free) but didn't need it for the most part. I hope to stay here again when I can go back and see more of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great family getaway”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel-wteens
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell is a beautiful new hotel with great service and decor in a nice neighborhood. We walked to the Space Needle and Experience Music Project and drove to the Market. Traveling with two teenagers, finding three beds is always a challenge. The Maxwell offers large rooms with two very comfortable beds and a pretty comfortable pull-out. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, fun and HELPFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Joyous96
Reviews.Content: This stylish hotel is located right next to the Seattle Center. It has great decore and super cumfy beds. The best part? When I managed to leave my cell phone in the bed, they found it and mailed it to me ASAP. Thanks Adriel!

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: jojowongie
Reviews.Content: We booked the Maxwell a month back for our spring break and with another family. Kids love the hotel. It's clean, staffs are friendly. They serve mini cupcakes at the lobby from 3pm to 7pm daily. There is A fitness center with a small pool open 24 hours. Room is so clean and nice. And the area around the hotel are nice too. We took the kids ton the pub at the corner of the hotel for dinner. Recommended by the hotel staff. So good. The hotel is walking distance to the space needle and the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RachelNRuss
Reviews.Content: Nice clean spacious rooms. The bathroom was decorated very tastefully and it was cool to have a light in the mirror. Came with all the amenities we needed-wifi, parking, close proximity to things.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean, Quiet & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EllSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel is a clean, convenient, comfortable, contemporary, boutique hotel. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The location is within walking distance of many great tourist attractions in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Superb deal”
Reviews.Author: VRinA2
Reviews.Content: Unsure what to expect from a 3 stars hotel, however, this one blew me away. Amazingly comfortable rooms, great staff, superb location. Free parking in Seattle is a bonus that is hard to top.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing spectacular. Far more interesting places to stay than here.”
Reviews.Author: minicity
Reviews.Content: Nice folks and nice moderate amenities, but nothing that makes an especially memorable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I found a new home whenever I’m in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Justwon88
Reviews.Content: I was in search for a hotel that my family and I could stay whenever we were in Seattle for our short getaways from Vancouver. When we arrived I was surprised to see how modern and new it was, the lobby was huge and a great place to lounge. The front desk told us the hotel would be one year old in two days. They were extremely friendly and even helped me find a tire shop where I could fix the nail in my tire that I encountered on the drive down. He printed a map for me and all the contact info. It was very helpful since I didn’t know that part of town. We stayed on the 3rd floor looking out to the parking lot, not a big deal for me since I knew there would be no traffic and noise. The rooms were amazing and very clean…I love the Keurig coffee makers (you could choose what flavor of coffee or even make tea). They are way better than those cheap coffee makers in other hotels. There was a nice LCD hanging on the wall that actually gets HD channels if you scroll the channels high enough (it doesn’t mention it on the channel guide they give you). This was the first hotel that I stayed at that had true HD quality. Plus free internet and parking…you can’t go wrong! I forgot to mention the pillows…nice big fluffy pillows and 4 on each bed. I really only needed one, but the more the merrier. Only problem I had with our room was the hardwood floors…you can hear people walking above you. We were lucky to have people that weren’t heavy on their feet and only heard them once in a while. Great location with plenty of restaurants and walking distance to the Space Needle and monorail that takes you downtown. The only disappointment we had was that the pool was closed for a couple of days during our stay. I mentioned that to the front desk. They said there was some blood found by the pool and they had to drain the entire pool and fill it. I thought that was great for them to do it for safety reasons and it showed this hotel has a concern for their guests. Most hotels would mop up the mess and add a little more chlorine in the water and be done with it. I really wasn’t expecting anything, but because of the pool not being open. The front desk person gave us a discount coupon for our next stay. Plus he told us to ask for him the next time we make a reservation and he will give us a great discount. Now that’s what I call customer service…very proactive. We didn’t even have to ask! I can’t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was exceptionally friendly -- in a real sort of way. Hotel is a bit pricey.”
Reviews.Author: KsSunflowers
Reviews.Content: The stay was comfortable and very well accomodated. I did miss having a Gideon Bible in the room. Should have asked about it, maybe it was only missing from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Can I give it a bad review so it stays a hidden gem?? :)”
Reviews.Author: NoonisGirl
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel is a fantastic hotel. I loved the free parking, the decor and the coffee maker. That's right, the coffee maker. The coffee maker in the room is one of those that makes coffee with the little cups, it was delicious! I have never enjoyed hotel room coffee as much. The room was very clean, the shower was nice and there's a McMenamins pub right next door! The Thai place on the other side is good too. Overall, I had a great stay at the Maxwell Hotel and I will be back. Remember this hotel is not right downtown, but it's not that far away.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: sweetcakesbc
Reviews.Content: My family and loved this hotel so much I had to write a review. Beautiful rooms, spacious, well thought out design and great coffee! Very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel! Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Dottybug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 15-19, 2011 and really enjoyed our stay. First of all, parking is free, which is a big deal in Seattle. It is also very secure, requiring a room key to open the garage door. This hotel is a two block walk from the Space Needle, so it is not in downtown. However, it is still convenient to downtown since you can catch the monorail from the Space Needle to the Westlake Center Mall at 5th and Pine. A one-way trip is $2 per adult, 75¢ per child, double that for a round-trip. Note that if your room faces the Space Needle there are telescopes up there and people can see right into your room if you leave the curtains open. We found that out when we went up there and could see our jackets on the chair by the window! The hotel is brand new so everything is new and clean. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable, even the sofabed in our room made for a wonderful night's sleep. We had two king beds and a sofabed in our room so we had a lot of room for our family of 5 (3 adults, an 11 year old and a 14 year old). There was a lot of room for our luggage, and we had plenty of luggage. It wasn't a suite so there was one bathroom and one t.v. for the 5 of us to share, but as long as we could all stay together we were happy. There is free wifi in the room, and also a business center in the lobby. There are no restaurants in the hotel, except for a little snack shop in the lobby. We saw many restaurants nearby though and the hotel staff can recommend some others for you if you ask. It is convenient to Interstate Highway 5, if you head east on Mercer Street which is a block south of the hotel. The front desk staff was very nice but there was a little communication problem between them and the housekeeping staff. We needed 5 bath towels in our room every day and told the front desk to notify housekeeping about our request, but we had to ask for extra towels every day. It was a minor detail that we could overlook though. We loved the decor of the hotel (art deco perhaps?) and how new everything was. We would definitely stay here again since we were so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, modern, comfortable, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: sfjonathan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our home base for a long weekend. I was attracted by the get the 3rd night free deal. We were very happy with the value you get for the space and comfort of the rooms. It's in Queen Anne so centrally located without being trapped in downtown traffic. The staff was always helpful and polite. The parking and wifi were free. That's a huge plus in Seattle. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: MountainCat9
Reviews.Content: Very cool, comfortable and colorful, we couldn't believe what we were getting for what we paid! Easy walk to all the Seattle sights, we definitly will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingThruEurope
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and could not have been more pleased with this beautiful, brand new hotel! The decor is so fresh, colorful, and welcoming. The lobby, corridors, and rooms were just fantastic. Truly, every part of this hotel is just top notch. The afternoon coffee and pineapple mini cupcakes were a nice treat too. The bed was super comfy and soft; and the bathroom was spacious and well appointed. The hotel is a short walk to Pike Market, restaurants, shopping, REI store, Space Needle, etc. We borrowed the free bikes and helmets which was a nice touch. If you like authentic tasting pizza and calzones, try "Bambinos" just a few blocks from the hotel. The only small complaint I have is the noise that comes from the hallways. There does not seem to be any sound proofing in the hallways- we could hear every door slam, foot steps, talking, the housekeeper in the morning, etc. Although we did not experience any noise while trying to sleep, it could affect a guest if they were trying to sleep in. We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bolero1953
Reviews.Content: Usually when we visit Seattle we stay at The Watertown but we wanted someplace that allowed easier access to Seattle in the morning. Wow. The hotel is new and wonderful with friendly staff, a nice room, a great bed and solid construction. Could hear the television from the room next door - grrr - but otherwise quiet. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy at the Pineapple!”
Reviews.Author: HeaveninHermosa
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Maxwell Hotel during a college visit. With such great reviews on TripAdvisor, we were expecting a lot, and the Maxwell did not disappoint. With free underground parking, wireless internet, DVD player, in-room Keurig coffee maker, and tiny pineapple cupcakes at the front desk, how can you go wrong? We took advantage of the website's "stay for 2 nights, get the 3rd night free" promotion and enjoyed each night of our stay immensely. The hotel does not offer breakfast as they have no restaurant or bar; however, they do have a small coffee "bar" with bagels, muffins, breakfast sandwiches, hot chocolate etc available. Great Seattle coffee and restaurants are just up and across the street. While we were there, it seemed a film company was shooting a commercial or program of some kind in the lobby - it is a popular spot, due to it's beautiful furnishings and lovely decor. The rooms themselves are lovely, with fluffy pillows and comfortable, plush mattresses. A full-length mirror in the room is a nice touch, while an ironing board/iron are handy as well. The bathrooms are luxurious, with walk-in showers (no yukky doors!) and upscale toiletries. The waterfall showerhead does not have "knock you over" pressure, but was more than adequate. Our room on the 4th floor had a wonderful view of the Space Needle as well! Stay here - reject the "free breakfast" of other closeby hotels and luxuriate in the Pineapple's welcoming aura - you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Newlyweds34
Reviews.Content: We only spent two nights in Seattle but LOVED every minute at the Maxwell! The little 24 hour "Pineapple Espresso" was awesome for a quick but hot and yummy breakfast. The free parking garage and WiFi were incredible amenities, as was the in-room DVD player and single serve coffee maker! The next stop on our trip took us to a 5 star hotel in another city but we wished we were still at the Maxwell. Would absolutely stay there next time we're in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Marc_Eaddy
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the room my wife spent 10 mins exclaiming how awesome it was ("now that's what I'm talking about.") I went to get a coke and returned with free mini cupcakes from the front desk. My daughters (3 & 5) loved jumping from bed to bed. Good times!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and good price”
Reviews.Author: canadianfamily17
Reviews.Content: We were amazed that we could get such a great place to stay that was within our moderate price range. Here is what we were looking for: walk to Seattle Center, pool, free parking, fridge, good for kids. What really impressed us were the staff. I have to say that I have never stayed anywhere with such helpful staff. This place is a score. When we told friends what a great deal we were getting, two sets of friends decided to join us. We all thought that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Backpackernomore
Reviews.Content: As others have said this really is a gem of a hotel. This rates as one of the best city centre hotels I have stayed at and I have stayed at lots. It’s clean, funky and has the best beds ever. No bar/restaurant (small coffee shop) but close to lots of good bars and restaurants. The area was safe to walk around day and night. Location a bit out from the centre but you can take a $2 tram/shuttle ride or a gentle 20-30 min walk. Loved Seattle and would not hesitate to book this hotel again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: saritagon
Reviews.Content: We just came back from spending three nights at the Maxwell. My husband was up for a job interview, and we also planned to see old friends in Seattle. The Maxwell exceeded our expectations. The room was quiet, large, full of extra amenities, and very clean. The hotel staff did everything they could to make our trip that much more pleasant. When my husband realized he'd forgotten his toothbrush at almost midnight, the man at the desk came up to our room with one. The next day, someone else was helpful with figuring out his tie and wished him the best so we'd be able to come back to Seattle. When there was a problem with the heat, the engineer was there within five minutes. And, best of all, we were given a fabulous recommendation, again by the front desk, for dinner last night. All in all, we'd stay there again any time we're in Seattle and recommend it to anyone who wants warmth, friendliness, a prime location, and helpful staff. Thank you so much for making our stay such a pleasant one!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiburonTony
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights two weeks ago and were extremely happy with our choice. We used to live in Seattle and watched the building being constructed but didn't realize that a hotel was going to be a tenant. It is about three minutes walk from McCaw Hall which hosts the Seattle Opera and Pacific Northwest Ballet, the Seattle Repertory Theater, probably one of the best repertory theaters on the West Coast and the Intiman Theater, another repertory theater. It is also very close to Seattle Center. Our room was a standard queen room and was more than adequate in size with an easy chair and desk with a comfortable desk chair. The desk itself was a generous size for working with power outlets above the level of the desk, no need to scramble underneath the desk to plug in one's equipment. There was also an Ethernet connection but I never used it so I cannot comment on it's capabilities, we did use the WiFi and that proved to be stable and with adequate performance, Web pages loaded quickly. The walls were in a muted yellow which may sound a little bilious but were in fact pleasing to the eye. The bathroom was large and contained a toilet, large sink (I can't remember if there was one sink or two) and a walk-in shower, but no tub. The shower had no door but there was minimal splashing onto the floor. Water temperature and pressure were both excellent. The lighting was good in the bathroom but, as in many hotels, in the drive towards ecology they use fluorescent lights which means that it takes about 60 seconds for the bathroom lights to output full power. There was a nice selection of toiletries, however, in the design of the bottles form overcomes function. The bottom of the bottles are tapered so it is impossible to stand them upright, consequently the liquid has a tendency to drip out of them while they are lying laterally. The towels were large and soft, better than average for a hotel and there were two robes. The room contained a larger than average sized safe (which we didn't use) and an iron and ironing board, along with a refrigerator and microwave. The public spaces are bright, well lit and filled with hotel level contemporary art. The parking is complimentary in an adjacent garage, a non trivial benefit in Seattle where parking can be expensive. We didn't use either the pool or the gym so I cannot comment. There are a couple of possible disadvantages depending on one's circumstances. There is no restaurant and breakfast is a bit of an oddity. There are packaged items for sale and there appeared to be staff on duty in a kitchen in the mornings to microwave the packaged food. It didn't look particularly appetizing and the setup seemed a little odd to me. Unfortunately there aren't many good breakfast establishments in the immediate neighborhood. The second possible negative is the location. It is in Lower Queen Ann and there are numerous excellent restaurants available for dinner. It is however, somewhat out of the center of Seattle (defining the center as around the Convention Center and the shopping area of Pacific Center and Nordstrom). Off peak it is about a 5+ minute drive from the hotel to the center, during the day it can take up to 15 minutes. Alternatively there are buses within a 15 minute walk that will take one downtown. The hotel is also a little inconvenient to get to from the highway. The exit (Mercer St) can become very congested in the evenings and due to Seattle's one way system in that area getting to the hotel on city streets can be convoluted and can take anywhere from 5 to 30 minutes. Getting to the highway from the hotel is considerably easier (except at evening commute time). Overall an excellent hotel and one I would recommend for both leisure and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to a perfect hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: stt-jc
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel is simply a jewel. Beautiful, creatively designed decor, huge comfortable beds, friendly helpful staff - it was really amazing. And a perfect view of the Space Needle. It is a bit far from the center of town, but with a car it's no problem at all (and there is plenty of free parking). We would highly recommend the Maxwell Hotel for either business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheInspector16
Reviews.Content: Great two night stay at the hotel. It's been open less than a year. Very clean. Pool is small but adequate. No restaurant was the only draw back. Otherwise we had a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great time @ the Pineapple!”
Reviews.Author: Suisse19
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night this past weekend, but enjoyed pretty much everything about the Maxwell Hotel. From the friendly, courteous staff at check-in, to the clean, nicely decorated rooms...everything was fantastic! Getting a complimentary upgrade to a suite was also a nice surprise. Special thanks to Melanie at reception who was very helpful and courteous - provided directions to local restaurants and stores, gave the kids a DVD to watch, etc. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated, with all the creature comforts, ie; fridge, microwave, coffee maker, etc. Great location if you're planning to see the space needle and Seattle centre. Will definitely stay here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel at 3 star prices”
Reviews.Author: spacey_uk
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this wonderful hotel. The beds were comfy the rooms big and the people there absolutely wonderful. They were really helpful and gave absolutely great tips on where to eat. Toulouse Petit...especially which was amazing! I liked the shower, but can understand why some people didn't, I would have preferred it slightly more powerful, however that is a minor gripe, with an otherwise wonderful hotel. Having popcorn in the room was fun, especially after a bit of heavy drinking which always makes me want to snack on something! The coffee machine worked a treat, and the coffee was real nice. I have to say though the coffee they sold downstairs was simply delicious, and I also loved the free cupcakes they gave out in the afternoon. It was brilliant also to have free wi-fi and free parking, which I understand is a major problem in other Seattle hotels. The position of the hotel was great too as it was around a 5min walk to the space needle, so easy access to going downtown on the monorail. I really loved this hotel, the look, feel and the people. I would not hesitate in recommending this place to everyone, and I am certainly going to be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great View of New Years Eve Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: jams1
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel for its location and the guaranteed view of the Space Needle’s New Years Eve Fireworks. The view of the fireworks was perfect, from our 4th floor room and it was an easy walk to most of Seattle’s tourist attractions. Internet included, Flat screen TV, DVD player, Fridge, Coffee, & microwave in room. Rain type showerhead, nice powerful blow dryer, good quality shampoo, conditioner, lotion, & such, so if you are traveling light they have what you need except for tooth brush and paste. Parking was easy, secure & included. Walgreens, Safeway and New Seasons type market within a few blocks. Could hear folks talking in the hallway, but not in the room next door. It was New Years Eve so noisy hallway was expected. Did not use or see the Pool

Reviews.Title: “The Maxwell is perfect! free parking, free wireless, great people!”
Reviews.Author: thatpam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Maxwell for a couple of nights during the holidays as we were in town for a wedding. For such a wonderfully funky decor and affordable price it seemed too good to be true...but it was perfect. The people are friendly and helpful. Good size rooms, easy parking [and free, most local hotels charge $30/day]. Not one complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, fun, friendly & functional”
Reviews.Author: sjalbertson
