Reviews.Content: Stayed here just 1 night after a wedding in Bremerton. Loved it! Staff was super friendly. They even gave us special Apple cider & hot cocoa cartridges for the "coffee" maker in the room. The room was nicely appointed and decorated. Despite other reviews on this site, liked the floors and LOVED the shower. If you don't TRY to get water everywhere its fine. The bed was amazingly comfortable. I could easily have stayed in it all day. I was a little worried that our good-deal-of-a-room would be too loud being right by the elevator would be noisy but I didn't hear a thing. Proximity to just about everything you would need in town and in the heart of just the right amount of hustle and bustle. The only the thing I'd change is the parking. The under-the-hotel parking is really just for compact cars and the bottom of the garage had no turn around. The row of cars just ended. But there is parking by the door the staff suggested (where we did end up parking) and there's a public garage right across the street. Overall if I do ever make it back to this area I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel at a fantastic price!”
Reviews.Author: SistaKim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so beautiful! Everything is top notch. Nice linens, great tv..cool Keurig coffee maker and free parking! We brought our little do and she loved it to. They offer dog treats and waste bags at the front desk. How nice!

Reviews.Title: “Seems nicer than a 3 star to us.”
Reviews.Author: shelbymom
Reviews.Content: Not sure what criteria is used to award stars to hotels, but The Maxwell must be on the verge of a 4th star. We were in town to see a show at Teatro Zinzanni(WOW-Great show!) and chose this hotel since it is so close to the venue. It's also perfect if you're going to any of the plays or other events at the Seattle Center. The lobby and the rooms are very stylishly decorated. Our room was spotless. Great bed. Great bathroom and shower amenities. We're big fans of the Keurig coffee machines and this was the first time I've ever had a hotel room with one. Lots and lots of great restaurants and pubs within walking distance. And FREE PARKING which is astonishing in these parts. We only live about 20 miles away, but love to stay "in the big city" when we can and we're delighted to have found a home-away-from-home at The Maxwell.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Maxwell”
Reviews.Author: WSUonline
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Maxwell a couple times now. We have had some issues (it is a new hotel) but the location is great for us...easy access to the Monorail. The issue was that the heat would not turn on but they moved us to another room and that fixed it. Very nice property.. nice size bathroom, underground parking which is free.

Reviews.Title: “Fab!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bossneal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Thurs. & Fri. and found the hotel to be everything we needed and more. It's in the heart of the action of the Seattle Center just one block to McCaw Hall and within 10 minutes of downtown, even in traffic. The knockout decor and colors, pillow top mattress, walk in shower, microwave, Tully's in-room coffee (even half and half in the refer), and the big flat screen TV were very cool. The staff was great and very helpful. All that for under $150 w/tax a night with free covered, gated parking. We walked to great restaurants close by and enjoyed espresso and snacks at the Pineapple Espresso in the lobby. We slept without interruption even though it's right on Roy St.. You can't miss staying at the Maxwell.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: lajd2003
Reviews.Content: I read plenty of reviews on Tripadvisor.com before settling on the Maxwell and I'm glad I stayed here. From the front desk staff (Justin and Helen) to the cleaning crew, everyone was super accommodating and friendly. The place is immaculate, new, fresh, crisp, clean and tidy. Great bang for your buck too - they ran an online special when we were there and go the third night free. The neighborhood is quaint and full of great restaurants and things to do. Save your money and don't stay downtown in the noise of the city. Go here, just a few miles north, for some peace and quiet and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: rsorganize
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed there twice, in April 2010, while visiting colleges. Staff were friendly and helpful. Loved the colorful and unusual touches of the lobby and the rooms. Location was terrific - not just the Space Needle area, but the general neighborhood. Rates were great, too. Years ago, when visiting Seattle from MA, would usually stay at the Edgewater. Everything about the Maxwell was outstanding for us. Will look to stay there, again, when I/we are next in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: clem_423
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel -- it was conveniently located and clean and the staff were really friendly and helpful. I'd definitely consider staying there again as there were great bars and restaurants nearby, lots of buses stop nearby, and at the same time the neighborhood feels relatively calm and friendly. My only complaint is that I find it surprising that a hotel this nice still expects guests to use the bedspread as the blanket, which is gross. Why any hotel still uses a bedspread is beyond me. The result was that all we had was a thin blanket that we got from the closet, which wasn't idea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: keepitnice
Reviews.Content: Hotel Staff: No complaints - friendly and helpful. Coffee shop right in the lobby, umbrellas for convenience, early evening coffee and cupcakes on the house, nice lobby area allowing for some intimacy. Decor: Interior design is spot on: kudos to the designer. This is definitely not decor for you Victorian lovers - no stuffiness here. It's all about fun and vibrancy - could be a bit much for some, but I enjoyed it. My partner thought it was a bit over the top - perhaps it is, but how fun! Rooms: The rooms are not wall to wall carpet - just a rug for the bed. I prefer this for cleanliness reasons, but sound is impacted by it. Nice entry way (hall if you will) so shoes can be kept outside of the room. There is a table in the hall for your keys and such. Roomy bathroom with lots of cubby areas to keep things and plenty of counter space. Reading chair w/ foot stool and lamp, desk, fridge, microwave (free popcorn), coffee maker, wood hangers, ironing board, hairdryer, big TV with a lot of channels and a dvd player - good if you want to watch your own thing. Curtains which will not allow one speck of light to shine through. Alarm clock with 2 alarm settings, and not too annoying of an alarm - so the neighbor's won't wake you up. And this place is clean. I know it is new and perhaps that is why, but I hope they will continue to keep it clean. This hotel seems to have been constructed and designed well so hopefully the cleaning staff will be trained well and have enough pride, and get enough pay to keep it clean. Beds: I think they have a fluff top - I'm a fan of a firmer bed, but it was comfy enough. Complaints: Hooks - always a complaint of mine - why are there never hooks in hotels. Especially noticeable here because of the hallway. It would be so great to be able to hang my coat in the hallway; on those rainy days in particular - which is so often in Seattle. We had two wet coats and nowhere to place them to dry. Just one hook in the bathroom - why? I would like to place my pajamas on a hook. Not a big deal - just something that would be nice. Fitness: They have very minimal equipment. Pool is a square - not a lap: more for fun and relaxation. Parking: No complaints. I have a compact. Always had a space. Parking garage is secure. Also, it only cost $8 to get a cab to the heart of downtown. Other - All within walking distance: Vietnamese restaurant:Pho Viet Anh is close by and delicious, Metropolitan Market is fantastic, Bartell Pharmacy has whatever MM doesn't and Cafe Zingaro is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMermaid
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! Great price for a really cool, really clean, really comfortable hotel! Fun neighborhood! Great beds, nice amenities -- we have adult children in Seattle going to college and we'll always stay here when visiting - no need to look further.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: evergreen17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maxwell for three days in November 2010 for fun in Seattle. We love the proximity to the Seattle Center and great neighborhood restaurants. We were on the third floor and had a fantastic view of the needle and downtown Seattle. The free parking is a plus. Ask for an ethernet cable at the front desk for a more secure connection to the internet. Each night they had little pineapple cupcakes and coffee in the lobby and umbrellas to use if you were walking around the area. The one downside we noticed is the noise. The maids in the morning were quite loud with their carts and general talking back and forth with each other. We wanted to sleep in on Thursday morning and were unable to with all of the noise in the hallways (very thin walls). We would stay here again and next time we will bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Maxwell - perfect for theater access”
Reviews.Author: ivoryspirit
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed there prior to our evening at McCaw Hall for the ballet. Loved the easy walking (safe) access to McCaw Hall and excellent restaurants on the same street as the hotel. The staff were super friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations and directions to the monorail so that we could leave the car, after we checked out, and visit SAM (Picasso Exhibit). We agreed that the lobby decor was elegant/funk and enjoyed the little pineapple cupcakes in the lobby, late afternoon. Just a nice touch. Also the pool, although, not huge, perfect for relaxing after a busy evening. In fact, the staff allowed us to stay in an extra hour after the "normal" closing hour. And yes, free parking! And very comfy room and mattresses. With a "sexy" coffee maker in the room. Can't wait for an excuse to travel back to town for another theater experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place-not the best location for me”
Reviews.Author: david_ex29
Reviews.Content: The room was spectacular, the staff excellent and accommodating. I particularly like no carpets on the hardwood floors in the room - very clean. The walk-in shower is great! They did overfill the parking lot and I ended up outside but still OK. The only problems I could find were that it was faaar away from where I intended to be - SouthEast Seattle. Roads were under construction with detours everywhere. Also the internet was spotty and slow in my room - small criticisms. If you need to be close to the Space Neede/Seattle Center, this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, hip, new, and fun”
Reviews.Author: beaufort-tiger
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my second stay (Hotel Modera in Portland was first) on my most recent swing to the Pacific Northwest and it did not disappoint. The Maxwell is a beautiful new facility with nice decor and a great lobby. The rooms were very comfortable, good shower and comfortable bedding as well. Although the location is not exactly near downtown Seattle (but close to the Needle and Seattle Center), I appreciated the free parking and enjoyed the short walk to the Queen Anne neighborhood restaurants. One thing that didn't affect my stay but may affect others was the notion of a "space needle view" room, where rooms on the southside (streetside) of the hotel have a view of the Seattle icon. The first night I was there I split a room with my folks on the third floor, and we could barely see it, as a parking garage across the street blocks the view. If you are on the fourth floor (as I was on my last night) or the fifth floor, you will get a much better view.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pugman
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell hotel is a perfect hotel for folks who wish to stay a little outside the Seattle core but still enjoy all Seattle has to offer. The neighborhood is full of restaurants all with in walking distance. The hotel itself was very clean with colorful well-decorated rooms and very helpfully staff. Free parking and WIFI is also available. Guests should note that the WIFI throughout the hotel is not using any sort of encryption meaning no id or passwords are required to access internet at the hotel. While this makes it easier for the non-techie sort to get online it does potentially leave guests open to security risks associated with an open connection. All in all we loved the Maxwell and hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: SailingBye
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for what we wanted to do in Seattle without having to pay the expense of staying in a downtown location. On the other hand you don't get a view of the Puget Sound that you get from one of the downtown high rise units. However, this place is still very new, very nicely appointed though sparse to some extent since there's little activity in the main lobby area due, I think, to no on-site lounge/bar or restaurant. Staff engaging, friendly and helpful. Amenities were right up there, the bed restful and relaxing, wooden floors in the room were an interesting 'green' touch although it made sound bounce around a bit. A number of good restaurant choices within easy walking distance. And big plus was free parking (especially with what is charged downtown) although getting out to a bus stop (or the monorail) is equally as easy to do if its not raining too hard. We had beautiful fall weather and walked around a lot, over to the Seattle Center, etc. And glad to have found this very reasonably priced hotel. Well worth it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location & Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: rina725
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel is an amazing value for the quality of service, the facilities, and especially the location! My boyfriend and I chose to walk and take public transportation, and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. It's a couple blocks from the Seattle Center which houses the Space Needle and the monorail, which can take you directly to downtown Seattle for $2! (I'm from SF and our BART system is not cheap). The Seattle Center also has the Experience Music Project, the Science Fiction Museum, as well as other great things to check out. The hotel is also located nearby some yummy restaurants like Pesos (go there for breakfast!) and a handful of Thai restaurants. There's a really nice grocery store a couple blocks away if you want to save some money or need to pick up some snacks and water. Bank of America ATMs are everywhere in the Queen Anne neighborhood and there are great views of Seattle nearby at Kerry Park. The hotel is clean and the staff are very nice. The room was clean and very spacious. Big comfy bed, view of the Space Needle from the window, and a mini fridge for those leftovers. I docked a star for the room because one of our lamp's bulbs was out, but it was a small lamp and not a big deal. The shower also doesn't have a curtain, but it's also so big you don't really need one unless you're bunking with someone you're not comfortable with seeing you shower! The hotel has a artsy (jazz and ballet) theme and a pineapple motif since it's the international symbol of hospitality. Front desk staff were very helpful since it was our first time there, and they even let guests use complimentary bikes and umbrellas during your stay. They also arranged for a car to pick us up and take us to the airport at a cheaper rate than taking a taxi. Thanks Maxwell Hotel for making our trip easy and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive - a memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2112
Reviews.Content: Reading through previous reviews on TA alerted us to the Maxwell Hotel, which we selected for our 4-night stay on the basis of the many favourable recommendations. No problems finding the hotel by car, although you must follow the driving instructions from I5 on the hotel website precisely as there are many one-way streets in the area. We had been a bit concerned about limited parking spaces based on previous reports, but we needn'y have worried. The (free) underground car park has (approx) 50-60 spaces so there was never any problem getting a space during our stay. Yes the spaces are narrow by US standards, but we had no problem reversing our full-size rental car into a space. The large lobby of the hotel is very strikingly decorated, with lots of bright colours and looks very stylish. There are lots of chairs and tables, but as there's no bar, there was no particular reason to provide so much furniture in this area. Check-in was fine and the receptionists were very helpful and friendly - really making us feel welcome after a long flight. Our standard "Queen Aria" room was more than adequate for our needs, and was like the rest of the hotel, absolutely spotless and new looking with very attractive furnishings and decor. We also liked the little touches such as the popcorn and the microwave. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept fine despite some jetlag. The hotel has a free business centre with 2 PC's plus printer, which was extremely useful for making travel bookings and last minute research on things to see - a really helpful facility that all hotels should have. The local area is very quiet (in a good way), but well located for easy access to I5, and on foot to the Space Needle/monorail. There is a (limited) selection of about 7 or 8 restaurants/cafes in the area plus some fast food places, mainly about 4 blocks to the west, so within about 10 minutes walk. There's also a Thai restaurant right next door to the hotel which was pleasant enough on a rainy evening. As the hotel building is still very new, there are some unopened retail/restaurant units on the ground floor facing the street, so maybe one day there will be more dining choices on the doorstep. We would definitely recommend the Maxwell Hotel and hope to visit again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: dweezilb
Reviews.Content: I rented a king room for $130 with free parking. It was nearly as large as a studio apartment, clean, modern, and comfortable. The location on lower Queen Anne is a nice break from the hassles of downtown: quiet, but still walkable to good restaurants. The cavernous lobby and long hallways were a little empty, in fact the whole hotel reminded me a bit of The Shining, but I didn't see any blood pour out of the elevators :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, great stay overall”
Reviews.Author: alberta842
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching Seattle-area hotels and came across the Maxwell hotel on TripAdvisor. The reviews were great and after looking at other options, I found that the Maxwell was a bit more affordable for my budget. I made the reservation online and within 2 days, received a phone call, confirming my reservation. I really wanted a room with a view but there were none available when I made the reservation, so I included a note on the reservation form, explaining that I was coming into town for my birthday. A few days later, the manager called to wish me a happy birthday and also to let me know that he personally upgraded my room (free of charge) to a view-room. My original reservation was for two nights, but the day I arrived, the hotel offered a third night at an extremely discounted rate. I decided to stay an extra night and was really happy with my decision. Upon arrival, there were pineapple cupcakes and coffee in the lobby which the hotel provides every afternoon. I thought this was a very nice touch. While the hotel isn't in the heart of downtown, the location is great, within walking distance from several restaurants, stores, etc. and just one block away from the Seattle Center. I went to a concert at the Key Arena one night and the hotel is just a few mins walk from the venue. McMenamins (a great Irish-inspired pub) is right next door - good food, great drinks, and great staff. We went every day for happy hour! The rooms were wonderful -- huge tv, walk-in shower, separate sitting area, refrigerator, coffee, and popcorn. Comfy beds -- my only compliant would be the noise level. Because the rooms have hardwood floors, we could hear the people above us walking around, very early on Sat and Sun mornings. The hardwood floors are nice but it can be noisy. Free parking and free wifi are hard to come by in Seattle so it was nice to have these amenities. All in all, a wonderful hotel and I would definitely stay at the Maxwell again. See you at the Pineapple!

Reviews.Title: “Had to move to another hotel the second night.”
Reviews.Author: MuffetMardi
Reviews.Content: The website made it look great. But you get what you pay for. It was average. The thing that put me over the edge was the fact that the bedding smelled of dryer sheets or fabreeze or something and there was no way to get away from it. We had to switch hotels because it made me feel so sick. Our room was near the elevators and so we could hear them "bing" all night and people coming in and out of them. The decor was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: beamer48
Reviews.Content: Clean, elegant and great customer service. THE BEST BEDS I've ever slept in! Good exercise room/pool. I wish I could've stayed here longer.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected treasure in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: rahelab
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel was on a list of possibilities handed out by a conference. I chose it for the reasonable price and the free parking and in-room safe, and hoped for the best. The great surprise was on me. I came into a hotel that felt spacious and expansive, from the well-appointed lobby to the room itself (the room had a little "foyer" with a flower in a vase on a shelf before entering the sleeping area). The room had laminate flooring, and a large-screen TV on the wall. I plugged in my computer - free wireless! - and a fancy coffee maker that made one perfect cup of coffee at a time. I opened what I thought would be a mini-bar, and found REAL milk in a bar fridge for my coffee. Then, I saw the microwave popcorn and noticed the microwave. The bed was comfy, and I slept very well, thanks to the black-out curtains. There was no noise from other rooms, either. If I had realized ahead of time that they had a fitness center and pool, I would have come prepared. Instead, I took a shower in their oversized shower stall and wondered how I stumbled upon this gem of a hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, and helped me pick a restaurant from one of the numerous (mainly Thai) restaurants on Roy St. I travel a lot on business, and stay in a lot of hotels; I have high expectations. This is a boutique hotel that has everything I would want as a business traveler. If I have more business in Seattle, I definitely know where I'm going to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it to all our friends”
Reviews.Author: ckpascual
Reviews.Content: It was my trip to Seattle, and the hotel will definitely be a huge reason we come back. Great, friendly staff allowed us to check in early (11am) and get an upgrade to a room with a great view of the Space Needle. The decor is wonderful, and well worth the price. Made us feel like we were staying in a boutique hotel in SF. The beds were comfortable, and with a BF who's over 6'4", that doesn't happen often. There's an AMAZING thai fusion restaurant - Asian Breeze - just down the street. Everything is delicious and very reasonably price. Plus the decor is trendy and unique. The monorail and light rail system made getting downtown extremely easy, and very affordable. Sure beats $20 cab rides everywhere. The cute mini cupcakes and coffee @ 3pm was a nice touch. They also held our bags after checkout, so we could mill around the town before heading out to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fun couples weekend getaway, wanting to take in the sites and sounds of Seattle. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place near Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: Dooglas
Reviews.Content: A wonderful boutique hotel in the Queene Anne Hill neighborhood. Close to the Seattle Center and the restaurants of the Queene Anne District. Convenient parking, Comfortable and spacious rooms. Helpful and polite staff. A nice place to stay on a personal visit to seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Okay Location”
Reviews.Author: DesignDiva
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was really nice. Very stylish - loved the sort of 30s vibe. I always appreciate internet access in a hotel and in this day and age, expect it. Maxwell Hotel does have it, but it's very poor. Getting it in the lobby is easy, but completely hit and miss in the rooms. The free parking is a huge bonus, but the parking stalls are pretty squishy, so don't bring a big vehicle. The location is okay. As it's not in the centre, it's quiet, however that also means it's a ways away from anything. Not a big deal if you don't mind walking.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel, loved the room, staff, eco-friendliness. This is now my "go to" choice for Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: 3PupsandMe
Reviews.Content: Wow! I was impressed. We were traveling with friends and leaving on a cruise the following day. The hotel was very accommodating, allowing us to check in early since our rooms were available and also check out late the next day. Walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. We didn't even bother renting a car. I'm a coffee junkie and LOVED the in room Keurig machine. Our room was so comfortable and the staff was incredibly friendly. I have stayed at the Four Seasons as well as many other 5 star hotels and find that I prefer The Maxwell over them all. Again, Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Meet me at the Pineapple!”
Reviews.Author: simva3
Reviews.Content: What a great find! The Maxwell hotel is beautiful and unique. Our room was spacious, spotless, comfortable and beautifully decorated. The staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby is huge, with intimate seating spaces, and also beautiful. Free Parking! The Hotel is a couple of blocks from Seattle Center, and downtown is a short monorail ride from there. There are good restaurants within walking distance...just ask the staff for a recommendation. When you come back from sightseeing, enjoy some coffee and pineapple cakes in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely thoughtful staff in ensuring a great night for us in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Rick16
Reviews.Content: I was only at the Maxwell for one night with family after catching a Mariners game. We had a great stay from check in to check out. The lobby was clean, open, and has a neat design to it. The room was large, including the bathroom, which in my opinion was the most impressive aspect. The staff gave us suggestions on a number of great restaurants in the area and we ended up choosing Peso's. I should save this for a different review, but the food and prices blew my mind. We were there during happy hour and had delicious meals for five dollars apiece! Our only problem came the following morning when there was no hot water, but before we even mentioned anything to the staff at check out, they gave us our night for free as well as an extra night to be used within a year. Overall, I was extremely satisfied with the price (including free parking), the staff, and the room. I would recommend the Maxwell to anyone looking for a great night in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “This Is A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bear_E1065
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here on vacation, exploring Seattle and the surrounding environs. The people in the hotel are very friendly and very knowledgeable. Public transportation is located nearby making it unnecessary to rent a car when exploring Seattle - Downtown. Many different types of restaurants are located within easy walking distance. You get a lot of value for your money at the Maxwell and I would recommend this hotel to anyone vacationing in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: nstar612
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with my wife and 19 months old toddler. The place was easy to find coming from airport. I was surprised to find out our room was available for check-in at 11 AM. That was a life-saver as our son badly needed a place to take his nap. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood. There are nice grocery stores located three blocks away. The rooms are very clean and modern. The beds are very comfortable. The afternoon snack at the lobby was a nice touch. I also saw that they have a couple bikes for guest to use. We had a rental car so the underground parking was a very nice feature for us. Unfortunately when we came back from dinner, the parking lot was full. I checked with the front desk and they told me that metered parking is free on Sunday or I could find parking in the resident area up on the hills. I circled around the neighborhood 3 times and couldn't find any metered parking. I was unsure about parking in the residential area since the signs said no parking without permits and I saw a parking enforcement guy giving out tickets at 9 PM on a Saturday night! I decided to park my car further up on the hill next to a bush. I told the front desk where I parked my car and expressed my concerns about getting a parking ticket. The two lovely ladies who were working at the time told me that I should be fine, and not to worry about it. The next morning, I found a parking ticket attached to the wind shield. The parking ticket was for $49! I took the ticket back to the front desk and to my surprise they said they will take care of it and apologized for the inconvenience. I was truly amazed by the level of service that the hotel staffs have offered throughout the stay. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: kellyochico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell for three nights for my birthday. It was my first time to Seattle and let me just say Location is everything. We didn't have a car so it was especially important for us. The Maxwell is in the center of it all, a couple of blocks from the space needle, in fact you could see it just sitting in the area out front of the Hotel, an $8 cab ride to Pike's Market, the Waterfront or the Quest Stadium where we saw the season opener--so fun! The Hotel had the friendliest staff I've ever experienced, truly pleasant happy people ready and willing to do whatever they could to make your stay as nice as it could be. The Hotel is new so everything is very clean and nice. It is sharply decorated with a lot of bright colors kind of art deco like. The beds were very comfortable with a lot of wonderful down like pillows. Our room had hardwood like floors, a first for me in a hotel, but I really liked it, felt spacious and clean. Great big flat screen T.V., the bathroom was very nicely done, lighted mirror, nice bath products and soft towels. Great lighting fixures in the rooms too, soft light. We were on the 3rd floor and it was completely silent so sleep was great, however, it was during the week? Free parking though we didn't need it, that is a HUGE consideration in Seattle, and the Maxwell's prices, well you just won't find better for equitable accomodations anywhere. There is also a lovely indoor pool. There is no restuarant so no room service, or bar, but they do have a small coffee shop in the lobby where you can get coffee, muffins, a few other drinks/snacks which was nice. And, they service the most yummy pineapple mini cupcakes and coffee, complimentary, every afternoon at 2:00 p.m. Overall a great value, and we will definitely be staying at the Maxwell on our next visit to Seattle and there will definitely be a next visit! Just a tip if you're up for a great dinner, especially seafood, Ivars down at the Waterfront is out of this world!!! Beautiful location right on the water, great bar and restuarant, the food was just incredible, some of the best wine my husband and I have ever had, really a great dinning experience...a tiny bit pricy though, but worth it! The Pink Door down in/near Pike's also a fabulous place to eat, great food, and the atmosphere is really charming, like walking into Paris, complete with Piano bar and hanging flower baskets---truly special place to have dinner! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: vt_travelers65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in 4 hotels during our stay in Seattle because we wanted to get to know different areas of the city. Although they were all nice (in fact 3 out of 4 were more than nice), we decided that the Maxwell is the one we would choose to stay in for our entire trip should we come again. The rooms are large, modern and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The desk clerk upgraded us to a room with a view of the Space Needle - what more could you ask? Oh yes, there is a small coffee shop, a pool and exercise room, snacks and coffee in the afternoon in the extremely large and roomy lobby... This hotel is within walking distance of the Space Needle and Seattle Center which is the main reason we stayed there, but it is also within walking distance of the free bus zone which makes it very easy to get anywhere in the city. They also have bikes that can be borrowed. There is a market two blocks away with very healthy foods that can be brought back and kept in the fridge or microwaved. I almost forgot the Keurig machine with single serving coffee and half and half in the fridge. Much better than the usual coffee found in hotel rooms! We just really can't speak highly enough of this hotel - it was perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, new, "happy" entrance - great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travelinmom_7
Reviews.Content: Not too much bad to say about our recent 4-night stay. Everything spanking clean and new, contemporary in design, rarely seen wood floors in large rooms w/nice amenities. Most of the staff were very helpful and cheerful. We would definitely stay there again. My complaints: Twice I asked for emailed confirmation 2 wks. prior to arrival but it was never sent. When checking in and only upon my asking, the room rate did not agree with what I negotiated for on the phone but was quickly corrected ($142/night + taxes). I asked the check-in gal if our view was "fairly decent and of what?". She responded that it was mostly the "neighborhood" - so okay, I knew my room rate was pretty low. However, the view was actually about 85% of the parking lot - WOW - what an overstatement. The bathroom door squeaked terribly but was quickly fixed by one of the staff who used a spray of WD 40 type of product on the hinges. This resulted in oil residue on the wall and floor and this was never cleaned nor noticed by the cleaning staff. There was a large patch of long hair on the drain in the shower that I had to remove the first night. Other than this, we were pleased. It was quiet; we never heard a thing from others. The free daily mini cupcakes & coffee were terrific. The free use of hotel-provided computers near the lobby, at very fast speed, was a great convenience for us, too. We really liked the ambiance in the lobby and in walkways. Also, very thoughtfully, on the only morning that it was raining a little, the hotel put out a large container filled with umbrellas for us to use - a big help. The walk to the Sp. Needle (worth the outrageous charge) is a good but easy 6-7 min. with the monorail right there, too. The free pic they take of you there will not arrive for ten days, btw. A previous reviewer saId you could walk to Pike Mkt. but I heartily disagree unless you're willing to invest probably 45 min. to do so. All in all, a great hotel; we'll be back. I've incl. the pic of our "view" - lol.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: DukeyDogsMom
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Maxwell Hotel the week it opened and it was simply awesome. Everything was perfect. In addition it is within walking distance to the Space Needle and Pike Place Market. My cousin who lives in Seattle will be recommending the Maxwell Hotel to her visitors. Definitely a 5-star hotel and I will stay there again on future trips to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected based on others' reviews.”
Reviews.Author: KGBnwu
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I traveled Saturday to Monday as a quick getaway- we were looking for something reasonably priced yet well-reviewed. We chose the Maxwell Hotel because of this. We had a king size bed room on the 4th floor. The stay was slightly less than average. Pros to the hotel include: spacious rooms with microwave and fridge. Bedding was very comfortable and room was made up quickly, even on a Sunday when I assume there was plenty of room turnover and fewer staff working. The neighborhood is eclectic and has some good lunch/dinner locations. It within walking distance to the space needle area if one is looking for that. The cons were numerous. Although the hotel advertises free parking, it is actually quite limited. The spaces are SMALL and several larger cars had no choice but to occupy two spaces. We attempted to park at about 9:00 on a Saturday night. There was no parking and the front desk advised us that plenty of free street parking was available and that there would be no charge on a Saturday night-Sunday. FALSE- there is plenty of street parking, BUT if you park there overnight, you will receive a ticket unless you have a residential permit for that area. Luckily, we ran into a parking ticketer who advised us that the only safe parking was in a pay garage. We payed 16.00 for one overnight stay. Luckily, on Sunday night, there were plenty of garage spaces. My guess is that as long as you are not at the hotel on the weekend, parking will not be an issue. Still, a disappointment that front desk staff incorrectly advised us. Other cons include the noise level by the elevators. There was a wedding going on in the basement and we clearly heard the band in our room on the 4th floor by the elevator. I advise guests to ask for a room away from the elevator on a weekend night. While the guest services book advises that the front desk cashes checks up to 50.00, they in fact only cash travelers checks. The front desk was unable to advise us on a location of a cash machine. The hotel has no restaurant on property, and the closest breakfast spot is a 4-5 block walk. They do have a small store which sells water, soda, snacks, and pharmacy items. All in all, a nicely appropriated and comfortable cheaper hotel WITHOUT fantastic guest service. Be mindful of parking and room selection, and you can most likely make it on your own. Do not expect 4-5 star service at this price, although the rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Peggy&Ralph
Reviews.Content: Great location near nice area and easy to see sites by foot or catch a bus. Hotel was opened in March 2010 and decorated very boutique like with edgy youthful class. Front desk staff was great, happy and helpful. This hotel does not have a restaurant but many are near by. Nor a bell hop, which I rather liked, as once you check in there are no extra fees involved. Free overnight parking as well.

Reviews.Title: “No hestitation in returning to this one!”
Reviews.Author: Telfordsmama
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a long weekend at the Maxwell, having found it on Tripadvisor - it's the best hotel I've found in a long time. Everything was new and sparkling clean, the staff were very helpful and it was very conveniently placed for most of the sights. Our room was large with two double beds, a microwave and a fridge (not a minbar) and the bathroom had a large shower but no bath. We used the (small) pool but never managed to be around for the free cupcakes! Snacks for breakfast are available but there are a number of cafés in the area for breakfast - the best for food and service was the Mecca on Queen Anne (walking distance). The 5 Spot (up Queen Anne at the top of the hill - 5 mins drive) was posher but the service was poor, however the drive back through the residential area at the back of the Maxwell afforded some brilliant views, which made up for it a bit. The Maxwell is 5 mins walk from the monorail line into the centre, which takes a couple of mins to get you into the Westlake Centre on the main shopping drag. Most places, such as Pike Market and the waterfront are only minutes from the Westlake on foot. Once again, Tripadvisor reviews came up trumps! Oh yes, and the parking and wi-fi are free.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amd58
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell Hotel was a gem of a find. Located within walking distance of the Space Needle and in a lovely neighborhood, the Maxwell was wonderful. Opened in March 2010 the hotel is poised to meet the needs of the traveler. The front desk personnel were helpful and kind. They recommended several fantastic restaurants close by. The rooms were immaculate and well appointed. We would definitely return to the Maxwell.

Reviews.Title: “Not your run of the mill hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3hapitravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Maxwell Hotel at the end of a 2 week trip to Washington and Canada. The hotel was very nicely decorated and our room was large and extremely clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the decor and general feel of the hotel, much different than your run of the mill hotels. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful and accommodating. We would definitely choose the Maxwell Hotel again if we were in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Great All-Around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 19aml75
Reviews.Content: I came for a few days of fun and a couple days of work. Great location, affordable, clean, new, cupcakes! This hotel tries to be fancier than it is (the furniture seems a bit on the cheap side), but it's a great all-around hotel. It was only open a couple months when we stayed there. So, the customer service was lacking. I blame it on being new. There is FREE PARKING! It's also outside the city center, which is less of a hassle. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauramcamis
Reviews.Content: If you would like to stay in a hotel that is not like all the others - stay here. Modern, colorful and fun. The beds were super-comfortable, the rooms were quiet and the staff was very friendly. Right now prices were well below the average for Seattle for that class of hotel. Maybe they are trying to attract clientele. The only hassle is parking - very small spaces, but it is free!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, updated, clean, roomy”
Reviews.Author: mayapram
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered a great value, it was updated, clean, and roomy

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Taco52
Reviews.Content: A bit tricky for us to find (because of the 1-way wierdo streets downtown), but once there we were greeted with an easy check-in and mini cupcakes. The room was fabulous! And the bath amenities?- They smell soo goood...I used them throughout my whole stay there! Wierd that our bathroom didn't have a shower door, though it didn't bother us too much, it's just wierd. Free parking is a plus. Location is AWESOME...we were able to walk to the space needle easily..and they have an inexpensive monorail from there to downtown so it's easy to get to Pike's place etc.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: DEH60
Reviews.Content: There are four sisters in my family. The four of us try to get together at least once every few years for a sister's weekend, which has become increasingly more important since my younger sister is battling cancer again and is on chemo. A friend of a friend hooked us up at the Maxwell Hotel this past month and I can say that we have never been treated better. Our room was beautiful, and the staff spoiled us with gifts and flowers each day. They really care about the peolple who stay at their hotel. Linda Jones was amzing as was Jessie and the entire staff. I hope that we will be able to make it to another year and if we do, we will try and stay here again. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - A Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: chloethomas
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Maxwell Hotel on an overnight trip to Seattle. Before the trip I had spent many hours looking at hotels and found it difficult to find well priced accommodation with good reviews. The Maxwell caught my interest because of the middle range price and the free parking. It was FABULOUS! I would recommend this hotel to everyone, even my mother who is extremely picky on where she stays. The decor was funky and modern, and the cupcakes in the foyer was a great touch. The room with the hard wood floors, extremely comfortable bed, flat screen television and well designed bathroom was exceptionally clean and comfortable. I loved the modern feel to the hotel and both my partner and I had the best night sleep we had in a long time. The room had a mini-fridge, microwave, quick and quiet coffee maker and complimentary popcorn! We also loved the complimentary bicycles and had a great time riding around seattle. the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The location, which is a little out of downtown, is actually perfect as the monorail is a 5 minute walk and adds a little fun riding it downtown for $4 return. There is also a about 4 restaurants on the same street, which we didn't eat at, but they looked busy when we walked past. The whole experience at The Maxwell Hotel was fantastic! A great place to stay in Seattle that made our trip perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Blas-Herrera
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for a business trip and we couldn't be happier. The rooms are BIG and pleasent and the service was GREAT! Two downsides to staying here were that the key cards get demagnatized VERY easily and the rooms are hard wood floors so you'll hear everything above you of if not on the fifth floor. We didn't get a chance to check out the pool but it looked nice from the window of the room we were staying at! Free parking and WIFI a great bonus! Great places to eat in the neighborhood were Sushiland and Bahn Thai. The music and movie house up the street was also fun to hang out in and get movies on the cheap to watch in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, loud flooring”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer025
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell Hotel for 4 nights. We loved the decor and location - in fact, this was the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in! The area is quiet, but close to so many activities and restaurants. We were very excited to see wood floors, because it looks great and is definitely more hygenic than carpet. Our only real complaint is that we were awakened each morning by the people above us 'tromping' around. It sounded as if they were actually running around the room. I'm not sure if there is anything that can be done about the noise with this flooring. Otherwise, we loved our stay at the hotel. Perhaps next time we'll request the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel and a very good price.”
Reviews.Author: SimonPBethesda_MD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and were very happy with the rooms and service. The hotel is on the north side of The Seattle Center (10 mins. walk to The Needle and Monorail) in the quiet Saint Anne neighborhood. The free underground parking (under the hotel) is a bonus. The facility is new and was well designed. I didn't have any issues with the hardwood floors in the rooms causing noise from people walking in the room above, but the room doors are very substantial and do close with a loud 'thunk' unless you shut them by hand. The smallish pool was OK; the exercise room was small but well equipped, including a spinning bike. Coffee and small cup cakes were served each late afternoon in the lobby; a nice touch. There is no restaurant on premises, just a coffee/snack bar - but there is no shortage of places to eat in the vicinity, and we got menus from reception and had dinner delivered in room from a local pizza restaurant. The front desk staff were helpful when we needed assistance. I paid an average of $141 a night for each of the two rooms (taxes included) via Expedia. I consider this to be an excellent value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fab decor”
Reviews.Author: welshbelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only been open for a few months and the whole place is still gleeming with a brand new air about it. The decor is quirky but fabulous - there are plenty of comfy arm chairs in the large airy reception area where you can enjoy a coffe from the in hotel coffe shop. The rooms were large and beautifully decorated with gleeming wood floors and free internet. The bathrooms were spotless and the beds exceptionally comprtable. The hotel does not have a separate bar or restaurant but the young and very friendly staff at reception were able to suggest any numbers of places close by where to eat. We were not very impresed with the Irish bar one block away but Tilikum Place for lunch/brunch and Toulouse Peteite for breakfast/bruch were exceptionally good. The hotel has a lovely feel about it. It seems to be situated in a good area and we had no concerns about walking from the monorail station after dark. Definately a very good find.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in comfortable and well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: jsmosley7
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. Despite being outside the city center this was a great place to stay. Large comfortable rooms with all the amenities, very helpful and friendly staff, and a convenient coffee bar in the lobby. We loved the decor, somewhat a new Hollywood glam, and thought the spaciousness of the rooms was great. The staff were very helpful in recommending places to eat or whatever it is you need. The place is a little outside the city center but walking or public transit are accessible and easy. Space Needle and some good restaurants are a few minutes walk. I think a benefit would be that you could easily park here, though we didn't, for people who use this as a home base to travel to other nearby destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family with teens”
Reviews.Author: landlockedks
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Maxwell and found it to be perfect for our family. We stayed in a queen suite--two queen beds and a sitting area. The free wi-fi, parking and in-room mini-fridge made this a great spot for us. The location is nice, it is close to get on the monorail at Seattle Center and ride to downtown. It is also walking distance to restaurants and to a large grocery store for drinks and snacks. We parked the car and never needed it. I've also stayed downtown (Alexis Hotel) but honestly preferred this location and the fun and colorful vibe of the Maxwell.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ABQ-Sammy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Maxwell because it's part of the Watertown / University Inn group which we've stayed at and liked before. If you're looking for elegant furnishings and 1 block from the Space Needle, this is your spot. The lobby and rooms were immaculate, the staff was helpful. But if your looking for free breakfast and a shuttle service, look elsewhere. We found the Maxwell to be a smart, trendy, elegant hotel, but not as practical as most places that we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip with Friends and Kids”
Reviews.Author: rockin_traveler18
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days (two nights) on a recent trip to Seattle. Purpose of the trip was to entertain the kids with some of the amenities that Seattle has (Children's Museum, Pike Place Market, etc) as well as shopping. The staff was excellent, helpful (recommendations etc) and caring (actually asked what we thought of their recommendation). We were very happy. Price was on the high side, but value was provided (free parking=$15-20 value). Check out Peso's Mexican Restaurant only 2 blocks away. It's super close to Seattle City Center (amenity area) and you can ride the monorail easily to Downtown (Pike Place Market, shopping, etc).

Reviews.Title: “The Maxwell Hotel was a thrilling discovery!”
Reviews.Author: schistoryteacher
Reviews.Content: My grown daughter and I found the Maxwell to be the perfect choice for our stay in Seattle. It isconveniently located so that you don't need a car at all. The staff was absolutely wonderful and helpful. One of the staff even planned my daughter's upcoming camping excursion while we were out sightseeing! I thought the interior of the hotel was adorable, the beds were very comfortable, every membger of the staff we encountered was welcoming, and our stay there was the highlight of our trip. I met someone on the street outside the hotel one morning who asked if I woudl recommend it and I said, YES, without hesitation! I know that thishotel won't be a secret for long, so I am glad we found it first!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: lastiki
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 great nights at the Maxwell Hotel. Super friendly and helpful staff. Very close to the Space Needle and Seattle Center attractions. Public transit is just a few blocks and is only 1 bus ride away from downtown area sights. Many restaurants in walking distance. There is also a 7-11 close by which has a Redbox for DVDs to use in the room. Great neighborhood. I would not hesitate to stay here again when in Seattle and would highly reccomend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Modern Hotel w/ Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: dandcg
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Its right beside the space needle and we were there for July 4th so we were just a short walk from Lake Union. The staff was really great and made some excellent dining suggestions. The hotel also has complimentary cruiser bikes so we out a couple of those and took a ferry to Bainbridge Island and rode them around and had a great time. I loved the fun modern design of the rooms and everything was very new and nice. The only drawback is the small pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Concerts / Key Arena”
Reviews.Author: Nini1
Reviews.Content: Clean all around and the rooms were inspirational to redo my own bedroom :) Definitely walk to the Key Arena and other attractions. Can walk a few blocks up for food. I really enjoyed this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: oska12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights the hotel is in a great spot to walk to attractions and catch transport into town. The service was excellent and the hotel is in great condition, very pleased we chose The Maxwell

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Austinophile
Reviews.Content: This is a new Hotel with modern furnishings set in the Queen Anne District of Seattle and the perfect place to stay particularly if you are attending Shows/Concerts /Dance in this area which could be called the 'cultural district' of the city. The rooms are a decent size with good' bathrooms' though ours was with a large walk in shower rather than a bath. Ours also had a 42 inch LCD TV and DVD recorder, microwave and Pod coffee maker. Very comfortable and friendly staff. There are several good Restaurants within walking distance. The best for us was Tolouse on Queen Anne. Great atmosphere and excellent food which they serve until 1 a.m. Many of the local restaurants close at 10 pm. We would definitely come back. The only downside is that the parking spaces in the hotels parking Garage are on the small side so if you drive a Suburban you will not find it easy to park.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bubba507
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent place to stay. The staff was extremely corteous and helpful, always offered excellent recommendations for food and travel. The rooms were clean and the beds super comfortable. Even though the hotel has a very modern look it was very comfortable and homey. Would definetly stay there again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cindy099
Reviews.Content: Had really enjoyable four night stay in this very clean and modern hotel. A very short walk from all the attractions in the Seattle centre and well located for monorail to downtown. Room was well equipped with microwave (and popcorn), fridge, safe and plasma TV. Afternoon coffee and cakes along with complimetary bicycles were a nice touch. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again for any future visits to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: onwardho2gether
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. It has a very hip and trendy feel to it. The staff was extremely helpful with area restaurant information, walking directions and mass transit help. The room was average sized with beautiful furnishings, an enormous television, microwave (popcorn too), frig., a walk-in shower and a bed sooo comfortable I thought I was at home. The location was everything we were looking for with just a 4 block walk to the Space Needle (we also had a perfect view from our room) where you can also catch the monorail to downtown. We parked the car (free at the hotel underground lot) and walked or used public transportation to the Needle, Pike Place Market, Downtown and the Piers. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Critter3
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on our west coast road trip. What a great hotel! And the rate is very good! There are so many things we loved about the hotel....the great vibe, the great look of the rooms, clean, great coffee/espresso machine in the room, big flat tv, microwave popcorn!, quiet, friendly and helpful staff, big lobby which is great for lounging, a couple blocks from City Center, complimentary bicycle to use, etc. I think it was our favorite hotel on our trip and we stayed at the 4 Seasons in San Francisco and the Fairmont in Santa Monica. Everything is true about the great reviews it's been getting. I think the only negative I can think of is that it doesn't have a free breakfast. However they have an espresso bar right beside the lobby desk that sells breakfast items, and from what I can remember it was inexpensive and good. As well, the room did not have a tub. For us that's no big deal, but for someone who needs it, it would be for them. We definitely enjoyed our stay and wish we had more than 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mdray
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from the space needle and walking distance from the most gorgeous of Seattle's neighborhoods (Queen Anne), this hotel could not have been a better find. Very nicely decorated, large comfortable rooms with great beds, friendly customer service, and a complimentary afternoon coffee and cupcakes "happy hour". To add to the value of this hotel is the fact that they offer free parking, unheard of in other downtown hotels. Feel free to leave your car there as public transportation into the heart of things is right there. I do not feel we missed anything by being away from the bustle of downtown. It is a very short distance away, and the price and amenities are great. Also, we found some great restaurants in the area, that are more local than touristy spots. For Mexican go to Pesos, for amazing breakfasts go to 5 spot, and for incredible, homemade Greek go to Athina Grill. I promise you will not regret your decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We were really happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: banana_alb
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Maxwell Hotel. This was the only Seattle hotel with a pool in our price range. It turned out to be a great choice. We all loved it. The wood floors were wonderful, it was very clean and the staff was nice. The pool was very small but a really nice and so was the exercise room. The ability to borrow bikes was thoroughly appreciated and utilized by two in our party. Great location too, nice neighborhood and near Seattle Center, lots of restaurants and walkable to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Salsi69
Reviews.Content: Fairly new hotel, with lots of color, in the Seattle Center area of town. Queen Anne shopping & eats 3-4 blocks away. Third party travel sites had rates $10-$15 lower; called the hotel directly & they matched the rate. Best thing about it; FREE parking, saves you anywhere from $20-$40 a night compared to other hotels in Seattle. Excellent mini cupcakes in the lobby every evening.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in downtown Seattle by far.”
Reviews.Author: dpg2
Reviews.Content: Brand new place, spotless. Wonderfully comfortable beds, lots of great amenities in the rooms. Had a view of the Space Needle and downtown high rise buildings. Wonderful. Only a couple minor drawbacks such as a very tiny and kind of depressing indoor swimming pool. And the parking area is difficult to maneuver around in. But those are very minor complaints in light of the extremely low price we got this room for. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel stay; would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Leslie79912
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on this hotel at Hotels.com. The rate was $125 a night with free parking. The free parking was important to us as we drove into Seattle and had to leave the car parked there over the long weekend. We hate valet parking because it is so expensive and we don't like other people driving our cars, so this hotel was ideal. They have an underground parking garage (though small) and guests can use it for free. We checked in pretty late at night and the garage was full, but they allowed us to park the car in guest check-in parking just until the morning. Then in the morning we moved the car to the garage after everyone had left for the day, and we left the car there all weekend so we wouldn't lose the space. All the employees were extremely friendly from the reception people to the cleaning staff. We stayed in an Aria room (1 king size bed) and it had a Keurig coffee maker, microwave, mini fridge, flat panel TV mounted on the wall, and a DVD player. The bathroom did not have a bathtub, just a walk in shower, but I never take baths at hotels anyway because you never know how clean it is, so I liked having a walk in shower a lot. The floors in the rooms are wood which is nice for sanitary reasons because hotel carpet can be very scary. I think the wood floor was a good call particularly since this hotel is pet-friendly, so the floors are easy to clean probably. I thought the decor was very well done all around. It is very obvious the time and thought put into each piece from the floor plan to the draperies to the furniture. For example, there was a full length mirror on the wall in the room. Next to the mirror was a little shelf (marble I think) and right under the shelf was an electrical outlet--a perfect place to charge your electronics or blow dry your hair if someone else is using the bathroom. Things like that don't cost a whole lot, but those kinds of details make the experience more hospitable all around and people DO notice those details. Yes, the other reviewers are right that it can be a little noisy at times due to the thin walls. However, I found that between floors was very solid. I never heard anyone walking above us and you could jump or stomp on the floor without fear that you would disturb the people below. So really you're only hearing noises from the rooms on either side and even then it's not THAT bad. We turned the closed captioning on on the TV so that we didn't disturb anyone else because you can hear the TV if the people next to you are watching it. My one criticism is that, while the bed was extremely comfortable, I didn't care for the sheets or the bedspread. I like my sheets to feel cool and crisp when I move my legs on them, and their sheets feel stiff and scratchy. Also there is no blanket in between the top sheet and the bedspread so if you use just the sheet you get cold, but if you use the sheet and the bedspread it is too hot. I would have liked a lighter blanket in between the sheet and bedspread. The pillows were heavenly. They lay out bite-sized cupcakes in the afternoons in the lobby that have a little slice of pineapple stuck in the icing. We had one and thought they were pretty good. It was a nice treat. There is a giant mosaic tile pineapple on the floor in the lobby--pretty cool. I could see this hotel being a chain because they carried the theme throughout so thoughtfully. We didn't use the bikes or the espresso bar, but it was nice they had those there in case someone wanted something. The location is FANTASTIC. It is one block from the ballet, Teatro ZinZanni, and a short walk further is the Space Needle and the Experience the Music Project. Pike Place Market is about 3 miles away and a fun walk, too. I did some research on this hotel after we stayed there because it was such a nice place and I discovered that it is owned by Columbia West Properties which is still a family-owned business. My hunch is that has something to do with why the people working at this hotel were so friendly and it was run so well. I've stayed in hotels in 6 countries and all over the U.S. and this hotel stay was very memorable in a good way. I really like that we patronized a family-owned business and not some corporation who couldn't care less about our experiences at the hotel. We would definitely stay here again and will rec it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveln0w
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Seattle numerous times. For some reason for this particular weekend, it was difficult to find decent accommodations. The Maxwell House is new so we decided to give it a try. It is near Queen Anne hill which was convenient to friends and great for running (the hill is quite a workout and the views at the top are stunning). The hotel has free parking (not easy to find), is about 1.5 miles from downtown so you can walk there, and is blocks from the Seattle Center. The flat screen television was great for watching World Cup soccer. The room and lobby décor is trendy and new, the laminate floor was nice in the room, but noisy if someone is walking in a room above you. We did have a problem a couple of nights with people coming in late and making a lot of noise in the hallway. This may just be a function of people returning from late night concerts held at the Seattle Center. The spring loaded heavy doors really do slam loudly too. The hotel had a small coffee bar, but being in the town of Starbucks, it was weird how bad the coffee was (the complimentary coffee was bad too). The pool is small, the exercise room adequate (especially after you have run up Queen Anne hill). The staff was welcoming and the service was very good. The Maxwell House is really good value (we paid around $100/nt), but I think we will look elsewhere for our next stay in Seattle because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and would return!”
Reviews.Author: apacat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week. The hotel is new and very modern and clean. The beds are comfortable. The hotel had free parking which is unusual for Seattle. The staff was great. The location was good and you could take the monorail downtown. We found the car to be unnecessary unless you wanted to leave town. If you are looking for service like at a Hilton this is not the place to stay. The only downfall was that it could be noisy at tomes due to the slamming doors and loud floors. we would definitely stay here again and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: DocAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to the Seattle/Vancouver area and wanted to let everyone know what a great hotel this is in Seattle. We stayed at great places through the whole trip (thanks to tripadvisor reviews) but this was really special. The rooms are large. Bathrooms are large. There are cupcakes in the afternoon with coffee. Everything is clean. The beds are wonderful and almost no noise from the outside. The hotel is within walking distance to great restaurants and the Sky Needle. My son didn't want to leave this hotel which is pretty amazing. You will enjoy your time here. Oh, and parking is free!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in downtown Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: travelnutEncinitasCa
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a visit with family in Seattle and had a very pleasant stay at the Maxwell Hotel. There's something to be said for a brand new hotel...everything is so clean and fresh. We especially loved the large walk-in shower, and the bathroom itself was very roomy with great lighting (women always appreciate that), upscale toiletries. The bed was so comfortable...not sure if it was a pillowtop, but it was wonderful. They have miniature cupcakes in the lobby in the afternoon...nice touch, along with coffee. Underground parking is FREE...you don't find that anywhere in downtown Seattle and that is a huge savings. The hotel is close to the Seattle Center and the Space Needle, and buses are also free in downtown Seattle, so if you don't want to walk to Pike's Market or Pioneer Square, just leave your car and grab a bus. We're going to stay here again when we visit at Thanksgiving...you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: rainbirdreader
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Seattle, I was eager to try the very well located Maxwell during my most recent trip to attend a concert at Key Arena. I could not have been more thrilled with the location. The access to Seattle Center was super quick and I was at the arena or on the monorail to downtown five minutes from my door. My first impressions of the hotel are that it is stylish, spacious and welcoming. The staff was lovely, except for the maid who twice failed to see my "do not disturb" sign and knocked anyway, and the tiny cupcakes in the afternoon are a memorable touch. The rooms are unique and very comfortable for sleeping, working at a desk or watching the absolutely enormous televisions, not so great for eating in or reading as there is no "tea table" or really good cozy chair. I tried the DVD player but could not get it to work which was a disappointment. The wood floors were very attractive and I had no problem with room noise around me. As someone who loves a long soak after sightseeing, I guess the lack of a tub in the bathrooms my biggest drawback to this new property. While the open showers are hugh and aesthetically pleasing, it is impossible to get really warm in them because they do not trap heat. I thought a dip in the pool might take the place of a good bath, but that too was chilly and ridiculously small. It was my bad luck to be swimming at the same time as a rowdy family of five with dive bombing kids and there literally was not room for all of us to enjoy the water. I longed for a hot tub. I also wished for a few more food options coming in late from the concert or early in the AM. The tiny espresso bar in the hotel has mostly sugary junk food, sodas and juices. How about some upscale herbal teas, better baked goods or something savory like a mini quiche? Fortunately there are tons of eateries and a really fine upscale grocery store and deli within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good price”
Reviews.Author: kenbug
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel near Seattle Center, free parking, affordable, clean, friendly staff, within walking distance to numerous restaurants/bars, nice neighborhood. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awe-some!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBama
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel. The lobby is trendy and clean. The staff was very eager to help, and we put them to the test, asking lots of questions about the surrounding area. If you took a Holiday Inn-type value hotel and crossed it with a boutique hotel, Maxwell is what you end up with. You get a great value, good parking, and trendy, new decor. The room had some sort of faux hardwood floors, which look nice, but don't muffle much sound. It is located about two blocks from the Space Needle, where you can catch the monorail for $2 and get to the shopping district very easily. If you can handle hiking a couple of very steep streets, walk to Kerry Park at night and get some great photos of the Seattle skyline!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: kelbust
Reviews.Content: The newness is refreshing, the decor is chic and modern, the staff was very nice, the prices were lower than most, the location was good, the parking was FREE! This place has a lot of positives. However, there were some negatives about our visit that we couldn't ignore. 1. It is a LOUD hotel. They have beautiful hardwood floors in the rooms, but that means you can hear your upstairs neighbor clomping around at all hours. Also, and even harder to ignore, was that the doors are very heavy, and don't have any slow-stop close, so throughout our entire stay, any time anyone in our hall closed the door it was easily heard in our room. SLAM! 2. We got "upgraded" to a room with 2 Queen beds instead of the 1 King we'd reserved. Who wants to spend the night at a hotel and go down a size in bed? So my husband and I ended up having our own beds for our anniversary celebration. :( Lame. Plus this "upgrade" was supposed to be a "view room" and our view was of a parking garage. The Space Needle was directly behind a big tree. 3. No restaurant in hotel = no room service for breakfast (or anytime, for that matter). 4. No movie channels, or movies to rent on TV. Might not usually be a big deal, and they have a DVD player in the room, but who goes to a hotel with their favorite DVD packed? Overall, it was "fine."

Reviews.Title: “I Want to Stay There Again, and again and again . . . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: cookie2494
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maxwell the night before our cruise for Alaska left. I searched a long time before I picked the Maxwell. There were several advantages I was looking for. I wanted a pick up from the airport, closest to Pike's Market, transportation to the docks the next day, priced right, space in the room and amentities. I got all that and bonuses that included a view of the Space Needle, a beautiful clean room with a huge walk in shower w/shower goodies, beautiful decor, flat screen TV, wonderful comfortable bed ,I could go on forever, just as I stated in my title, I want to stay there again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious staff and uplifting decor...”
Reviews.Author: toplay
Reviews.Content: My son and I had completed finals and decided a get-a-way to Seattle would be what the weary brain needed. Wow ~ by staying at the Maxwell our bodies, minds, and spirits were pleasantly revitalized. The location at the base of Queen Anne hill is a must with Kerry Park for the most outstanding view and the convenience of the Met market and QFC just around the corner for late night snacks or early morning treats. Upon check-in until check-out you shall be treated like a welcome guest complete with superior service. The staff is superb!! The decor is tremendous! The pool area is delightfully cherry and warm. I started each morning therein. The temp is perfect. The complimentary newspaper in the mornings is heavenly as you sit alongside the fireplace in the uber sized lobby, complete with freshly brewed tea. Oh and let me not forget the super pretty cupcakes that greet visitors throughout the day in the lobby. A nice touch Maxwell. So now that I am almost ready to move in...you may question the perfection factor. Ok - herewith a few comments erring of the side of human-ness. I would like to see additional swing towel bars in the bathrooms, to dry towels - therefore saving water and energy costs. Perhaps a hot-tub? Also - I would like to see additional comforters - and down alternative pillows. Otherwise, I am moving in.... Thank you Maxwell for a superb time. We loved staying with you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, warm and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: estaben
Reviews.Content: After a long cruise in tight quarters, the Maxwell Hotel was a needed stay. The music in the lobby was soft, the front desk was friendly and pleasant and the room...Beautiful!! We really appreciated the soft wood flooring, the open, large showers and the beds (I think they're Sleep Comfort), what ever they are, we fell right to sleep. Though, cars were going by, we couldn't hear them. The room was big, quiet, clean and comfortable. The complimentary water and microwave popcorn was a bonus. My wife doesn't see very well so the large flat screens were a plus. We didn't get a chance to use the workout room or the pool but they looked very inviting too. Thank you Maxwell!! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel in Great Location at a VERY Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: AmesMan
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after extensive research via TripAdvisor (which proved to be invaluable for all aspects of this trip). I typically look for a clean, newer hotel in a good location that is under $200/night. I don't care that much about having people park my car or turn down my bed. If this is what you need, look no further. This appears to be a brand new hotel. It smells like new lumber; kind of how my house smelled when it was newly built. The interior design is contemporary, interesting, and bright. It has many amenities. The pool is smallish, but OK for kids. They have a coffee kiosk (it is after all Seattle) that is inexpensive but not overwhelming in terms of quality. The rooms are great; very plush and comfortable. Fully equipped with flatscreen TV, microwave, fridge, etc. Beds are very comfortable. Floors are wood and tile. No tub, but I never use one anyway. It has a large tiled shower. Staff members are casual but polite. Only one glitch: I left some smoked salmon in the fridge and wanted to come back to pick it up. I called them right after checking out and they said they would check it out and get back to me. They didn't return my call and when I called back later they said it had been thrown out. Kind of frustrating although they were nice about it. Didn't offer to adjust the rate. The location is very good. It is close to the complex where the Space Needle and other attractions are. You can walk to several restaurants, but it takes a few minutes to do so. The area is safe for walking. They have free parking which is obviously a huge plus. All in all, this is a fantastic bargain. You won't find anything else in this area for under $150. My advice is go go for it before they raise their prices up with the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Decor, Odd Parking”
Reviews.Author: xgoldsera
Reviews.Content: Whoever designed these rooms had a sense of humor, but a fun take on the color palette. I really enjoyed the decor; the hotel is decorated in a very whimsical-jazz inspired way with bright colors. I think we must have gotten a handicapped accessible room because the shower didn't have an actual shower, just a curtain on the side of the bathroom with a seat.
