Also, when the wake up call sounded, there was also a flashing light like a fire alarm. There was also a door bell and a peep hole about waist height. No real complaints there. The parking situation was the only real problem. If you go to Seattle, just get a compact car. People don't like to actually follow the compact car parking spaces and usually park wherever the heck they want, mostly over the line and in two spots. The Maxwell had a parking garage, but people parked so poorly, there weren't even close to enough spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my girlfriend. The hotel is new and the room was spacious with an extremely comfortable bed as well as a safe, coffee machine, large tv with dvd player (can rent films from the front desk) and a microwave. No bath (not sure we would have used one anyway) but a walk-in shower instead. All the staff here were extremely friendly and helpful. Location wise, it is slightly out of downtown - about a 5 minute walk to the monorail at the space needle or about a 3-4 minute walk to the bus stop to go into downtown. There are also some restaurants on Mercer street that are only about 5 minutes walk away. We did hire a car for a day and parking overnight at the hotel was free. One or two minor niggles - there was no bar which would have been nice but the hotel does provide coffee and fairy cakes (for free) in the lobby and also has a small shop that sells fruit / pastries / soft drinks etc. Also, there was some noise from the street when we first arrived but when we mentioned it to the front desk they had no problem with moving us to a room at the side of the hotel where we couldn't hear the cars. Other than that, the hotel also has a swimming pool / gym and free wifi. We would definately stay here again if we come back to Seattle and would not hesitate to recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... wonderful pool... way too loud when sleeping at 3am”
Reviews.Author: tccam71
Reviews.Content: We loved the close location to the Seattle Center and the free parking. Our young children loved the pool, which was perfect for their swimming abilitiy. However, between the hours of 1 am and 3 am we didn't get that much sleep due to the loud voices and pounding of doors. Overall we enjoyed our one night stay. We would most likely return with ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Newness helps you overlook a lot of things”
Reviews.Author: melwood7
Reviews.Content: Well, first and foremost, it's new. Along with most new things, you tend to "overlook" the details because everything is shiny, new and pretty. The decor is ultra modern and beautiful. The lobby is gorgeous and contains many little nooks and areas to lounge around - be sure to check out the mosaic pineapple on the floor when you walk in. Back to the rooms. Pros: NEW, very comfy beds, awesome bathroom with walk-in shower (no bathtubs), mini-fridge with microwave, large flat screen TV with DVD player. Cons: LOUD due to the wood laminate floors in rooms, traffic noise if you are at the front of the hotel, poor water pressure (water saving shower heads), small, did I mention loud? All in all they are very nice but you can hear doors shutting, ice machines (if you are lucky enough to be by one), voices in the hall, traffic noise, and people walking above you and beside you. Overall, the hotel is a good value for the location. You can walk to several restuarants and if you are in town for a concert it is only a couple blocks to Key Arena and city center. Biggest plus: FREE PARKING. This is almost unheard of in Seattle. Beware, however, the spots are tiny and hard to come by. Get there early and leave your car or you won't have a spot when you come back. I would stay here again the next time I'm in town for a concert, but other than that it's not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a criminal that lessened my opinion....”
Reviews.Author: animalchen
Reviews.Content: Went to Teatro Zinzanni for a wonderful evening. Because my car had been broken into before in this vicinity, we took my handgun into the hotel and locked it in the safe. Aside from the gum lowlifes leave on the floor in the parking garage and walkways, the cleanliness was good. Our room had good location and decor but as mentioned before by other reviewer... the insulation for sound is on par with a prefabricated manufactured home. If you are lonely and spent $163 dollars to be close to other people, this allows you to know when your neighbor is upstairs or next door. Its great at a hotel when you see few other guests but can still hear them. My wife and I were on our anniversary and I hope they could hear us too:0 So aside from lack of sound insulation, I was having general good impression of the place until... I left my HK40 locked in the safe. called and talked with receptionist who refered me to Keith. Keith asked for safe code and told me he would put it in the hotel safe. I suggested that I'd come Sunday for it but he said the manager Linda would not be there and she had sole access (combo) to safe. Keith said Monday was holiday so Tuesday was next workday. He then called and said Linda thought that was too long. I said I would come tomorrow then and call if I could not come tomorrow (Friday). Now the slick part... I hate it when you talk directly with someone multiple times working out details and then?!?!? .... that person and others do whatever they feel is convenient to him or them and this has lasting inconvenience. Linda told Keith to call the police and officer Monson 4161 was asked to take my gun. This ended up with it being impounded and I got 4 more calls from cops. I can pick up the gun between 8-5pm after a background check which takes 2 days. Tuesday at the earliest. So then today as I was getting out of my car with my bum R wrist, I was held hostage by a guy with a box cutter who stole my kids candy while I said "I see you brought a knife to a gunfight" and pulled out my empty hand . nah not really. I'll just stay in my house gunless. So Linda was uncomfortable locking away my gun where she has "sole access". Keith was too secretive to call me before mucking up my whole next 4 days. He thought I was calling to request help but actually helping me.... bah call the cops and confiscate my legally owned and purchased gun for which I have a concealed carry permit. Peter says I can leave a message... for Linda, then that she would call but she did not. I would suggest recommend this hotel to anyone out of prison or of color. The Maxwell House will make you feel at home if you are accustomed to being treated with, suspicion, distrust and disregard. If you like to have police involved at every step of the way and the hotel responsible make excuses and ignore you. I should have booked another night tonight then drove back tomorrow to get the gun in the morning. Being honest and asking for help was a mistake. I berate myself for this failure. I mean I left a gun in a safe.... how foolish. I only paid for one night and only $163. If yoy want respectful service.... one has to pay $400 night and go somewhere that requires a membership card!

Reviews.Title: “Still working out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: PDX-DUO
Reviews.Content: Two cons & four pros. (Con: 1) We checked in 4 times. The first time we were given room keys to a room that either had people still staying in it or it hadn't been cleaned yet (tv was on, pizza box in bathroom, bed a mess). The second set of keys was for floor 2 and we reserved a room with a view. This room overlooked the 3 story cement parking garage. Granted you could see the Space Needle if you really looked up, but it wasn't exactly a "view" room. The third room they gave us keys to, again had people staying in it. We walked in and the room was tidy, but there was luggage, a woman's purse. The final attempt to check in finally worked (mind you it's been about 45 minutes at this point). We were on the 3rd floor which still overlooked the parking garage but you could see a little more sky line. (CON: 2) All the floors are laminate wood flooring so you can hear people walking above and beside you. If you want a quiet place with a REAL view, this may not be the hotel for you. Also, I question the security since we were given access to a room with other people's personal belongings in it. (PRO: 1) Nicely decorated. Everything is new. (PRO: 2) The people who work here are very friendly. (PRO: 3) Great location to downtown and walking the city. (PRO: 3) Rates include parking.

Reviews.Title: “The Maxwell Hotel-Seattle WA”
Reviews.Author: Londonles23
Reviews.Content: The Maxwell is a new hotel opened in March 2010 . We had a room with a kingsize bed, bed was super comfy. Bathroom is nice with a good sized walk in open shower. The room has no carpet, has a laminate type wood floor and very modern boutiquey type furnishings. Room also had a big flat screen and dvd player, a microwave, mini fridge and coffee maker along with an in room safe. We were on the street side which has the view of the space needle but you will have a little it of traffic noise on the street side. Hotel is within walking distance of Seattle Center which has the space needle and a nice little park that has the international fountain and the nearby monorail. Monorail takes you to Westlake and Pikes Place market is just a 0.2 mile walk from there so we found the location very good. The staff were very nice and helpful with any questions we had about local restaurants etc... In the afternnon the lobby has free coffee and mini cupcakes and they also have an espresso bar . The hotel also has free parking for residents of the hotel which is a rare luxury in Seattle. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - close to Space Needle and cool bars”
Reviews.Author: julesb77
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and still has the new smell to it! The room was spacious and well equipped - a microwave as well as a fridge. The bed was large and comfy, and the bathroom modern, spacious and clean. The hotel has a small pool and gym room - again all new and clean. Although this hotel seems far out from the centre of town, it's only a 5 minute walk to the Space Needle and Seattle Centre, and then a couple of minutes on the cheap and reliable monorail into downtown Seattle, which runs until 11pm. We got a cab back from downtown which was very reasonable. It's also a 10 minute walk to the trendy bars and restaurants on Mercer St - a better bet than downtown for good food and nightlife. All in all - would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic decor, delicious pool.”
Reviews.Author: dublinrock
Reviews.Content: The rooms were gorgeous, the lobby big and inviting, the pool warm and relaxing. We especially enjoyed the complimentary afternoon cupcakes and coffee as well as free, convenient parking. The location was close to or in walking distance to many sites. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome new hotel option offering excellent value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: Xntrik75
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular traveler to the Seattle area and, over the years, have gravitated toward my preferred hotel for same time now. Upon hearing of the Maxwell's opening, I thought I would give it a try and am glad that I did. It's location is ideal, just steps from Seattle Center and easy monorail access to downtown. Underground parking is free of charge, which is desirable in a city where parking comes at a premium. Rooms are exceptionally spacious given the price point, with very comfortable beds, 42" flat screen TV, fridge and microwave w/ complimentary popcorn and free WiFi. I would have preferred to have a bathtub, but the spacious shower stall with rain shower head did the trick. Toiletries and bath linens are of a good quality and generous in supply. Service was prompt and efficient throughout. At the price paid, the Maxwell offers great value for money and amongst the best bang for your buck in the Downtown/Seattle Center area. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: Zeller91
Reviews.Content: I came to Seattle for a film festival and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in such a great location, walking distance from the Seattle Center and numerous great bars and restaurants. The decorations in the hotel were very elegant and colorful. All the hotel rooms have large LCD TVs with DVD players, coffee machine, alarm clock that acts as a speaker for your MP3 player (has AUX input) and also has iPod/iPhone dock, microwave (with complimentary popcorn) and the bathrooms are quite large. I especially really liked the spacious open shower. Anytime I come to Seattle, I would definitely stay here. One thing to note, the rooms are not very quiet. Noise in the hallways carries, the doors seem to always slam, and because of the laminate floors you can sometimes hear footsteps on the floor above you. It never bothered me, but I was always quite exhausted when I went to sleep so it could be an issue for some. ust bring ear plugs if you know you are a light sleeping. The other thing is that the WiFi network does not work well with certain products (I had troubles with my iPod in certain areas of the hotel. My iPod refused to connect to the wireless service in a friends room but worked just fine in mine). In all, the positive aspects of the hotel far outweigh these minor annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and fun”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaAnne
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother and I stayed in one of the double queen rooms. How wonderful to enjoy a brand new hotel, decorated in a whimsical, colorful, modern style. Staff were excellent, the amenities fabulous, loved the walk-in shower (so big there's no need for a door) and the big flat screen TV with DVD player. Most comfortable beds of our entire trip. The prices were quite low for rooms of this quality. The free parking in attached garage, with elevator into the hotel, was a big plus. (Most hotels in downtown Seattle seem to be valet parking with 20 per night at minimum.) Location was great - easy walking to monorail, Space Needle, Experience Music Project, various theatres. I plan to stay here whenever I come to Seattle, and have already recommended it to many friends at work.

Reviews.Title: “We found our Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandInMyShoes32
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maxwell Hotel for one night on April 2/10. This is a brand new hotel and we got a fantastic rate $79.00 per night. I stayed with my boyfriend and his parents and we were very pleased when we got into the room and found it was huge. We had two queen beds and a sitting area with a pull out couch. There definately was enough room for 4 adults in this room. The decor is hip and modern, very colorful. The bathroom is very large with a spacious walk in shower. We loved all the small touches, like the microwaveable popcorn in the room and the IPOD loading dock on the clock radio. The coffee and cupcakes in the lobby are a nice touch as well. There is a small pool and gym in the hotel as well. They provide free garage parking underground (rare for a downtown hotel) although the night we stayed it was full and people were forced to park in the ramp down to the parking garage. There is also some limited free parking on the street in front of the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, providing great information about the area, where to eat, etc. And for us the location could not have been better. The hotel is a block or two from Seattle Center with the Space Needle and Experience Music Project and Key Arena all in walking distance. The only thing to note is that the floors in the room were laminate and you could hear walking in the suite above although it wasnt enough to bother us. We visit Seattle often and will definately stay at the Maxwell Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: CMC37
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Maxwell one week after it had opened. It is in a great neighbourhood close to many amenities. Gorgeous, modern decor and fabulously comfortable beds. The staff were extremely friendly. They took the time to explain how to use public transit and what sights were worth seeing. I would recommend taking ear plugs with you. The floors in the suites are laminate and you can hear people moving around above you and the noise in the halls seemed to be quite loud (banging doors, talking, etc.) Free parking was a huge bonus. We decided to leave our vehicle and did our sightseeing via bus and monorail, which was very easy and accessible. The monorail entrance is within walking distance. I highly recommend exploring the Experience Music Project and the Science Fiction Museum. The weather was not great (rainy and windy) so the two museums were a welcome break from the elements. Pike Street Market is a must see, of course. We had a wonderful time in spite of the weather!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tycoon2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maxwell with my wife and 12-year old child for a close-to-home vacation. The location of the hotel made it so easy to explore parts of Seattle with which we weren't familiar. Exploring the Queen Anne neighborhood was great, including close proximity to a "spa" for our daughter which was a nice treat. "Teatro Zinzani" is right across the street and there are many excellent restaurants within walking distance (a great grocery store too!). Key Arena and the Seattle Center is a block away as well as several of Seattle's theatrical stages. Free parking made it easy to drive somewhere and not worry about hassles when returning. The decor of the lobby and the rooms is bright and modern without being stark. Very friendly and accomodating staff. The pool may be small but it served us very well. We used the work-out room as well. Having a pool was important to us and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “First Review - Opened March 22, 2010”
Reviews.Author: pgo
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at the Maxwell for four nights during its inaugural week. The rate was a bargain, the parking and internet were free, the rooms had two queen beds and there was even a small pool, all of which are hard to find in this neighborhood. It promises to be a popular hotel with young, hip customers. The attention-seeking decor features circus colors and reflects every design fad of 2009. It's very of-the moment. The staff was well-trained and made the stay particularly pleasant. Oh, and the free coffee and cupcakes are, well, the icing on the cake.

HotelInfo.Name: The Maxwell Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 300 Roy Street, Seattle, WA 98109
